reviews.review: Great visit. We enjoyed our walks and sight-seeing in this area very much. It wasn't too crowded in April but I bet it would be in summer!

Very alive area. We stayed at a hotel in this area, and it was great. Very alive, lots of restaurants, stores, people. Only issue were the parties on the streets that went a little later than we wanted, but even then it was nice to hear such life!
Quintessential Paris. Tree lined. Great shops and restaurants. Beautiful. Buzzy and sophisticated. Wanted to buy a flat and move in straight away!
BEST LEFT BANK NEIGHBORHOOD. the best atmosphere of the left bank is found in this area------Aux Deux Magots, Cafe de Flore, Brasserie Lipp, the renowned local church........best people watching, etc
Perfect neihgborhood to just roam. I've been there three times and each time followed an entirely different route. Great restaurants, nice churches and a charming little museum, Musee Maillol

Historic and Fun!. This is the best area in Paris. The area is historic and quaint with narrow streets full of shops and cafe's. You can venture to Saint Michael square for some expansive views and tourist action or venture deep into the Latin Quarter for some historic streets with lots to do and eat. In many parts of Paris once 8PM hits, you are hard pressed to find things to do. In this area the action goes on until the wee hours of the morning. We love staying here so we are close to a lot to do at night and have close walking distance to many of the most famous Paris attractions.

great neighborhood place to stay to avoid tour busses. This is an excellent area to enjoy Paris, great cafes, resturants, shopping and just walking around the narrow streets. short walk to the river accross from the Louvre.

Make Time to Visit. On a prior trip to Paris, we overlooked this sweet neighborhood. There is lots to see, do and eat. It is easily accessible by several metro lines which allow you to explore the area on foot. The 3 cafe's we stopped in at exceeded our expectations. A walk west lands you at the Eiffel Tower!
The best location.. Stayed in a wonderful Air BnB on Rue Gozlin. Everything within walking distance that you would need.

Location, location, location!. We stayed in this neighborhood and it was absolutely perfect! We saw every corner of the city while we were in Paris and were consistently reminded of how lucky we were to have decided to stay here. This arrondissement is close to EVERYTHING: restaurants, bars, cafes, groceries, shopping, parks, tourist attractions, museums, and bakeries. Most everything is walkable from here. We walked to the Louvre, Centre Pompidou, Notre Dame, le Pont Neuf, Luxembourg Gardens, and the Latin Quarter from our apartment. For those that do not want to walk, but there are so many metro stops here that you can easily take them as well.

You must visit the elegant neighborhood!. Great after dinner walk, daytime visit as well. There is a vibrancy in the area you must experience with monuments, cafes, restaurants,and shops you are going to love.

Great shopping, great brasseries, patisseries and chocolatiers.. You can find it all in the 6th arrondissement...high-end shopping, specialty shops, casual dining, furniture showrooms. We especially enjoyed our dinner at the beautiful Ralph Lauren restaurant-Ralph's- on Blvd St Germain de Paris. Handsome place with indoor and outdoor dining, gracious and professional service, nice wine list, and "good eats".
Parisienne charm. Cultural, interesting, trendy. Great eating spots and the evenings are lively. It was on my 3rd visit to Paris and staying in this area definately made it the best by far.

Our first visit to Paris !. We stayed in Saint Germain des Pres Quarter... there was so much to see, all the little shops, cafes and restaurants. We were close to the metro. We felt safe wandering around the streets too with our 11 year old daughter.
Heart of Paris. You can start here and walk in any direction and you will see a vibrant city. Lots of Cafes and restaurants with lots of activity going on.
A fun long weekend in Paris. Next to Le Marais this is my favorite neighborhood in Paris. It is convenient to most attractions and a good area for people traveling with Children.
Great Restaurants. Great location for restaurants and bars and enjoy people watching. Take in the beauty of Paris and its people.
Gorgeous. Really enjoyed wandering the streets here. Very beautiful. Cute shops and quaint cafes. Definitely worth a trip.

Fantastic neighborhood for strolling and grazing on cafe fare. This is a neighborhood filled with cafes and a very cool vibe. We looked at but skipped Cafe Le Deux Magots as it is famous for the avant grade of the turn of the 20th century but was pricey compared to the other fine cafes.

Vibrant and Full of life!!. Simply magical and it's on the 6th arrondissement of Paris. So it's very very safe a lot of Police presence, shops, restaurants, live jazz, hotels all within walking distance. Very close to the Louvre, Notre Dame, and more. Just to sit in one of their many cafe/ bistro and simply enjoy see people walk by have a nice chat it's just an experience a true Parisian way of life.
Shopping and Cafe's. What more do you want from Paris?? Historic gorgeous street of shops and cafe's. In the heart of the Latin Quarter, it is central to so many attractions.

Walk in the steps of Hemingway and other legendary writers and artists. There is much to recommend a leisurely visit to St. Germain de Pres, including an ancient church and cafes where the the likes of Hemingway, Sartre, Simone de Beauvoir, Oscar Wilde, and others sat and talked ... and wrote. Les Deux Magots is one of them, along with Brasserie Lipp and Cafe de Flore. If you are a history buff, this is a great area to explore. No, the literary greats are no longer there, and perhaps there are more people from the fashion industry than the arts, but still, it gives some of us a thrill to think of Papa sitting at a table pondering the words he would shape into A Farewell to Arms.

Best Area of Paris. Staying in the Saint Germain area gives you a taste of a true Parisian lifestyle. This neighbourhood is close to most major attractions (Louvre/Notre Dame etc) and there are tons of cafés, independent boutiques, and chain clothing & food stores. Every time I visit Paris, I always stay in Saint Germain.

One of the best. My hotel is there, I just booked for convinience. I didn't know that it was one of the best neighborhoods but it looks very good, and the restaurants and the streets are clean and not GRAFITIES! (particularly important for me. In the 6 arred, is central and close to everything!
Full of life. This area is centred around the main road and there is an abundance of shops and restaurants. I stayed here in the Da Vinci hotel and would definitely return.

Find a Walking Tour. If you can, find a walking tour of this historic and beautiful quarter, full of gorgeous buildings and unique high-end shopping, plus a lot of good restaurants and cafes. My favorite is the charming Place de Furstemberg.

Great shopping and people watching. Yes, there are the big chains that are inescapable, but there are also many great shops with the latest fashions. Also, plenty of good cafes to sit around and watch the action.

Beautiful!! . This has to be one of my favourite places in Paris. You have beautiful buildings lining the streets and these amazing wee coffee shops all along the street. Well worth your time to have a look around here and stop in a coffee shop and have a look and just watch the world go by. Only thing is you will pay a good lot for a coffee but it's normal for the centre of Paris.

Nice area to chill out and walk around. Luved Saint Germain area. Was nice to walk around and chill out checking out the bars and restaurants. would defo recommend here if you plan on going out at night aswell for drinks

More nice version of the Quartier Latin. The former Artist and Literary district Saint-Germain-des-Pres is the chic version of theLatin Quarter. The famous cafes of this quarter above all the Cafe de Flor and the Procope met in the 20th centuries the intellectual and artists such as Pablo Picasso, Ernest Hemingway or Jean-Paul Satre. Today you will find noble cafes and restaurants as well as numerous boutiques, galleries and Antiques dealers in this quarter. In the south of Saint-Germain-des-Pres you will find with the Jardin de Luxembourg the most beautiful park of the city.

Stay in this area. Our hotel was in this arrondisement so we got to explore it quite a bit. It is beautiful and safe. I wanted to take photos of all the buildings because everything was just so beautiful!

Stunning streets, romantic walks. Such a nice area to walk around in, enjoy the romance of it all and the artistic residential buildings.
During the day there are market stalls dotted here and there with Parisian food, locals who are happy to chat with you and even offer you tastings.
My favourite Parisian district. Local, few tourists, great eateries. It's a tad expensive but it's actually better value given the local feel of the place. I love the shopping offerings in the area.
Typical Paris corner. Very exciting. Have a feeling of old Paris. No crowds of tourists. Good atmosphere and fantastic cafes.
lovely but expensive. Really lovely area, lots of much better, less touristy, bistro type restaurants but boy is it expensive!
As other parts of Paris, just amazing. Another part of Paris with its own charm and attractions, lots of shopping, local and international brands, great restaurants in the area,

Great neighborhood. We stayed just off the boulevard and walked it many times, down quite a length. It is a wonderful shopping and eating area with gorgeous buildings. It is very upscale but still very accessible.

Our favorite part of Paris. We have always stayed here. Can walk around the quarter and see many interesting things, like the historic St. Germain de Pres church. We walked to Musee d'Orsay along the Seine -- very interesting, but long walk. Notre Dame is an easy walk. Recommend visiting Rue de Buci with its shops. More commercial now, but still great shops like Carton (pastry).

Favorite Neighborhood to stay in Paris!!! . The 6th has it all!!! Wonderful restaurants, cafes, patisseries, museums,hotels ,shopping and the best people watching in Paris!! Just love it -it's so alive !! The cafes are constantly filled day and night with Parisians drinking, eating, talking and living the Parisian life! Among my favorite spots are the Rue de Buci , the small streets leading up to the Seine, like the Rue de Seine etc. And the Boulevard Saint Germain, of course, with its fantastic designer shops and boutiques and also the Carrefour de l'Odeon--right off the Boulevard Saint Germain--where there are a number of chic wonderful cafes like Le Hibou and Les Editeurs and the restaurant The Comptoir de Relais is also right there!Le Hibou is a great spot to stop and have a coffee and watch the see and be seen crowd!!

Excellent area to stay.. Loads of retaurants cafes and pubs. The meals are reasonably priced but thought the drinks were expensive. Probably due to the fact that the only choice of vodka was Grey Goose.
Favorite Paris Neighborhood . Fun active area with so many unique cafes and restaurants. Our favorite place to stay in Paris. Very active street scene.

Fabulous place to spend a few hours. Saint Germain is a great place to walk around in and enjoy the atmosphere. There are many shops and restaurants and its just lovely! If you are in the area it is a must.

Iconic neighbourhooh to visit surrounding the Abbey. Iconic neighbourhooh to visit surrounding the Abbey. This is a fantastic place to walk and visit interestic places. First of all the Abbey but also walking there in the streets and the Boulevard there are very interesting places : the house of Serge Gainsbourg for example.The Café the Fiore is in front of the Abbey and it's a must (I suggest there the Tarte Tatin). Also the Restaurant Le Deux Magots it's a must even it is a bit expensive considering what they offer.

Get lost. This quarter is a great place to meander and get lost in. Stop for a coffee and poke around the local shops - just not on a Sunday. No one told me that the retail places close on Sundays. Which sucks.

Great selection of restaurants. Some great selection of restaurants and cafe's (some are great for people watching) in this area, including the oldest one in Paris. There are also an number of designer shops so make sure you have some deep pockets for these.

Beautiful district. Saint Germain is one of the best areas in Paris.This district is cool , one of the four administrative quarters of the 6th arrondissement of Paris, France, located around the church of the former Abbey of Saint-Germain-des-Prés.Also, full with lot of restaurants, good cafes and nice atmosphere.The quarter has several famous cafés, including Les Deux Magots, Café de Flore, le Procope, and the Brasserie Lipp, and a large number of bookstores and publishing houses. Furthermore,It is good area for shopping.This area is popular and great area to meet local.100% must see.

Proper Paris!. This area is what you expect Paris to be like based on what you see in films. Hundreds of little private art galleries, lots of street cafes, expensive shops and restaurants on the main roads whilst plenty of quaint (cheap) shops and restaurants.You could spend hours walking around here looking through shop windows and stopping for the occasional coffee (or wine).
Nice city part. It is one of the typical parts of the city, lot of restaurants, nice atmosphere, real Paris people there is.

Had lunch at this restaurant and people watching.. After a couple of hours of walking tour, we finally parked ourselves in this restaurant. the food was great, server was attentive. The only thing is that the toilet is packed because it's a tourist spot.
Beautiful neighborhood. Loads of shopping, restaurants, and cafes. It's a great place to wonder the streets and live like a local. A must see!

Great places to shop and eat or drink. We stay here all the time. The area is full of great restaurants, bakeries and bars. Good grocery stores to pick-up some wine and cheese to go with you to the Eiffel Tower and sit on the grass and enjoy the view.

Feel like a local. Very nice to walk around still seeing lots of old buildings and historical monuments in the close vicinity like the Notre-Dame, Pantheon, Sorbonne and atc. Lots of shops, nice and budget eating places and witnessing everyday life.
Great Neighborhood!. This seems to be where the locals hang out to eat and shop. Many charming streets with cute cafes and markets. Really trendy, too----a really good place to people-watch!

Saint German. We stayed in this part of Paris for a weekend. The district is packed full of restaurants, shops and wonderful things to see in its' own right. It is worth a lazy trip around, to see a particularly cool cheese shop right around the corner of our hotel, Hotel Vaineau. The Metro is obviously worth the 3 day pass we bought and we'd recommend buying those and SNCF tickets at the airport for ease of travel overall..

Nice area to rent an apartment. We have stayed in this quartier for years, renting various apartments while visiting Paris. There are many short term apartment rentals in the area. Saint Germain de Près is in the 6th arr. Lots of places to shop, including Bon Marché department store, Le Grande Epicerie (connected to Bon Marché), lots of boutiques, La Poste (if you need to mail anything or purchase stamps), fresh fruit markets, several shoe repairs, neighborhood groceries stocked with fresh everything, patisseries, boulangeries and beaucoup de restaurant choices within a close area. And there are several Metro stations within the quatier.
Good for a walk around. Full of character and a good place to walk around and then sit and people walk (with a cheeky glass of wine)

Great area to base yourself. very trendy area. Many shops, cafés and restaurants. Les Deux Magots is a must do, just to sit sipping coffee where many literary and intellects mused away the day. great food, a bit expensive but worth it.
Paris shopping. Too expensive, but I usually go to the Cluny museum, which is superb for the early "Middle Ages." xx
Very Busy. Great Parisian place to vidit sit, eat and people watch. Go around all the small shops antiques or similar fascinating ...

Great area. This is a great area to be based. Right next to the Latin quarter.Plenty of cafes, restaurants and shops. Good metro access.Walking distance to a lot of attractions, eg Sorbonne, Notre Dame Cathedral, The Louvre, the euro 16 'big wheel'.
Quintisential Paris. It's everything you imagine when you think of Paris, the restaurants with sidewalk tables, the old shops, the Parisians walking to and from.
All. If I lived in Paris it would be here. Relaxed atmosphere, informal and safe. Varied shops and restaurants and clean. No seedy establishments
Tourist area but still ok. It is a very touristy area but worth a stroll. Prices of bars/restaurants make it very accessible to younger people on budget.

Beautiful area. This is a lovely area close to most of the main attractions in Paris. You have some of the oldest cafés in Paris along this strip, as well as various high-end clothing retailers to view at your leisure.
Absolutely lovely. Try to find an hotel int his quarter. Very convenient, full of attractions and excellent transportation to all the other quarters of Paris. Besides very safe and friendly.

One of the Great Paris Walks. Walking the latin quarter is a must for any Paris visit and I do it every time I get the chance. For a first time visiter, Saint Germain is an easy one to find and to enjoy. While some parts of it has become too touristy, it is still worth it, especially if you start exploring further away from the intersection with St.-Michel. One thing to do is to find a cafe and sit outside to watch people and then make it your own to return to every trip.

Good for a late night walk. The quartier is so pretty that it is worthy even just a late night out. Unfortunately we could not spent more time there. We really enjoyed the view over the lightened churches and we rested on some very nice cafes
12. Many times I have been there and definitely will go again when I am back in Paris. There is many nice restaurant, pubs, bars and just nice area to be... Go there when you'r in Paris
Great fun area. This is an extremely lovely part of Paris, lots to see, lots of bustle, shops, restaurants, beautiful architecture, a feast for your eyes!
Comfortable and interesting Walk. Walk your way back and forth. Be courageous and walk the small streets, you'll find you are walking 200+ year old small streets.

MCDONALD AT ST GERMAIN DES PRES QUARTER. Don't forget to stop by the MCDONALD at St Germain des Pres Quarter intersection Go and take a seat upstairs. Relax and looking out of the window, you'll love the street scenery. From the MCDONALD, walk downhill you'll come to ST MICHEL with all international restaurants. Perhaps you'll want to try the French sandwich, something like the US Subs, with all French fries stuffed in the sandwich.

Great food and culture!. This was one of my favorite areas of Paris. We travelled here a few times and the highlight was being there on a Friday night though it was crawling with police and other security types so it made me a little uneasy!

Loved it!. We stayed in this arondissimont for 4 nights. So much to see and do, markets and all shops close by, loads of great restaurants and things to see and do. Little lane ways are brilliant. It's a busy little hub and is excellent for nightlife too! Highly recommend staying here is you want to combine seeing the sites and partying. Loved the sense of culture and found the local people very helpful.

Historical, upscale arrondisement . I've been to Paris many times but never stayed in the 6th arrondisement. This part of the city is historic, very safe, upscale. It had many great restaurants and cafes. We were there for Xmas and it had a Xmas market in the area. I enjoyed walking the streets here and dining out. We rented an apartment which was considerably less as hotels in the Saint Germain area are pricey. We used parisianhome.com
Lovely area to walk about. This is a lovely area to stroll through & people watch from the many cafes such as Cafe de Flor & Les Deux Magots.

My favorite arrondissement to walk around in!. The cobblestone streets hiding movie theaters playing frnch films. The shops on St. Germain, the classic spots to get coffee and just hang out for hours reading or people watching...

Many places to duck into along your walk. When you think of bustling local Parisian life and of course a fair amount of tourist this is the street and area to check out. You can walk for several blocks on the Main Street or cut back a street or two and see many shops, news stands, food stands, a smaller cathedral and many cafes and other restaurants. If you're like me you'll enjoy getting small bites and drinks at a few places along the way to try to soak up as much people watching and flavor so of Paris as possible. The area feels really safe and is fairly clean. Many of the iconic cafes are within a couple hundred feet of each other, Lipp, cafe de flore , les deluxe magots and many more. I would recommend any visitor to put this area on their list.
See and be seen. I felt like I was on the Champs d elysee. It was incredible the stores and shops. Everything you could want is in this area.

Nice neighbourhood with many restaurants. Walked along St. Germaine des Pres in October 2013 en route to Luxembourg gardens. Looked at some menus at restaurants along the way. I saw a grocery store too besides a nice flower shop. Many shops. Many restaurants and shops. I decided to stop at a bakery and pick up a snack instead on my way to the gardens. This is where Ernest Hemingway lived while he was in Paris.

Nice quarter to visit with shops, restaurants and a glimpse of Parisian life. This is the quarter you want to visit on a vacation in Paris. As a Parisian myself I can tell you how much I enjoy this quarter on sunny days as you can find many places that we like to visit, shop and eat in.Don't miss it

The place for artists. Stumbled into this part of town while exploring the Latin Quarter where the ambiance was perfect for coffee lovers and writers. I've reached the point where it's oddly my favourite place in all of Paris for the millennials, artists, poets, street dwellers, and restos!
Great for a drink at night. This quarter is known for the great intellectuals that used to come and live here. It's great to have a drink at night in one of the famous bars.

The 6th Arrondissement in Paris is the quintessential Spirit of Paris for me.. Anchored in the History of Paris by the Luxembourg Garden & the Deux Magots on Blvd St Germaine & bounded by the Seine, the youthful bustle of the Universities of the 5th and the very Bourgeois 7th, are all of the galleries, high-end clothing shops, bistros, pizzareas, the lovely Place St Sulpice with the fountains and the Church whose mournful bells signal the departure of another notable, Marche Saint Germain with the latest Apple Store as the anchor tenant that make the 6th so very special to many generations of visitors as well as Parisians. It is many small commerces changing too quickly that inevitably draw everyone back to the 6th to walk through the small streets and look to see if their favorites are still there.

Take a walk through history. This neighborhood tucked away on the Left Bank is chock full of small winding streets with cafes, galleries and boutiques as well as Boulevard St. Germain with chic French brands (Louis Vuitton, Cartier, etc.). In short, something for everyone! Don't miss the Luxembourg Gardens. Beautiful setting all year round.

Another lovely face of Paris. This is a nice and chic area, especially brilliant if you need to dine on a budget, you will be spoiled with choices here!! Just be mindful that some cafes/restaurants will be overly inviting and welcoming to get your attention, and it is always OK to nicely decline if you'd like to what other lovely places this area has to offer.

For the salmon!. We really only chanced upon this place and were quite hungry. Once in and connected to WiFi was when I realised where we were. The smoked salmon was brilliant. My wife had the onion soup and loved it. The only thing I can gripe about was tables being placed way too close to each other. You could hit someone just by stretching your arm. The waiter we had wasn't very nice either and placed us at the door, but the manager then helped us out with a better table.
Nice cafe. taste of a real french cafe in a nice area of Paris where the service was good and were the service was bilingual which helped a lot.

An inviting area to stay, eat and shop. Saint Germain des Pres is a vibrant neighborhood in Paris. It is full of great bistros, shopping, galleries, hotels and life. It is fun to walk the area to take it all in. It is hard to choose where to eat and drink as there are many excellent choices. You can choose whether to sit back and relax are be part of the buzz.

Perfect place to live like a local. We decided to get an AIRBNB apartment as we were going to Paris for 12 days. St Germain the pres seemed to be the perfect place for us. And it was. We had a quaint apartment on the second floor of a walkup building. We loved the area. The Metro outside our door. Restaurants, shops, Markets all around us. The Notre Dame was a 12 minute walk we were there for the midnight celebrations for Christmas. There was a Christmas outdoor market around the church. An open market on Rue Respial on Saturday where any kind of food was available. We got a sole (fish) and some mushrooms and cheese & olives and cooked up a great meal. every street you went into was like finding new places, Art Galleries, chocolate shops, antiques.... you name it, you can find it there. we will be back
Lovely area. Great area, full of nice unique shops and restaurants. There were plenty of bars with good happy hour deals.

One of my favorite places. You'll find 2 of the most important cafés here (Flore & Les Deux Magots) as well as Lips Brasserie but you'll also find Yen, one of the better authentic Japanese restaurants as well as le Petit ZINC a super art-deco seafood restaurant. If not for dining, then walk back in time when visiting the oldest Church in Paris, or just meander down streets viewing art galleries, tea salons or mid-end shopping. Close to the Latin quarter and other ancient parts of Paris, this place (they even have Vuitton outlet) is sure to please.
The Left Bank for ever!!. Saint Germain is the place to be. The environment is superb with lovely restaurants very good hotels and such a buzz everywhere. Right Bank forget it!!

Classic Art and Literatures History Served Today with Chic Authentic Today's Paris! . Saint Germain serves chic Parisian residents - its where the French today live, eat and peruse galleries, foods, wine shoppes and more. Boutique hotels combined with ultimate specialty shoppes makes it easy to find your favorite block, shop or place to eat to return over and over. Because you develop a real sense of belonging in St Germaine - like a good fit in surroundings, hotels, coffee shops, eateries, or bistros without the heavy tourist footprint. Stay on the single lane streets and keep looking up at the Parisian shuttered windows w the iron decorative grids on each - this is the real Paris!

a herald's quarter for contemplation. As a base to stay in Paris you can lose yourself in multiple layers of quality and comfort and edge in the Latin Quarter or St Germain des Pres. On every front, food, accommodation, culture, retail therapy you won't be disappointed - and 10min walkable to the Seine through multiple laneways....relax, breathe out, enjoy those you love....whether with you or in contemplation (and gifts to take home).

Great mix of Locals and Tourists. The 6th arr is pretty even mix of locals and tourist and is a great way to see how locals live without having to go far from the city. The cafes and bars can get really busy if you are on one of the main boulevards, but if you venture down a smaller street you'll think you've left the city.
Chic yet so comfortable. If you are both sensitive and sophisticated, this is the place for you. Wonderful history, beautiful streets, so many cute shops. This is the heart of Paris.

Beautiful Saint Germain. A wonderful hotel which offered great amenities. We loved our stay here and would return in a heartbeat. Close to metro and all of the other wonderful sights Paris has to offer.
Perfect stroll for the literature geeks. It was inspiring to see where Oscar Wilde, Ernest Hemingway and others gathered and walked. Sit in their seats for a coffee.
When in Paris..... My favourite place in Paris ... fashion ...trends...people watching ...the view....friends coming and going !!!old and new...
Food folks and fun. The locals refer this as the party quarter of gay Paree. Lots of food, bars, and outsider culture are a lot of fun.
Saint Germain . It's a beautiful walk for a day out in Paris. The views are beautiful and the cafes are very cute and Parisian.
Fun area. Get off the main street which is all about stores, crowds and shopping. Fun on the side streets with little bistros and restaurants

Lunch and a stroll. We enjoyed our venture in this area. We ate lunch in a corner cafe the continued to stroll around this area of Paris. Enjoy the back streets, experience the beautiful windows and life in this area.

Loved this area. Full of little shops and gorgeous high end designer stores, this area held a lot of appeal. We were only lucky enough to spend one day there, but will definitely return to explore more. Gorgeous!

part of intellectual Paris. A lot of famous cafés (Flore...) and brasseries (restaurants like Lipp) are around; Boutique hotels, nice historical surroundings. A lot of antiques and art galleries are around. Churches and small museums to visit.

A foodie's dream to live in this area. No matter what direction you turn, there is a boulangerie, chocolatier, patisserie, cafe or fromagerie in every direction and there will be multiples of them! I remembered my first visit to Paris in 2009 and thought that I would definitely stay in this area the next time. Well, Dec 2016 rolled around and I booked in the Latin Quarter up the street off Rue Mouffetard and loved that it is still in close proximity to this area. Must visit if you want to eat your heart out!

Nice neighbourhood minus the annoying touting at the restaurants lining the side streets. The neighbourhood is a typical Parisian area which you would like to visit or the main reason you are visiting Paris. The buildings, atmosphere is very scenic and pleasant. However, please do not go during lunch time or meal times as the restaurants will start touting for your business to the extent that it becomes very off putting and annoying. Personally I like to visit a restaurant where there is no touting , are full of locals which indicates good quality food and a local flavor rather than pseudo French food that most of these restaurants claim to have. These cost restaurants can easily be found. Other than that, a nice area to wander around for about 30-60 minutes .

Best place in Paris . For me is the best area in paris! With the finest restaurants and shops. I love eating in deux magots and then to walk till I find the jardin de Luxembourg and finish till the Sorbonne.
Lots of American history.. Stop by Cafe Procope and have a drink where Benjamin Franklin stayed, while he was negotiating the Treaty of Paris, which created the United States.

superb view, location and staff. We had a woderful few nights here. The staff are all so welcoming, helpful and speak English very well. The location of the apartment is excellent within a short walking distance of many important sights. We had a wonderful large terrace equiped so we could dine on it and watch life below. Could clearly see Tour Eifel. We recommend and would stay again when next in Paris. Thank you.

LOCAL AMBIENCE. This traditional square it´s very nice, and not fully of tourists, you can find local brand stores and the big brands also, but it has a special ambience, little bistrots are great to get a coffee with specialties for food.
the Parisien place to be seen in!. dont miss a visit to Les Deux Magots and join the famous clients past&present....and its pricing for drinks isnt over-the-top.

The best place to live. A charming district with charming little shops, cafes, restaurants, bakeries. A great atmosphere in the streets.
Very worthwhile to rent a room in the 6.

My favourite Quartier. This neighbourhood feels like home away from home. Near the métro, great cafes and restaurants like Café de Flore, Alain Ducasse's chocolate palace (for the best chocolates), a church and a short walk to the Seine and Île de la Cité and Île Saint-Louis. I love it here.
Spectacular shopping available here!. This really is a place to come if you like boutiques and exclusive ranges, off the main thoroughfares in the Rive Droite. This really is the Rive Gauche!

Epitomizes Paris.. To visit Paris without visiting St Germain des Pres is like visiting London without seeing Bond Street. The beautiful 19th century buildings and boulevards are stunning and home to some of the swankiest names in retail. Add to this the ancient churches such as St Sulpice and St Germain and you have a whole morning or afternoon of pleasure in a small area. There is even a Marks and Spencer for the anglophiles! This may not be the most obvious place to visit during a stay in Paris but do consider it!
Grab a chair. A people watching Mecca , get a seat and order your drink of preference and people watch , lots of options , pleasant way to pass the day

Our home away from home. Great location. Has everything from easy access transport, walking distance to most things. Local markets, great food shops, lovely really any sort of shopping. Easy walk to Bon Marche Department store, which would have to be the best large store in Paris for both friendly helpful staff to quality of items. The food section would have to be one of the best in the world. The small restaurants and bakeries in the area are plentiful. This area is a great way to experience life in Paris
Saint getmain. Saint german des pres is the best location for calture and draem , it have many old cofes exclusivly , cafe du flore is the best cofe shop in the france.

Superb buildings, nice shops, bohemian atmosphere. Not to miss.. Getting lost in this wonderful district is equally an enchanted adventure and intellectual delight. Nice architecture, great specialty shops, papeteries, bookshops, Sorbonne, students and locals all create a unique atmosphere, quintessentially Paris.

Quirky neighborhood in the heart of Paris. My favorite to walk around and stay while in Paris. This is one of my favorite neighborhoods to stay and play in. Very safe, and lots to do and see. Walking distance to everything close by.
A must do. We love the Saint Germain area. Lots of beautiful streets to walk through with great shops. We ate at Le Procope which was terrific.

History, charme, fine dining, fashion. A great part of Paris where anyone can find something special: Old churches (Saint Germanin, Saint Sulpice, Val de Grace), the Jardin de Luxemburg and its fantastic Palace, the sumptuous Institut de France, but also bars and restaurant with charme, luxurious shops.

Shopping and Restaurants. Nice neighborhood , shopping , restaurants & coffe shops we visit Cafe Fleur, Ralphs, Cafe Louise shops like Karl Lagerfeld ( btw great service ) and more many shops a place to go loved it

This is France as You Imagined. This area was our evening haunt. It is bustling with people out for dinner or shopping for foods to take home at the various and delicious patisseries or boulangeries and every other kind of store. The difficult part of the evening is to pick a restaurant to have lunch or dinner in. The choices are endless. Just strolling in the area will wake up your appetite. Even if the weather is cool the outside seating areas are heated. This really is a must see location. If you are not hungry, stop for a hot chocolate or an espresso and stay as long as you like people watching.

So Much To Do. Bustling, busy, I think the best district at night. Sit at a cafe and have a glass of wine and watch life go by. Alive at night, just walk the streets. Slide next door to visit the Latin Quarter as well. Metro St. Michel will put you in the center of the action. Great shops, restaurants.

Lovely area to stroll and browse. This area, as all of Paris, has a lot of history, but St. Germain is well known for its literary history. However, there are plenty of other reasons to visit, such as great dining and shopping. An entire day can be spent just browsing and shopping. Park yourself at an outdoor cafe and enjoy world class people watching!

Stay here! Close to everything. We choose this area for our hotel. Its a great walk to anywhere in Paris. Clean and safe, I would stay in the area again. Everything is within a 30 min walk, with some sights only 5 mins away. Lots of great cafes and restaurants to choose from.

I love love walks in Saint Germain. A beautiful Arrondissement to stroll around for hours. The streets & buildings are divine! There are also some of the most beautiful shopping precincts in Paris. Highly recommend exploring. Some of the cafes are so incredibly beautiful inside & out.
Pleasant streets lots of cafes, excellent for ( window )shopping and evening strolls. . Pleasant streets lots of cafes, excellent for ( window )shopping and evening strolls. Also a number of cinemas.

Cool and friendly area! Must go!. That is the most touristic neighborhood I guess. Lots of shops and cafes and restaurants, souvenir shops and etc, hotels, but it is a charming area to walk around and contains many attractions nearby.
truely Paris. just the right spot to see and feel real Paris. must visit just walk around admire the people by seating in one of the cafe, drinking very small amount of coffee

Plenty of restaurants and shops. A pleasant area of Paris to visit for shops and restaurants. If you like antiques and art there are plenty of galleries in the side streets near here. The shops are expensive here.
My favorite part of Paris. I love this quartier of Paris. It is a visual feast: the buildings, the people, the shopping. It's also just perfect!
Artsy, historic. Great neighborhood located in the heart of Paris; close to everything you will want to see. Great restaurants, good metro and bus connections.
Walk walk walk. Just walk and walk every corner you turn there will be something interesting - stop at the many cafès for a coffee

A MUST DO!. I don't care who you, are this is an absolute must if you are in Paris. We just love it, each and every time we come to Paris we stay in accommodation in this area. It is fantastic for shopping and feeling like a local. Close to the Seine, galleries etc. 10/10
The best. Hands down my favorite area in Paris to stay. Great cafe's, bars, restaurants, and hotels. Old world charm. Close to many major landmarks. Great night life. I will always stay in this area.
Walkable, charming, lots of shops and restaurants.. It's hard to imagine this neighborhood in any city other than Paris. Walk, shop, eat, drink, soak in the atmosphere.
Beautiful walking area. We had lunch @ Les Deux Magots & was not disappointed! Beautiful area to walk with numerous, boutique stores & restaurants.
Real Paris!. It's charming quarter, great choice anytime of the day, there are small cafes, but my favorite is cafe de flore,it's vintage cafe, very nice and pleasant. you can feel Paris here!

The most charming Quarter in Paris. We were in Paris for 4 days and I would have been happy to stay in this Arrondissement the whole time. There are so many cafes, restaurants and sites to see you will not be short of things to entertain you.
My favorite area. Do not miss this gem of Paris. Great exploring the side streets. Antiquing at its finest. Good bar scene. Great,people,watching. Good restaurants.

Pleasant quarter. It's a charming quarter, in the second place just after Le Marais! Small cafés are averywhere and if you like shopping, there are many luxury shops and the streets are less crowded than Les Champs Elysées

You can find it here. Wonderful choices anytime of the day. In the morning, grab s coffee and croissant, walk the art galleries with the scent of oil paint in the air. Take a break and have a gelato or glass of wine. Dinner choices start at 7. Fabulous Jazz Club- Chez Papa- for dinner and wonderful music. Just gave comfy walking shoes and it's all at your fingertips.
pleasant experience. Very pleasant neighborhood for shopping (in the maze of small streets) and dining (some of the best places in Paris).

Great place for strolling and discovering cafes and little shops. This is a must go place for first time tourist. There are tons of outdoor table cafes, lots of small shops and little streets for walking. THere are no big museums around here, but worth a stroll and walking into bookshops and cafes.

Simply wonderful. We stayed 8 nights in this area in a BnB apartment, a block from Rue st Germaine near Rue Seine and Rue Buci. The area is teeming with cafes, retail shops, pastry shops, delis, markets, grocery store, art salons and more. We walked to the Louvre, d'Orsay, Seine river cruise plus. 3 metro stops within 5 minutes. There are more cafes/brasseries than we could explore in a lifetime. I can't imagine a better location for a "you are in Paris" feeling. Although we aren't shoppers, there are many high end shops, along with department stores, nearby.

Quaint neighborhood. It may not be the most popular area to visit for a casual tourist, but if it happens you end up here, there are few nice places worth visiting (churches, gardens). Some very decent food options are available as well.
Too BCBJ. Continually surprised as to how expensive and gentrified the area has become since I lived there as a student many many years ago

Best Window Shopping and Gazing of Buildings. Walk the streets early in the morning to easily window-shop without crowds. Of course, if you want to spend money, wait until the shops are open. Also, the museums and sites are beautiful. Cluny is a must.

Paris Now. This very old part of Paris is now trendy and expensive. Full of famous sites where literati once gathered, now full of tourists; however there are small very French shops and cafes nearby. We enjoyed a chocolate, cheese, and olive oil tasting at LA DIMANCHE A PARIS. You feel French. We were told it's the most expensive residential real estate in Paris. And the shopping is worth the trip.

my favourite neighbourhood in paris !. very nice for shopping, cafe and book stores ! Saint germain is so lovely, specially the place in front of the church, there was a jazz band playing, lovely cafe at famous cafe de Flore and book shopping in the library next door. Worth it to walk around, very chill and romantic. There is a smaller Laduree as well perfect for tea time and macaroons.

The real Paris. This part of Paris is a real secret, often overlooked by visitors. Together with the neighboring Latin Quarter, it best represents the best of quaint old Paris. Dining and cafe options are seemingly infinite here.
To me this is Paris. Where can you find that many cafés, restaurants, small shops, galleries, antique shops walk along Rive Gauche, central location for everything than here

This is what people think about. This is what people think about when you say Paris. Beautiful boulevards, shops, restaurants,things to see and do. Or not do and just sit in an outdoor cafe and watch the world go by. This is the reason to come to Paris.
We enjoyed a quick coffee.. An interesting area in which, unfortunately, due to a lack of time, we didn't manage to stay as long as we wanted. We just enjoyed a quick coffee.
A buzzing area. We stayed in an apartment in this area on a long weekend birthday break. We just loved the variety of the restaurants and the vibrancy of the district.

Where the Locals stay in Paris. Talked to many people who visit Paris regularly and they recommended stain in St Germain de Pres. Since it was the first time for us and we wanted to be closer to the sites we chose the other bank. But it appears that this is were the local action is with many artsy areas, near the Sorbonne and many restaurants and small streets. Very charming. Will probably stay in this area the next time we visit.

Another beautiful Parisian quarter. The area around St. Germain des Pres (and the whole 6th arrondisement) is another beautiful must-see for Paris. The whole historical center of Paris offers much to see, and this area is no exception. Whether it's old churches you're after (the legendary St. Germain des Pres, which is the burial site of many kings, and the interesting St. Sulpice, which contains works of Delacroix), or shopping activity (there is the whole Rue de Rennes), or simply wandering around without a fixed plan, be sure not to miss it.
Our go to place at the end of the day.. We were staying nearby and this was our place to get pastries, beers/wine after our tours. Lots of places to eat and shop.

Paris' best neighborhood. On the left bank, Qtr des St. Germain is chock full of little streets with shoppes, cafes, bakeries, boulangeries, patisseries, and vendors...street musicians. Just walk around awhile a enjoy the vibe with locals and visitors alike.
Always a pleasure!. One of the loveliest areas of Paris to stroll aimlessly soaking up the atmosphere. Don't miss the famous Deux Magots and a wander down the rue des Saint Peres to the river.

Fun part of Paris. BUCI. Head for BUCI street. Street players (accordian player in french sailor shirt) Such an assortment of shops, food and PAUL bakery...my personal favorite. Illy coffee store in the area.

Stayed here. We stayed In this area and loved being able to walk every where! Shopping, food and entertaining!
It was so nice to just walk and stop and sit and have a drink along the way. To sit and watch people and all the activities.
Great place to stay. Best cafes, restaurants and shopping...all within walking distance. A few blocks to the Seine. Musee d'Orsay nearby. Cafe Flore, Deux Magots, Entrecote. Perfect location.
Great area to walk. This area is quite easy to walk. Lots of window shopping, beautiful Parisian architecture to admire and plenty of places to stop for coffee or a drink. Simply delightful.

Bustling, charming and expensive. My visit to the Eglise de St. Germain des Pres was the highlight of my trip. This is the oldest church in Paris, and many original elements remain. Another attraction is the bustling square around the church, where I was told apartments have become among the costliest in the city. Never mind -- it's worth it for the charm, the history, and the famous bistros.

Revisiting old haunts. It is accessible by Metro, it is wonderfully diverse and complex and civilized in its offerings. We had stayed for several years on rue de Verneuil and it felt like home to spend time there again.
Great Shopping. Need plenty of time to wander around and shop till you drop, plenty of choice at both ends of the spectrum

Excellent walking area - ouch, it's pricey. I'll start by saying that yes, a litre bottle of Evian did cost 18 Euros - how?? The bar was on a corner on Rue d'Alma/Rapp but I can't recall the name. Opposite a Russian church. The area contains the Eiffel Tower and the Seine and has some beautiful apartment buildings. Good for a wander.

Chic area in Paris. One of our favorite areas in Paris. you feel the difference and the vibe with all the boutiques and restaurants, lots of public transport and private options too. one of the best areas in paris to stay and see all/most of the sights
High end shopping district. A lot of high end designer stores and pastry shops. If you have a chance take a guided tour of the pastry and chocolate shops in the area.
Lovely area. We really enjoyed walking around this area. Lots of lovely buildings, good shopping, and many food options. Very worth your while. Relaxing way to see Paris. Maybe a little more pricey.
where to go for coffee!. Forget the Champs Elysees, this is Paris at its best! Narrow streets, cafes (coffee and croissant at Cafe Flore), street musicians and buzz of activity.
Just walk and enjoy the atmosphere. A very lively quarter of Paris. Pleasant to walk around, stop for coffee or enjoy one of the many restaurants. A very good shopping area.

Fabulous Parisian base. We stayed in this area - perfect location. Close to everything, and lots of cafes, restaurants, bars etc. Quirky small shops & boutiques in the twisty lane ways - a surprise at every turn. Lots of small hotels, and apartments. Wouldn't stay anywhere else.

This iconic street has everything. This street is a slice of Paris - little shops, patisseries, bakeries, restaurants - great for strolling or sitting and people watching. Everything at your fingertips on this street.

Included with Paris pass bus tour. This is included with the narrated hop on hop off bus tour Paris Pass. The bus will drive through this quarter narrated in the comfort of the top of the bus. Lots of expensive boutiques and restaurants to savor.

My favourite area in Paris. I love the area, the place is vibrant. those cafes lining up the streets. so many beautiful buildings. we drove in some little streets on a motorcycle in the evening, it seems so romantic.

For anyone who wants to love Paris. How could anyone not love the Quarter? It may well be the perfect place for strolling, and for getting a feel of what Paris offers. Visit the church at St Germaine, stop for a coffee at Deux Magots, window shop, people watch, and just soak in the atmosphere. Of course there are plenty of tourists, but there are lots of little places that beckon. Don't miss it!
Nice area to visit and to stay. . Loved staying and visiting this neighborhood. It's chock full of great restaurants and fun for people watching. Near to many attractions including Notre Dame
Great for shops and restaurants. We spent 3 wonderful nights in this historic quarter and enjoyed all it has to offer. Good cafes, restaurants and shops all around. Easy Metro access to all of Paris.
So walkable. Great area of Paris to walk around. Lots of local culture to soak up. We spent a great deal of time just wandering around this area admiring the buildings and window shopping.
Europe . We stayed here very historical area. We had no idea. Transportation was difficult as the guards wouldn't allow the taxis I'd our arryismant

Charming Visit. Wow, what a convenient area to visit. Many restaurants and shops. From touristy to high end. Saturday night was filled with happy people along the pretty and narrow cobblestone streets. Wonderful smells permeated the air.
Loved Staying Here. We loved staying in Saint Germain des Pres. It is walking distance to much of Paris. We felt we were living in a neighborhood, not just hotel guests.

A place to while away the hours. A lovely area to visit, lots to see and do, both shopping and sight seeing. We get the bus there and spend hours walking the streets, looking at the architecture, having lunch, lots of restaurants, however many are exspensive and the food is not necessarily that good. Recommend a visit to this area.
Very Parisian neighborhood. We walk thhe beautiful Saint German des Pres at night and was such an amazing experience, a lot cafes, bars and restaurants. Really beautiful Paris quarter.
Plenty of choices of places to eat. This area was abuzz with restaurants ranging from French to Chinese to Greek, plenty of choices, you will not go hungry around this quarter

So quaint. Such a quaint and lovely neighbourhood, my wife and I strolled around for hours enjoying the architecture and stopped to enjoy a glass of wine at one of the outdoor cafes. This area is conveniently located near all of the major attractions in Paris.

Center of great food!. This location is great with easy access to transportation, trains and so many restaurants and shops. It is like being in the center of Paris. It is close to Notre Dame and the Louvre.

جده السعوديه. منطقه باريس القديمة منطقه فريدة. بها شوارع وازقه رائعه المشي بها متعه والتسوق كما يوجد بها مطاعم متنوعة الباريسي الأصيل والاستيك والمكرونة والمقاهي الفريدة جلسات شاعريه ورومانسية بالليل لها طعم وبالنهار لها طعم اخرلا يفوتكم المرور بهاذه المنطقه التاريخية كما انها منطقه تسوق للهدايا ذات المجسمات التي تزين باريسوأسعارها جدا معقوله ويمكن الوصول لها بسهوله بواسطهً المتروOld Paris area unique area. The streets and alleys of wonderful walking and shopping with fun and there are a variety of restaurants and authentic Parisian steaks and pastaUnique and cafes sessions poetic and romanticA taste of night and during the day have another tasteDo not miss the traffic Bhazh historic districtIt's also a shopping area for gifts of sculptures that adorn ParisAnd very reasonable pricesAnd you can access them easily by metro

Great area lots to do foody heaven. This is the second time we have stayed in this part of Paris and it gets better every time. Its has real character masses of charm with its slightly smaller streets and quirky shops and eateries but still some of the great pieces (the Pantheon, St Suplice..and so on) Loads of good eateries and bars
Charming, vibrant. Upscale, great bistros etc. Shopping abound. Walking is easy and the buildings are lovely.Give it a shot on a nice day.

Ah, the variety and the history and the food and the ambiance. Home of the mysterious Maison de Verre, as well as the Procope very old restaurant, and much window shopping. W recommend the Hotl des Saints-Peres in this area.
exclusive shops, cafes and restaurants. A must to take in the real Parisian atmosphere, visit some of the shops, but the real expensive ones have locked doors and qualify you first.

The perfect home base in Paris. We stayed at the Hotel Dauphine in this area and based our stay around the area. So many amazing places to eat, easy metro access, and the ability to walk to the majority of the city's sites make this an ideal location. We did not have a bad meal in this area and it was very safe to walk through at night.

Budget Tourists, Keep on Moving. Saint-Germain-des-Pres is a beautiful part of town. A Parisian knows this as well as any tourist, and that's probably why some of the wealthiest Parisians and expatriates choose to live here. You'll notice a wide selection of expensive shops and upscale bakeries. You'll also notice the natives looking you up and down, quite a bit. This was the only place in Paris I had a stranger on the street randomly say something rude to me (for NO reason). She said it to me in English, and I wish I had the sense to reply in English. Instead, like a good tourist, I tried to reply in French, and was only able to eek out a weak and passive-agressive "Merci" before she scurried into the crowd. And around the more famous areas there are crowds. I used to have some romantic sentiment for this area, but in the future I will likely avoid it.

Nothing much to do. Its quite happening place. We wasted out 2-3 hours but finds nothing apart from hotels and restaurants. tested wine in couple of restaurants. I will suggest to avoid visiting this place if you are on short trip

Saint Germain Quarter. Great place to find cheap restaurants that have three course set menus for 10 euros.
Good atmosphere in the evenings and plenty of souvenir shops open late.
Also good for daytime shopping. Cobblestone streets so wear comfy shoes.

Great place to stay while in Paris. While in Paris for a week, we rented an apartment in the Saint-Germain-des-Pres area (6th arrondisement). This was an excellent area to stay in. Lots to see and do in that area, but also convenient to get to various other areas of Paris.From our apartment, we had 2 different Metro stations, on different lines, within a two block walk (Saint-Germain-des-Pres station on line 4 and Mabillion on line 10. With those two options, we could go nearly anywhere within Paris, either directly or via transfer to another line (or to the RER). Within the Saint-Germain-des-Pres area, we mostly walked (there are many different shops and restaurants within walking distance) or, for points a little further (or if we were very tired) took the Metro.Some of the places to see in Saint-Germain-des-Pres include Jardin du Luxembourg, Eglise de Saint-Suplice, Eglise de Saint-Germain-des-Pres, Musee Delacroix, and more. Shopping options inclue La Grand Epicerie de Paris / Le Bon Marche along with many different options for clothes, shoes, lingerie, chocolates, macarons, pastries, and much more.Just a couple of the many dining options in the quartier include Restaurant Allard and Bistrot d'Henri.If you pick the right spot to stay in Saint-Germain-des-Pres, you can find yourself in a quiet tranquil oasis in the middle of Paris, but just one or two blocks walk to the hustle and bustle of the quartier! I highly recommend this area as a place to stay within Paris, but even if you stay elsewhere, be sure to come check out the shops and restaurants.

Historic street. Eglise StGermain-des-Pres, Deux Magot cafe Flore, Cafes, Restaurants around every corner; this is what's in store for you in this area. A more leisurely pace is evident here than in other parts of Paris. Stroll to the art galleries and the river and discover charming parks tucked away for your edification. Luxembourg Gardens, Notre Dame...it goes on and on. A treat in store for you.
Cozy neighborhood. This neighborhood is surrounded by so many historical building and beautiful classic construction in every corner of the street!
Lively area. This area is very nice with many shops and restaurants. Be sure and go through the narrow streets near the Seine where there are many food vendors.

A Great View of Parisian Life . I recommend strolling the Boulevard Saint Germaine des Pres early on a weekend morning. Walk from Rue Bonaparte to the area near the Orsay Museum and back. You will pass countless clothing boutiques, interior design stores, brasseries and bistros. Be sure to look up to view the architectural features of the buildings. Then come back in the early evening for supper, stroll the side streets and watch the "see and be seen" crowd move in for cocktails and snacks. Expect crowds. Great people watching.

This is the Paris I prefer. Close from louvre notre dame, historical district with universities school of art and art galeries designers .... became very touristic but charm still there. Many bars and restaurant where you can enjoy cheerful terrasse with good wine and simple and good food
Great area. Great little area, loads of different food options and well away from the pushy North African salesmen who frequent the more touristy areas.

Saints Germaine des Pres. Love the neighborhood. It's alive with locals and visitors. Great active and interesting mix of boutiques, galleries and restaurants. I always feel comfortable and safe. The famous, Les Deux Magots is a popular cafe to take a coffee and watch everyone pass by.

Great area for food shopping & more. In a relatively small area you can find excellent bread, macaroons, chocolate and cheese on top of a number of cafes & restaurants. Not as crowded as other areas of Paris

Elegance personified. In Kansas city we have the Plaza. NYC has Madison Avenue, Beverly Hills has Rodeo Drive and Paris has Ste. G des Pres. The huge abbey church is a good stop but it's the shopping and restaurants that usually attract people If you have unlimited credit card balances, you'll be in heaven

Great neighborhood for eating, shopping and staying. I love staying in Saint Germain and using it as my "base" for exploring the sights of Paris. It is a safe, easy to navigate neighborhood with great hotels, shops and restaurants. It provides easy access to many of the places one likes to see while in this beautiful city.

First Visit...need to return. I have been wanting to come to this area to walk around ever since I started traveling to Paris. I arrived after shops closed and only had time for dinner (Brasserie O'Neil...check it out). I MUST come back as it appears to be a very cool part of town to explore.
My Favourite Quarter. It's the best quarter to be in. Historic, classic and perfectly situated, it's nice to be among the locals.

Parisian Chic. If you want to feel like a glamorous Parisien(ne), head to St Germain des Pres on your bike on a Sunday afternoon and plonk yourself down on the terrace of one of its many bustling brasseries and order yourself lunch and a coffee and watch the world go by. If you fancy, you can then cycle up to the Sorbonne, past the Jardin de Luxembourg, down to Notre Dame or across to the Louvre and up the Champs-Elysees! A fab spot to take in the grandeur of the city!
Took a food toour. great location for a food tou, cheese shop, cream puff, tartine, chocalate -all at small local shops. Great location for coffee and boutique shopping

We stayed in this area. This is a great are to stay in. Lots of metro stop that get you everywhere. Its kind of central. Be aware that the nightlife is active here so if you stay here it gets loud at night.

Walking in Saint Germain. Our first stop in France was Saint Germain and it didn't disappoint. Loved spending time in Saint Germain church, shopping the flea market, listening to music being played by street artist, beautiful sunshine and low temps made it magical.
Walking chocolate and patisserie tour. Tiring but deliciously a great way to see this very affluent area the tastings were amazing and Melissa our guide very knowledgeable

Upper- class area to walk and shop. We liked the solid buildings built in the previous centuries. There are a lot of antique stores, boutiques,brand names stores, and designer furniture. The walk felt safe and quiet. It was a pleasure to observe the architecture and the people.
great shopping area. Stopped at Les Deux Margots on walk from Musee Cluny to Musee d'Orsay, Now icing my feet!!! But it was fun... mostly windo shopping. Try going down Rue Jacob for smaller shops.

One of the best shopping areas. When on the left bank, walk down rue Saint Germain is a must, but be sure to venture off and get into the side streets for some excellent boutique shopping. Great choices for restaurants - some traditional and some new/trendy bistros.

Love!. This was my second visit to Paris, and after spending time on both sides of the bank, I much prefer the more laid back atmosphere of the left bank, especially the Saint Germain des Pres Quarter. The narrow, cobble stone streets, art galleries, boutiques, and cafes are amazing!

the place to be in Paris. This Quarter of Paris (6th arrondisment) is the quarter very people live, - lot of students and artists. - lot of small restaurants and bars left and right of Boulevard St. Michel
Amazing neighborhood. This was one of my favorite neighborhoods at the walk around Paris. There are tons of shops, restaurants, cafes, and bars. Great pastry shops throughout the area as well.

Great Place!. Loved walking around this area and sitting in the cafes watching the world go by! It's not as busy and not as expensive as other areas so a leisurely pace of walking around is the key here!
People watching and restaurants . This is a fun section of Paris. Tons of cafes to sit outside and eat. Lots of the normal souvenir shops too. Easy aces to metro and buses.

Cafes, art galleries and clothe shops.. saint Germain de Prés is a very lively neighborhood. The ambiance is very specific. Lots of (too expensive) cafes, great art galleries (around rue de seine), hundreds if cloths shops ( all types and prices). Make sure not to get trapped in a mass tourism restaurant.

Posh Area!. We saw this area from our open top bus & although we didn't alight & walk around, it did look a very nice area indeed & we will go back & spend more time here next time we are in Paris. This area is in the fashionable 'left bank' area of the city & close to the famous Sorbonne university.
Our favorite area. We love this area of town, so many places waiting to be discovered. One of our favorite bars (le fer de cheval) is here, super cute bar.

Great place to wander. I just love this part of Paris, fab patisserie (Gerard Mulot in Rue du Seine) fab shops, fab cafes and just a really nice local atmosphere. Its not really too touristy but has lots of nice small boutiques and small streets to wander along aimlessly and watch the world go by.

Nostalgia and Resonance. St Germain des Pres has inspired famous intellectuals philosophers and artists from Jean Paul Sartre to Giacometti to Chopin or American Jazz players.
The Church hosts wonderful classic concerts not to be missed.
Fun quarter, lots to see and eat. this is a great place to visit and have lunch. we loved all the character, and the spots near the Sorbonne. Full of life and students.
Lots to do. Good neighborhood for art and boutiques. Lots of restaurants and loads of tourist. First time I have seen panhandlers in this area.

Loved this area. This was my first time staying in this area and I loved it. There were plenty of restaurants and cafes here and the location was convenient for seeing the Louvre, Notre Dame (and cute park across the street), St Sulpice and Luxembourg Gardens. We did not have time to visit the Orsay, but it is also nearby.

Great area to explore. Depending on your choice of hotel, there is a chance you may end up walking through this area a few times on your way to many of Paris's attractions. Clearly the church is quite iconic and the architecture is amazing, and the many eateries will give you plenty of mid-end choices if you fancy a meal here. There are many retail outlets in the area as well that range from great value to great debt but overall a terrific place to explore. Although I wouldn't put this on the "must see" list in Paris, be sure to spend about half hour walking around if you intend to pass through.
Busy but interesting.. Lots of cafes/restaurants and small shops, interesting architecture, lots of people and traffic, but a great atmosphere.

Left bank. This area comes alive at night with street theatre including buskers and acrobats. There are numerous bistros and shellfish are a specialty. It is convenient and we walked to the Champs and the Eiffel Tower. There are metros everywhere.

Skip the lines at the Notre dam and spend time here . Although this isn't half as famous as the Notre Dam but it isn't bad either. If you want to spend time at a peaceful church, this is a good option and not very far.
Loads of atmosphere. Head down here the feels the atmosphere of Paris, great food outlets, excellent shopping and a great collection of doors along the streets.

Where all the Philosophers and thinkers used to live. This is one of the most popular parts of Paris as this is where many philosophers, artists and poets used to live. Some of Paris´ most popular restaurants such as Cafe de la Flore or Relais de L'entrecote are found here.

old town. if you like long walks to explore hidden treasures head yi saint germain area.
plenty of shopping boutiques, some world famous brands have boutiques over there. even ralph lauren has a nice restaurant in the area.
also many famous historic cafes still operate there.

Great paris sighseeing. If you like the West Village in NYC. This is beyond, you have the Luxemburg gardens, the Saint German des pres church, and on Saturdays Jazz performances on square. If you like skincare and cosmetics go to rue du four to citypharma to stock up on french pharmacy skincare and makeup products, its cheaper than back home, they sell value packs and have good prices.

Unquestionably one of the best neighbourhoods in Paris!. This area has so much history and the as trees are lively, both day and nighttime. You feel safe in this area walking freely. Some other areas at night, you must be on vigilance. Get an apartment in this area and it will quickly become your favourite. You're within walking distance to just about all the best sights Paris has to offer.

Best neighborhood in paris. St Germaine has the shops, the metro, the location and good hotels. There even is a walking tour of the St Germaine district pointing out all the many historic sites. The tour starts in front of the Notre Dame and ends at the Pres St Germaine church. I think DiscoveryWalks does the tour. It is excellent. The bistros around the area are the best in Paris and are only a block or two from our favorite hotel Madison.

Enjoyed my third time staying in this quarter. Multiple trips to this fascinating city have found me selecting lodging in the Saint Germain des Pres Quarter three times. It is centrally located, has enough "tourist" services and benefits but also has a local feel to some of its side streets and shops. In three different hotels in the area, we were about 15 minutes walk to Notre Dame, the Louvre, and other nearby attractions. It felt very safe, especially this trip when there was a noticeable presence of armed guards patrolling the streets, particularly near the attractions. Metro and bus stops are strategically located for ease in transportation to other parts of the city. When I return again to Paris, I will more than likely return to Saint Germain des Pres for my accommodations and as a convenient location for exploring the remainder of the city.

Still the best. As a student many moons ago, this was not a very chic or expensive area but, my, how things have changed! Still the best place to be and it needn't cost an arm and two legs if you speak a bit of French, stay off the main drags and choose the smaller restaurants. The entire area is great for walking and getting "lost". Put an app on your phone such as Ulmon Paris and follow it

We like the area. We met regularly in this area with friends. Danton cafe is the place where we start to go to places from here. This time we went to the Odeon square and theatre. Although the place and the cafe are nearly empty because Paris is nearly empty of its residents in August, but the area and the square are so beautiful and the nicety of the area and proximity to many destinations like Saint Sulpice, the French quarter and the Luxembourg gardens makes this area a rare place to visit. This is nearly the heart of Paris. You can walk to so many destinations of interest!
CAFE SCENE. Café scene eating and drinking watching the world go by in old style part of Paris, beautiful colourful, flowers everywhere,
Quaint and beautiful. Our favourite place in Paris. Within walking distance of most of paris's famous attractions defiantly our favourite area to stay

Recommend- stay there. Recommend this area. Period.
Chic, classic, cleaner than other quarters.
Many and diversified shops, art, fashion (boutique style)
I enjoyed a hotel there, was great, recommend it also if you like to have good time in late night cafes, bars, jazz etc
Alive!. This is a boheme plenty of life neigborhood were you can walk, eat and sleep, well conected by metro service.
Posh Paris :). This is the most posh areas of Paris...clean and tidy with expensive shopping (all the designer shops are there). Loved the vibe though!!!

You must . There are some places in paris is just typic
This area with super cafes, super shops, super walking areas
Yes you must go and you need full day
Specially at night nice jazz clubs, and nice resturants which servs local food

Many shops closed on Sunday . I enjoyed walking in the area but was disappointed to find many of the shops are closed on Sunday, so I didn't get a chance to shop as intended. Just used to our Sunday shopping opportunities here in Toronto so didn't even think about it. Nice cafes. Nice atmosphere. Beautiful cobblestone streets. Plan ahead so you don't miss the shops as I did.
Quite place. Nice quite place every good for breakfast, where you are closed my many sightseeing after that.I liked it

Wonderful area. We are staying here at the moment and we love the area. Lots of cafes, restaurants and shops. Music by night and a great place to people watch. This is an expensive area to eat and drink but a must if you are visiting Paris.

This is a cool neighborhood.. Great place to spend the afternoon checking out the shops and the restos. Have a wine in a bistro or a cold one and watch the traffic, meaning the pedestrians, and enjoy the afternoon.Great even in the rain under an awning.Note: Pricey area, just off Metro 4.

Elegant. We stayed on the western edge of Saint Germain des Pres and walked through it every day. We loved the high end kitchen design and decor stores. It is a quiet neighborhood, elegant. We're happy we stayed here and will come back. Great bistros.

Nice village. I felt very safe in this quaint night spot of Paris and met a lot of fun people. We took a tour with Anto's Paris and had Carina as our hostess. She took us to several places here that were so much fun. Rouge ou blanc, Little temple bar, Tiger, Eden Park were some of them. Please book them for a fun safe evening on the town

Buzzing place. This place is always buzzing. Enjoyed walking around the streets and plenty of restaurants to choose from. Walking distance to Notre Dame. Well worth walking around and soaking in the experience

Paris Walks on Thursdays. A walking tour.. Walking tours in English. No reservations needed. 2 hours, and you will enjoy every minute. Rain or Shine. 15 Euro. Excellent guides take you in and around this wonderful area.
sweet promenade.. small streets, nice cozy cafés and brasseries -- all warmly inviting. Its very lively area but not loud or aggressive.
Great Area in Paris. Just loved the blend of history, restaurants and architecture, true Paris experience. The metro makes it easy to move to other parts of the city

A lively Parisian discrit. Saint Germain des Près is one of my Parisian favorite place. I did study there about 25 years ago, and though over the years the place slowly shifted from its historic nickname "Latin Quarter" to a hype place attracting healthy tourists, it has not lost all its charms.To enjoy the genuine spirit of the place, do not hesitate to stray from the mainstream boulevards (Saint Germain des Prés, Saint Michel, ...) and to get lost in the small neighbouring streets, or on the banks of the Seine River.Very refreshing, lively all year long, and now hosts loads of artists galleries.A must-go place

Indulgece does not come cheap unless you really look, but that is the point.!. An easy area to walk around-good metro service,but turn off the main road and explore to find the hidden gems.Some great hotel-Bel Ami,Arthus etc and wonderful restaurants,but avoid those on the main road with a couple of exceptions.Lots of small independent shops selling jewellery,home wear etc and some great chocolate shops and patisseries.Note though many close in August so lots of dark windows..
Great part of paris. This is perhaps the best part to base a trip to Paris, hotels, restaurants and handy walking distances to Notre Dame, The Louvre.
Cool St Germain. Chic part of town full of up market shops and excellent variety of restaurants. Great place to choose a hotel.

Our stay.. We stayed in an apartment in this area for a week and came to love the feel of Paris. Restaurants every where you turn,close to the tourist spots of the Louvre,Notre Dame and other major museums and gardens this area cannot be beaten.The hop on/ hop off bus also travels down and stops in the Rue de Saint Germain. A lovely place to stay and visit.
nice place for walking. many cafes and resturants. wonderful buildings style.you must visit specially in the afternoon time

Fun, fun, fun place to hang out and people watch. We've been here for about a week and we've been up and down this Boulevard. We like the O'Deon area the best because a lot of roads converge together there. There are tons of restaurants, serving local fair up to very expensive, fancy restaurants. You can throw an eclair from one patisserie to another one. It's quite funny. And there is no shortage of shopping, both small local boutiques to major chains. But the best part it, the people watching. That is the best. So, come and enjoy!

Have a drink in the Les Deux Magots. Sit on the terrace and you can almost imagine Hemingway, Sartre, etc being there. You can watch the elegant Parisians walking by and then go explore the area whuch has lovely architecture and interesting little shops and bakeries.

Must see in Paris!. Another wonderful area to spend the day walking around and experiencing, Paris has so many areas with different personalities. We really enjoyed the shops and cafes in this area. Wonderful food with great wine bars!!

loved it. We got here the last day we spent in Paris and I wish I had gone here earlier..... I liked the style of this area and even went inside the church. (right off the metro station) and we enjoyed our time here, you can walk for a while the shops are nice and so are the bars and restaurants around here.

The Place to Stay in Paris!. My 14 year old daughter and I rented an apartment in the St. Germain des Pres area of Paris and we were not disappointed. This section of Paris is filled with Brasseries, Cafes, restaurants, unique little shops right on up to stores such as Louis Vuitton....It would have been very easy for us to spend our entire 10 days in Paris in St. Germain and never leave although of course we made to enjoy all of Paris! St. Germain is loaded with character with its ornate building fronts and doorways right through the people! If you don't stay right in St. Germain de Pres, be sure to at least spend a half or full day taking in the sights and spending some time wandering around the streets!
Family visit to Paris!. So glad we chose our hotel in this location! So close to Metro, restaurants, St. Sulpice, and Luxembourg gardens.

You don't have complete food experiences till visiting these brasseries. Fabulous food in these admittedly touristy places once the haunts of Hemingway and Sartre. Cafe Florence and deux magots. Be sure to visit the church for which the area is named.
Shopping and sites - what a combination. Fun and lively without being overcrowded and touristy. Loved this area for the diversity of interesting things to do.

Lovely area. This is one of the nicest areas of Paris. During our recent stay in Paris we came by this area several times. In fact we always come by here whenever we visit Paris. There are lots of shops to lose yourself in and plenty of great cafes and restaurants. There is fantastic atmosphere at any time of the day or evening.

Another of my favourite places in Paris. Get a bike and cycle round the lovely little streets and stop off at bars hidden away for a not too pricey drink.The main drag is very expensive but off the streets is much better.Lovely bars and restaurants

This is the place to stay. A great part of Paris just south of the river and close by practically everything. Quaint cobble stone alleys with lots of galleries, shops, bars and restaurants. Even if you don't stay there, certainly spend at least a half a day walking around, drking a wine in a road side cafe and just watch the world go by.

Gotta love the history,the vibe and the essence of Paris here.
