Take a step back in time to the left Bank, plonk yourself at one of the many cafes and sip coffee and watch the world of the quarter go by.Many of the cafes in the area were haunted by Picasso, Sartre, Joyce and more. It was THE place to be years ago and still has a vibe and feeling of something unique and special. Like so many places in Paris, it's the time you just observe. You just sit and be. Watch. Breathe. Enjoy.If you want to know what Paris was like in the early 20th century - come here.
so much to see. lovely streets you can just walk by and enjoy the view. all around you can find a great spot to have drinks\buy chocolate or patisserie. I just loved it.

I love this lively quarter.. Got to the corner of Blvd. St Germain des Pres just as the brass jazz band was finishing up "When the Saints...." We loved the little bookstore very close to the Cafe de Flores where we ate supper. I wanted to eat at this cafe because it's where Sarte, de Beauvoir and other French intellectuals hung out. Food was fine, a bit expensive. We ate outside to participate in the French cafe culture, but the history is inside, so check that out.
shop till you drop!. Sales are all over and it's the best time to wander the streets and pick up bargains on your favorite designers!

Picturesque. My husband and I along with other seniors were on tour in Paris before going on the river cruise of the Seine. This was one of our photo ops and it was very picturesque. We all enjoyed seeing the sites and recommend it highly to all visitors. Even if you are on limited time as we were here for only three days, take a few minutes to photograph the historical sites. We did and we are have the most amazing pictures.
Great shopping and lovely walking!. We enjoyed walking and shopping in this area! So many unique as well as known stores -- it's just lovely! Plenty of restaurants and options to eat, too!
Make your way to this part of town. It was a nice walk on Bastille Day and we made it here. The cafes are bustling, the shopping is good.
Lively corner of Paris. Although it has all of the amenities a tourist could need, this neighbourhood felt authentic and was always busy with locals when we were out.

Hang out with Ernest Hemingway. Relive the glory days of the Left Bank, as you sip cafe in Les Cloiserie des Lilas or tea at Le Select. All of these legendary cafes saw the likes of James Joyce and Pablo Picasso, Jean Paul Sartre and Danny the Red. Imagine Jean Cocteau's famous Black and White parties, or F. Scott Fitzgerald's wife Zelda giving a ballet recital. This is the place to absorb that magical atmosphere of 20th century Paris.

Chic and Charming!. We made the best decision by staying in this part of Paris, it is truly a delight to wake up to the sights and sounds everyday on a holiday here. There is so much to explore in the little lanes of this quarter, with the best eateries and small galleries and lots of shops. The quarter has also been home to many artists, musicians, and writers. It also touches the river Seine, thus making it a pleasure to explore on foot or cycle. If you would like to enjoy Paris without being too close to the heavy tourist crowd, you must choose to stay here in one of the many plush hotels or cute B&B's.

History-filled restaurants and cafes. Taking a stroll around St-Germain is enjoyable in itself. Eating in century-old restaurants like Lipps or mythical cafes like Café de Flore just adds to the overal experience. Shops are very high end (excessive in my view, as I'm not in the habit of paying 300€ for a pair of shorts...), but if this is your thing, you'll find some really nice items. Otherwise, this is a nice place for eating out and just walking around.

A great area to stay in Paris. This is a great area to stay in Paris. Its affordable with great restaurants on every corner. A good location for getting to most of the sights and I highly recommend it for both young and old.

A must do in Paris. Get a map and wear comfortable shoes. Walk and explore. Get lost. Walk into interesting historical sites, independent shops and stop at a streetside cafe for refreshments and people watching. A great area of Paris for shopping and exploring.

Lots of restaurants and galleries. If you like restaurants and galleries, St Germain is where you should be. Its a very lively quarter and you are never short of somewhere to eat or to just sit and have a drink and watch the world go by. Never seen so many galleries (most of them tiny) in one place. St Germain is not really a shoppers paradise though if thats what you are interested in.
A place to walk. Saint Germain des Pres quarter is a nice place to take a morning or afternoon stroller with friends or family on a nice day...
Safe Classic Paris. In this day and time-safe for a family is valued. In 2 weeks in Paris-I thought this was safest area. Excellent restaurants and shopping. Perfect for Air bnb.

A lovely area to wander about and explore. A lovely area to wander about and explore - aren't so many in this beautiful city?! Great for shopping, people watching and to grab a meal. Go without a plan and see where your feet carry you. There's always something to see behind an unexpected doorway or down a less busy side street.
St. Germain is Quintessential Paris!. Wonderful boutiques, cafes, bistros and history. St. Germain des Pres is made for strolling. Don't miss this Paris district.

Not the St Germain of the sixties. No way!. Now full of expensive boutiques and silent streets. In the Old Days (fifties, sixties) it was full of Jazz and Life and Hippies and FUN. Now its DULL DULL DULL

Something new around every cornerbbb. Beautiful buildings, shops, cafes and galleries. There is something for everyone. There are lots of great restaurants too but this area can be a bit pricier than most others.
The bookstores are great!

Paris nightlife with the locals. When you're in Paris check out Saint Germaine de Pres Quarter for a fun evening with local Parisians. Many good restaurants, bars, gelato shop, etc. The outdoor cafes are lively & hip with street musicians & some local Jazz band playing cool retro Jazz to sip your Champagne, fruit Mojito or favorite beer.

Stunning neighbourhood in Paris. I didn't actually realise I was in this area of Paris. I had just finished breakfast and was wandering around the area looking for a Metro, following the stunning buildings that are everywhere, when I saw Les Deux Magots and thought, oh that's familiar, that's where I am! An absolute must for just wandering around at a leisurely pace. Even better, Sunday morning at 10.30am, nobody is around. It's stunning.

Lively & beautiful neighborhood.... We loved our stay in St Germain. We'd read it was a lively & centrally located neighborhood & it lived up to its reputation. Tonnes of cafes, kebab & falafel stores, delicious pastry shops, live bands performing on the streets. Close to many of the famous Paris landmarks, such as Notre Dame & St Chapelle. A feast for all the senses. Don't skip a stop at Amorino for ice cream or Maoz for falafel! Eric Kayser & Patisserie Paul for bread & pastries! Highly recommend this area.

One of my favorite quarters to peruse!. Saint Gemain des Pres is one of Paris' treasures. It's quite possibly the best quarter to stroll about and get lost in. I've stumbled into some of the best moments here - jazz bands on corners, amazing little shops, fabulous restaurants on tucked away streets and some of the best big name shops - Louis Vuitton, Burberry, Creed, etc. Day or night, take a walk through and see what you can discover!

The best place in Paris. St Germain is my favorite place in Paris. Great restaurants, great atmosphere. You are sure to enjoy every minute of it. If you are a literature or a music buff, you are sure to find a place where a famous author or musician spent time. This is part of the magic of Paris. The more you delve into its history, the more you get attached to St Germain.

Please please please make sure you stay here when in Paris. This is the most historic and beautiful, while also being the most chic and modern, part of Paris in terms of foodies culture as well. Amazing food choices everywhere Le Hibou, Margherita, Cafe Flore, Les Dous Magots... you cant go wrong with any of them.I wont be staying anywhere else when I come back to this amazing city.

Life on the Left Bank. By happenstance, I booked a hotel right down the street from La Deaux Maggot... The food was excellent. Not far is the church of San Sulpice, a must see if you are a Da Vinci Code fan...
My favorite area of Paris. This is a great neighborhood with all of its lovely shops, restaurants, bistros and patisseries. Art galleries and antique shops are tucked in everywhere.

In my opinion the place to be in Paris. Great restaurants and atmosphere and close to everything you want to see other than the Eiffel tower but that an easy Train ride. I wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Lively Area!. Saint Germain des Pres Quarter is a lovely district of Paris. It has many restaurants and cafes, and is also home to Notra Dame. The Seine River flows across here, and the bridges are nice and wide to stand and enjoy the views. I spent a couple of hours just walking around here. I took a break to enjoy a delicious nutella crepe from a tiny little corner shop. This area is charming. Do visit!

Our home away from home. we love staying in this area as it is open late and you can find great food for a great price as well as fancy food and fancy atmosphere..something for everyone including the kids

Very nice, but not quite as nice as Latin Quarter. Close to the museums (Louvre & d'Orsay) and a nice place for dinner and drinks after dark. But I'd recommend walking a mile east into Latin Quarter. Better yet, book your room in Latin Quarter.

A little piece of santuary and quality in a changing Paris!. Having visited Paris many times it was difficult not to notice how much more graffiti there seems to be and rubbish in the streets but as soon as we entered this Quarter everything changed!It was very clean and inspirational for a walk around on a lovely sunny Sunday lunchtime.It has a quality feel and an air of sophistication which was in stark contrast unfortunately to a lot of the over-commercialised usual tourist spots.A beautiful area to visit and one that still makes Paris truly a great capital!
Oh Yes! You know you are in this romantic city!. Fabulous cafes and restaurants and altogether an awesome experience just walking around the Saint Germain district!

Best and safest area to stay in. wonderful area to walk around, plenty of restos, cafes and great shopping. This is a great area to start a walking tour in, walk down st. Germain to Michel turn left towards water and go towards Notre Dame, visit le Marais, Palais Royal and start walking Rivoli towards Place de la Concorde to end up walking Champs Elysee

Charming Place. allez vous promener vers le château médiéval et laissez vous envouter par l'atmosphère des universités comme la SorbonneYou have to visit all these parts, it 's amazing!!! I m very found off of this part
Charming place. Its a very fancy "quartier" in the center of Paris, many places to go. The restaurants may be a little bit expensive but most of the are worth the cost.
Great . Wonderful part of Paris. Lots of restaurants and stores, very walkable. Plenty of hotels to choose from too. Would highly recommend

Love this area of Paris . Great area with a neighborhood feel, I love all the little shops and bistro's. There's also an open air market on St. Michel that is open quite a lot for fresh fruits and vegetables.

Walking around. It is amazing place full of so many opportunities to watch people, eat, drink and discover not only stores but architecture and the small streets of this neighborhood, one of my favorite in Paris

Love it!. I love this area! Place is so vibrant and little pockets of sanity everywhere for coffee and food. It's so vibrant that it doesn't feel touristy and so far everyone has spoken English to us and service has been very friendly - not overly prompt but obviously we are on Paris time so happy to wait it will come eventually.

A nice walk. We had a nice walk in the streets of Saint Germain, toured all the placed and the shops. we had a nice French dinner in a small cozy restaurant run by mother and daughter...it was nice :)

My home in Paris. St. Germain is a great place to stay when visiting Paris. Wonderful restaurants, cafes, and shops! The area also has a modern and bohemian vibe! Central to everything. I walked to the Eiffel Tower, Notre Dame, The Sorbonne, Luxembourg Gardens, The Louvre, d'Orsay, The Seine River and the Latin Quarter! Convenient Metro stops took me the the Arch. St. Germain is the place!

Glad we stayed in Saint Germain for a week. We had shortlisted Le Marais, Saint Germain and Latin Quarter for our stay in Paris. We are glad we stayed on Rue de Rennes in Saint Germain. Great atmosphere, lots of narrow roads to explore, close to shops of all kinds, great cafes, bistros and brasseries. And felt safe.

Upbeat quarter of Paris. This was my favourite area of Paris where Parisiens out number tourist and you can enjoy suburban life and good eating without having to think of pick pockets all the time. Enjoy a walk through to the Luxembourg Gardens.

Our Paris neighbourhood. Our hotel is in the 6e, and so we have spent quite a bit of time exploring this neighbourhood. Luxury brands are everywhere and the shopping is great, even if you can only afford to window shop at Prada (like me). It is nice and clean and a lot quieter than the more "tourist" areas...which is a huge plus for us.

Our "Maison" for a Week in Paris. Delightful! You could spend your entire visit in the 6th arr. This was my 3rd time in Paris, but 1st staying in the 6th arr. Saint Germain has many wonderful restaurants, shopping, sites and a great central locale for seeing Paris.
Celebrate. Nice and relaxing restaurant. They are open late for those who arrive on a late flight. Prices are moderate and the food was good.

Restaurants, Shopping with history thrown in. Saint Germain has something for everyone - plenty of sights, food, shopping, quaint streets with food markets, famous cafes to feel like you are a French philosopher or bon vivant enjoying your cafe or drink

Great Location on the Left Bank. We stayed here for a week in the summer of 2015. The location was convenient for many of the Paris attractions -- within walking distance of most. The cafes and shopping in the area are nice and all of Paris is just a train ride or walk away.

Our favorite area for stay. This is our favorite area in Paris for stay in hotel. Second time we picked St Germain and we were enjoyed again. The feeling is real parisiens, many restaurants, cafes, bakeries filled with local people and tourists. Bohemian atmosphere, artists, exhibitions, paintings, museums, parks, souvenir shops, food markets, churches etc. Not to much touristique but you feel yourself as real parisien. Watch the local - drink a morning's cafe, read fresh newspapers, smoke, chat on phone. For those who want to stay here - just 1 block from Seine River, 10 minutes walk to Notre Dame and Louvre you are just in the middle of everything. If we go again we will choose Saint Germain without a doubt
Beautiful area. This area was pleasant, everyone was friendly and kind. If I ever make it to Paris again, I am staying in this area. Great shopping for handcrafted items.

A Lovely Section of the City. We toured here as part of the Paris Secret & Charms electric bike tour. We glided through the streets inhaling the history in this area. Our tour guide stopped at several places during our visit. There is so much to do and see. A nice place to visit or even stay.

WORTH A WANDER. Whilst visiting Notre dame, its worth an hour or so out of your time to visit and have a wander around Saint Germain area of Paris. This is a vibrant area with lots of arts and shops, not to mention cafes offering the best of Paris. It is worth a wander if you have the time.
Best location. We stayed in this area for a week long trip and were so pleased with the area. Felt very safe - almost homey.

Fantastic Parisian neighborhood . I'm no expert on Paris. I'm not even 'experienced' on life in the city; though after seven days I can say this is an excellent part of town to stay. The location is premium, as everything is within walking distance, or a quick Metropolitan ride, or short taxi. The people are friendly and inviting. The cafes, shops, restaurants and businesses are as varied as any major city I have been to in the world, and they are simply fun to stop into. The place we stayed was cozy, as many of the residences in this quarter present. If you are looking for a clean, fun and safe place to stay while visiting the City of Lights, this is the area to stay in.
Nice little local. Stayed in the same street. It was a nice little local to visit for coffee in the morning & a bite to eat & a drink at night.. Service was great.. Very friendly.

Eclectic Little Place. Passed by this area on our way back to the hotel from Arc de Triomphe. We were eyeing for macaroons but unfortunately, as summer season, a lot of places or business establishments were closed.

Left Bank. I was a Left Bank person for 30 years. This district is known for the Intellectuals of the 50s, Sarte, Beauvois, Camus.....and others. Do not expect to find them now, but the markets, the streets are wonderful. Please just enjoy walking around.

Saint Germain des Pres Quarter is a wonderful place to start your Parisian adventure.. Home base here meant we could walk to the Louvre, Notre Dame and Musee de Orsay. Numerous cafes, Bistros, bars, art galleries, small unique shops. Also at night, parts of this area take on a celebratory, New Orleans type atmosphere with music on the streets. Wine, cheese, delicious crusty French bread, pastries almost any time of day/night.

Best place ever. This is my favourite place in Paris- gives such an authentic Parisian experience. Amazing food- bakeries, patisseries, crepes, ice cream. Could spend hours and hours walking around all the gorgeous back streets. Incredible contemporary art galleries with really different and interesting stuff.

Saint-Germain-des-prés is a great romantic escapade in Paris. Saint-Germain-des-prés is a great romantic escapade in Paris. The quarter has several famous cafés, including Les Deux Magots, Café de Flore (the most famous one), and a large number of bookstores and publishing houses. In the 1940s and 1950s, it was the centre of the existentialist movement with Jean-Paul Sartre (Being and nothingness) and and Simone de Beauvoir. It is also home to the École des Beaux-Arts, the famed school of fine arts, and the Musée national Eugène Delacroix.

Beautiful Neighborhood. It beautiful to walk the narrow streets full of special boutiques, art galleries and great restaurants. Visit St. Germaine des Pres Church, it beautiful, unfortunately right now the altar is being renovated. When you get hungry pick ant small restaurant and you will have an excellent meal, or just stop for a beer or wine.

Our favorite area to stay, play, eat & shop. We love the vibe of this neighborhood filled with great value hotels, trendy shops and local restaurants. Seems like everyone in Paris is here on Friday and Saturday nights in the cafes that line the streets. It is an authentic Parisian experience
A true bohemian street. Mandatory for all literature lovers! All great writers (Ernest Hemingway, Oscar Wilde) used to live and write there. Truly an inspiration!

Hub of fashion and culture. With all the typical yet inspiring cafes around one can sit around and only just observe and soak in the cultureThanks to the luxury stores the crowd is extremely trendy and makes you understand what the Parisian beauty and fashion is all about Makes you want to move to Paris
Great part of Paris. We stayed in the area on two different occasions. Great place for everything. Felt safe walking around at all hours. Heaps of restaurants and a good vibe.

Wonderful happening area with shops & restaurants. This is a busy area with lots of life It has many restaurants & stores and a vibranceof its own. Also it is not far from many of the tourist attractions. As it is a popular area to stay the hotel prices are fairly highIt is a sought after area to live stay or shop

A Focal Point Of Parisian Culture. If you appreciate Parisian culture - street / cafe . Brassaire culture, the Saint Germain des Pres offers Cafe de Flore, Les Deux Magots, Brasserie Lipp, Leon's [of Brussels] and many - many more.

Haute Style these days. The real heart of Paris nowadays, not just for students and bohemes like in the past, but for those in the know. How to quickly tell? You'll find every trendy shop from any City has a shingle out here now...or soon will be coming.

Great shopping and location to major attractions. We love the convenience of shopping at high end designer stores to affordable local markets with artists, antique shops, and cafes. There is a lot of Parisian vibe. We have stayed here for the past three visits to Paris.

LOVE . I stayed here with my family this month and fell in love with this quaint area of Paris. We stayed at the Hotel Left Bank on Rue de Ancienne Comedie, right off the happy, bustling Rue de Buci. The buildings and streets in this area (6th arr) are beautiful and you are SO close to so many things such as the Louvre, Notre Dame, Il St. Louis (must visit the island and stop at Berthillion for their ice cream!), the Seine (2 or 3 blocks away), Luxembourg Gardens, and many, many dining choices! The Eiffel Tower is across the city but still just a 10 minute or so cab ride away. You will be so happy if you choose to stay in St. Germain!!!
Shopping.. Top end, High St stores. You could spend a £/$/€/¥ or a Million. Enjoy.All kinds of eating and drinking establishments to suit all budgets.

Heart of the Left Bank.. Cafe, shops, cafes. The area has it all. Beautiful tree lined streets. You can find everything you would want. High end shopping or just the little souvenirs for friends. You will not go hungry with the vast array of restaurants available to you here. JOY!!

a slice of Paris that you can almost taste. I remember visiting this quarter several times while I was in Paris. One time it rained to hard that I had to stand outside a cafe... but it makes for a wonderful memory. You will find many shops in this district, some of which are distinctly French, and it's a good place to explore on grey afternoons or any afternoons in general. Visit St Sulpice and St Germain, breathe in the Parisian atmosphere and maybe have a coffee in one of the many cafes decorating the streets.

Amazingly safe and beautiful area . American grandma, mom, and grand -daughter/daughter visit. We made sure we found a very safe 'arrondissement' for our trip and we certainly did! The area is amazing - safe any time - or at least we have felt very safe ( of course always be smart anywhere you go ) but every cafe, street, shop, place we have gone has been wonderful here and we would HIGHLY recommend it to other Americans or non- French visitors as the people in St. Germain have been so so so very nice and welcoming! I have been to Paris 3 times and have never felt more at home!

Good central location with plenty to do. Stayed at the Citadines in the St Germain area. Plenty of cafe bars and restaurants nearby. Friday was especially busy. All places are welcoming and most have outdoor seating

Another amazing part of Paris . Another super fun part of Paris. I highly recommend coming to this part of town as much as possible. I spent 5 weeks in Paris, and I came to this area multiple times to eat, walk around, shop, etc. Super fun for groups big or small. Go!
Loved it. My favorite neighborhood. We will stay in this area next time. Very homey feeling and beautiful shops.

MY Home for 3 Weeks!!. I rented a flat for three weeks through Tripadvisor!! Had a great stay!! Everyone was so nice and helpful in my neighborhood ...and easy walking distance to everything!! Loved it!!

A great place to take in the most beautiful city in the world.. This part of Paris is what olde Paris is all about. The great restaurants and street cafes, provide the opportunity to eat and drink well, while taking time out from all you more adventurous activities, Street after street of restaurants, which cater to all tastes and cultural desires.

Not what it used to be. The entire area has gentrified over the years and is no longer where artists and poets live... Nowadays it is mostly frequented by tourists and foreign investors and the historic cafes Flore and Deux Magots have become Disneylands. Prices of real-estate in the neighborhood has sky-rocketed and many shops have converted into art galleries and antiques. You can still have a nice stroll on the back streets but be aware that you are mostly looking at a historic neighborhood in which you cannot afford to buy property...

Great shopping. We stumbled upon this area quite by accident but it is great for shopping and is filled with restaurants and cafes. Teenage girls will enjoy Subdued for shopping - similar to Brandy Melville but cuter clothes (in my opinion). Great cafes, bakeries, and restaurants!

Fun Place to Wander. My husband and I wandered through this neighborhood one afternoon during a recent trip to Paris. It is full of people sitting out at little cafes and interesting little shops. The whole feeling is that of a neighborhood enjoying itself.
parks and the Seine. Another iconic part of Paris, good for strolling along the Seine and great restaurants, sidewalk cafes, and parks.
Lovely area. Start at one end and take a leisurely stroll to the end. Lovely shops, iconic brasseries, beautiful food stores. A great stroll to familiarize yourself with the left bank.
Great area to stay in~. Saint Germain des Pres Quarter is one of the best areas to stay. It is within walking distance of many sites.

Cool, jeune et jolie . A most beautiful stroll in any day, rain or shine. One would never be bored of Saint Germain, whether one is a culture buff, a shopaholic or a foodie. Saint Germain has something for everyone, travellers and locals alike.
MUST SEE. We stayed in this area of Paris. We wanted a neighborhood to explore and we stayed in a Magnificent Apartment.....
Nice Area to Eat and People Watch. This is the "Artsy" area and it's full of fun eateries with great people watching. Laid back style and safe to walk in even at night.

My image of Paris is in Saint Germain. It is more Parisian than the Champs de Elysee which is so commercial now it is not even worth the walk. Abercrombie store on the Champs de Elysee? Really? Why. Saint Germain is really what I picture Paris to be: quaint shops, cafes, interesting buildings,etc. A real neighborhood feel and a must go to on my list, just to stroll along or grab a coffee or macarron.
beautiful location to explore. An amazing place to explore, but expensive to eat in, prepare and research before you arrive to get the full value of the visit to this location.
The essence of Paris's experience. Not to be missed to get a sense of the quintessential Paris and its cafe and their intellectual and cultural vibes.

Paris' Upper East Side/Soho. Not at all teaming but not sleepy either. Well heeled. Higher end shops mixed with a few "normal" stores here and there - albeit higher prices. Good location to tour Paris from. Don't miss Bon Marche.

Fantastic. Go and stroll through the streets of St Germain, enjoy the small shops have a croissant and cafe and then in the evening pick a restaurant of your choice and enjoy the wonderful atmosphere.
Amazing. This is where we rented our holiday studio for our week long break, this area is central to all amjor attractions and public transport links. Great cafes and bars.

Local area thar offers continuous surorises. We were lucky enough to be staying in this area for several days.This allowed us the opportunity to explorebon foot the many shops,wine bars,reatsurants and apartments blocks.We loved popping into a different winebar every day after a tour and reminising on the days activities.The food at the local restsurants wasbamazing rich jn flavour and taste.I discovered hot mulled wine and thoughtvi was in heaven.This district iffers so much gor travellors of all ages.
My favorite part of Paris. This is by far my favorite part of Paris. Loved walking around and shopping in this area and the non-souvenir shops are filled with helpful, pleasant shop owners.

Beautiful Area - stay with confidence. I stayed in this area for 4 nights last week with my teenage daughter.It's a perfect area, lots of places to eat, great views, away from tourist traps but not far away from any area you plan to visit. Good metro connections - any taxi ride you take isn't expensive - jardins de Luxembourg are lovely for a stroll.

Chic, trendy shops and galleries. My Paris neighborhood!. I love St. Germain. I love wandering the winding streets. I love the collection of galleries, trendy and very chic shops. But most of all, I love the neighborhood feel, especially on the Seine side of St. Germain Boulevard. I realize the Right Bank is more well-known and desired, but I highly recommend the Left Bank and the St. Germain area. A warmer, more neighborly feel.
Great Location. Excellent location, and easy to get to from the Gare Du Nord on the Metro. It's about a 20min walk to the Eiffel Tower, and there are some great cafés, bars and shops

quiet but not boring. my husband and i rented an airbnb situated in saint germain des pres - stayed here for 4 days and 3 nights and it was a better area compared to the area we stayed at in our second trip to paris later on in our trip. its more of a residential area but its surrounded by many establishments like cafes, restaurants and its walking distance to the 3rd arrondisement where a lot of shops, stores and restaurants can also tickle your fancy. on sundays, the 4th is also near the sunday bastille market which is great to go to for breakfast, brunch or lunch. this area is also good for families and couples.

I could spend days here!. We had a group of 6 and we really enjoyed this area. There are the famous Cafes Les Deux Margots and Cafe de Flore. They have it all here! You can shop, buy some local art, they have beautiful flower shops, you can see Notre Dame see go to the cinema or just enjoy all the beautiful people walking by. This is really what I thought Paris would be like. The buildings are just so gorgeous and you can find everything you ever wanted in this charming place! To think of all the people that fell in love with Paris the exact way that I did. I wish I could have had more time here and I can't wait to go back!

Amazing food and service. We booked for an evening business meeting of about 20 and the restaurant accommodated is easily as the seating plan is really flexible for large or small groups. There's a lot of history to this restaurant but they don't rely on that and the quality and service are excellent. I had the escargot to start and they didn't disappoint and followed with steak and crime brûlée, all amazing and clearly prepped and cooked with great care. The staff were really attentive and they have a great wine list . Not the cheapest option in Paris but not the most expensive either and the opportunity to sit where Hemmingway and others once did was an added thrill, it's pure 'old' Paris.
Great for eating. Some famous restaurants here..but a bit more expensive ..still worth the atmosphere and acting like a Parisienne

Wonderful Place to Spend a Day. We spent an entire day of our trip walking around St. Germain. The shops and restaurants were great, we sat at a cafe and enjoyed some people watching for a while. There were great bookstores, bistro's, and local artisans.
Perfect place. Nice place to walk and do some shopping. It is also very nice for an evening walk and a good dinner with various options.

Fantastic area with great cafes, pubs and shopping. Its is one of the best areas to stay for tourist. It has all the shopping from the best brands to nid range brands. Great pubs and cafes around it. It is very happeneing and as tourist you would want to miss visiting this area in case you are not staying in any accomodation here.
Wonderful place to stay!. Very accessible to everywhere via Metro and really fun neighborhood with everything you could need in Paris! Cafes, restaurants, bank, pharmacy, churches, history, etc.
Beautiful area. Lots to see and do in this area. Good shopping area. Great variety of very nice shops and restaurants. Great area for walking and just strolling along.

France May 2016. This is my favorite arrondissement in Paris. It has a large boulevard that cuts through it. The boulevard has many many places to eat and shop. There is a street market at least twice a week at the Maubert Metro stop on the boulevard. Two famous cafes are here. The Deux Margots and Cafe Flore.Also the oldest church in Paris The St. Germain des Pres is located here. Church Saint Sulpice from the DaVinci code is also located here and it is supposed to be the largest church including Notre Dame

The real Feel of Paris. This entire area smells and feels like the true Paris of our visions and dreams. From the large selection of sidewalk restaurants to the outdoor flower shops to the quaint shops selling books and other bits and bobs. A must see for those visiting the first or tenth time to Paris. We try to book our hotel with in walking distance to this delightful neighborhood. A must while in Paris
Still shopping area. Expensive Pastry shops, expensive clothes shops, restaurants- both tourist and expensive etc etc. Near Notre Dame. Good metro access.lots of fashionable People to watch.
Busy shopping quarter. Nice to see everybody shop, walk and dine. Quite busy, many restaurants.Some shopping is possible. If you walk upwards you can see the Sorbonne University.
Fun shopping neighborhood . One evening we decided to stroll through St Germain. It was a ball. Little antique stores and shops for all tastes. By 7 they are pretty much done so start early.

Great location for a hotel. Our hotel was in this area and was lovely. We had a 10 minute walk to the Louvre and a 15 minute walk to Notre Dame Cathedral. There was nice shopping nearby and many cafes.

Night life for mostrly for young people. Plenty of cinemas, theaters, bars, restaurants and young people enjoying Paris' night life. Nice to walk around and sit to have a good French wine seeing the world pass by sitting at one of the famous Paris' cafés.
Fun. We truly enjoyed our visit to this part of the Left Bank. Very lively neighborhood with some amazing restaurants and shops.

A very pretty area of the city. Cafe Flore is right there on the corner - a coffee is 5.70 euros so you have to really like coffee or really want to sit there. It was drizzling the day I was there so there were chairs and tables available. Walk a little further along the street and you'll also come upon Les Deux Margots. The Church of St. Germaine des Pres is undergoing renovation right now so is not in full view and is noisy. Lots of unique shops in the area.
Lots of food choices. A place where you find lots of food choices and shopping. Many second hand shops with good quality clothes and many unused too.

so cosy ...!. one of my favorite "quarters" in Paris ... so nice to stroll along the small little streets , enjoy the cafe's , small shops and beautiful art galleries ... around every corner there is something new ...

The Place to Stay when in Paris. An abundance of fine three- and four-star hotels populate this area; none of them are bargains, but many are charming. The area is rife with every kind of restaurant and cafe, so you're bound to find something to please you. Shopping is good here as well, with some high-end stores and independent boutiques.
Typical Paris, very beautiful!. Lovely place to have a coffee, and observe the beauty and uniqueness of Paris. This is unique, old-school Paris.

What you vision when you think of Paris. If you think of Paris and think of cobblestone streets and quaint shops, then thus is the place for you. Wonderful shops and little bistros. A great afternoon walk, close to Notre Dame and the Louvre.
Must go. Lovely street combined both baroque buildings and modern ones. Has lots of Cafes and restaurants. Must visit.

City Pharma experience. This is the part of town makeup addicts will love - City Pharma is right here and a must visit for your makeup and beauty essentials. Bargains and superb French brands. Be prepared for it being crazy busy!!

Great place to discover the not-so-touristy Paris. Lots of shops on small streets off the beaten path. The area is very residential with a few small hotels (see my review of the Hotel Du Bac at 66, Rue Du Bac). Grocery stores, butchers, bakers, fishmongers, hairdressers, etc; all catering to the local Parisians. Easily reached by the Metro Du Bac stop.

Best of Paris. . Don't shy away from this area. It's here to explore.
Rich in history and culture. Art galleries. Furniture stores. Flower shops combined with book stores.
Perfect place to stay. Even better place to live.

Location, location, location!. Everything you could want in Paris--cafes, shops, historical sites, proximity to Notre Same, Luxembourg Gardens, Muses D'Orsay....
Cafe Flor, Deux Magots, Brasserie Lipp -- they are all here. Luxury shopping abounds
Try to stay near St. Germain de Pre.
Jazz concerts in the neighborhood in May!
We wouldn't stay anywhere else!
Pretty to walk around. Extremely busy shops and restaurants but fabulous scenery and architecture. We enjoyed walking around and taking in the atmosphere.
Best area on the Left Bank. Loved it immensely. True French shopping and quaintness. Walk the alleyway s get lost and then found again. A beautiful place to feel French.
The place to be!!!!!!!!!. Wonderful reataurants, sidewalk cafes, shopping, cathedrals,ambience, and a good place to wander on foot.

Buzzing. a must for anyone in love with Paris / France the cafe' life is so great. snacks coffee pernod. the church is so quaint... we even got to see the skaters in the road, bobbing in and out the trffic, and the artists by the river are great. a romantic part of the city

Vibrant area with lots of local shops. My friends & I loved this area, it felt very safe. The shops here are great ~ lots of individual/local shops. Walking distant to Norte Dame & great for metro stations ~ especially if you want to come direct from Charles du Gaul airport.
Beautiful way to spend an afternoon. We just strolled down the boulevard stopped for lunch then another place coffee and dessert. Nice shops along the way very historic and lively.

excellent mix of everything. We stayed in this area and it had a wonderful mix of old shops and bars, some really unique and surprising , really wonderful place just to stroll around. lovely restaurants and less of the chains

Beautiful part of Paris. I love St Germain for Its beauty, the great atmosphere, shops and of course the great cafe culture. I always think of St Germain and St Michel when thinking of Paris. Fairly central on the south bank and easy to access the other sites either by open top bus, metro, taxi or on foot.

The Paris you want to see. Landmarks and historical attractions aside, this is the Paris you want to see, even if you do not want to admit it. These charming streets, filled with shops, bistros and relatively current literary landmarks is not to be missed. This time, we were taken by native Parisian friends for dinner and were delighted! Live jazz music, lovely cafes... beautiful streets,and cobblestone alleys with hidden gems of restaurants, galleries, chocolate artisans, etc We did not go the first time in Paris, did not want to seem too touristy. Once there, we realized that it was the Paris we yearned for.. (Louvre and Eiffel Tower aside) Really it felt like we had stepped back in time. Watch the traffic, follow your nose and your ears.. enjoy. It is the highlight of our trip so far. We are so glad that we did not turn our nose up at it. What a treat

A charming area. We walked around on different side streets. The architecture is just lovely. We had gelato at our favorite place Amorino. Delicious. We went to Les Deux Maggots for coffee and people watching and stayed a few hours. Just a great time was had.

Paris you'll never forget!. Feel like a parisien in this arrondissement! Older people, students, tourists, elegant buildings, cafés, bistrots & brasseries, bookshops & cinemas, an unique universe that make this city a different place to Live. History, art and la joie de vivre.

Great food and shopping. Ended up staying in this quarter for a week in May. Absolutely loved the abundant cafes, bistros, bread stores and bars. I highly recommend this region when looking for a hotel or on AirBnB.

Great location for tourists. Saint-Germain-des-Prés is a really good location for visitors to Paris, mainly because so few tourists stay there. It's in the 6th Arondissement, an up-market residential area. Saint-Germain-des-Prés is within walking distance of many of the sights, but is also blessed with Métro stops from a variety of different lines, as well as being on bus routes. The area has a profusion of shops of all kinds, cafés, bars, brasseries, and many really excellent restaurants. It's quiet, it's safe, it's friendly -- who could ask for more?

Love this neighborhood. This area is a good place to have your base at. Its close to everything, and it gives you that non tourist feeling, like your a Parisian. Plenty of neat shops, and restaurants. you can't go wrong. I always try to get a little boutique hotel in this area if I can.

Beautiful St-Germain-des-Pre's. We traveled to Paris in April and once again we stayed in the St-Germain-des Pres area. Although certain streets tend to get a little crowded and touristy, the vast majority of this picturesque neighborhood is home to Parisians. I kept asking myself what was it that made want to stay in this area again.. here it is: 1- Easy to get to from CGD via RER (beware, pick pockets abound in Paris, particularly in trains be careful) 2- Walking distance from Notre Dame Cathedral (if you stay in Blvd St Germain is a 15 min walk) 3- it is full of cafes, brasseries, restaurants, markets, and tons of patisseries. 4- walking distance to The Leuvre, Latin Quater, the world famous Shakespeare and Co bookstore, Cafe Flore, Les Deux Magots, Cluny Museum just to name a few. 5- Transporation (tip: before you travel to Paris, download the app Paris Metro, key in your location and it displays the nearest train station, to and from routes etc). I believe this neighborhood or Arrodissement is the best area in Paris.

Wonderful area... Feel like a local Parisian. Wonderful area with lots of shops, bars, cafes and bistros My favorite place to stay while in the city Central to all main attractions and many within walking distance
Lively Area!. This is one of my favorite spots in Paris. It's lively and full of restaurants and cafes. The walk along the river is beautiful and there is so much to see!
Lovely place. We loved strolling in this quarter with its old churches - Saint Germain des Pres or Saint Sulpice, the second one wonderful at night with a small square and fontaine full of light.

Touch down in Paris. We made a 2 night stop in St Germain for our first trip to Paris. What a great neighbourhood it was so easy to get here from the airport. very clean and such interesting street scape
Perfect location. safe, arty, fantastic food, cafes, even a small supermarket and wonderful macarons. love this area of Paris.

One of My Favorite Neighborhoods in Paris. One of the beauties of visiting Paris more than once is that you get a sense of the neighborhoods (arrondissements). Saint Germain (with the Marais following in close second) is my preferred neighborhood anytime I come to Paris. This trip, we rented an apartment on rue de Lille and we've loved getting to know the neighborhood as locals might. It is a highly walkable neighborhood with plenty of restaurants, groceries, museums (d'Orsay and Louvre within 5-10 minutes) and easy access to most of the major attractions within Paris. It is also a very quiet, clean and safe neighborhood. I wish now that I had known on my first trip to Paris that Saint Germain would be home to me in Paris. It took me several trips to find it but I'm finally home in Paris!

Take a walk here . Stayed near here when visiting Paris. A long Street with many smaller areas coming off. It's wonderful with numerous shops cafes boulangeries galleries. Just about anything. It's very safe, clean and upmarket. Loved it.
Shopping heaven. We spent a few hours in the well known department stores enjoying an amazing lunch in the restaurant of one of the department stores with the most amazing stain glass domed ceilings

Location, location, location. And great food. We stayed in an apartment in St. Germain for a week and were so happy we did. We were right in the middle of a vibrant neighborhood with great restaurants, all sorts of shopping, and great people watching. To top it off, it's walking distance to some of the best sights Paris has to offer: the Musee D'Orsay, the Louvre, Ile de la Cite and Notre Dame, the Luxembourg, and so much more. I would definitely stay in St. Germain again.

Shop til you drop and then eat a fab meal and drink St. Germain wine to cap it off!. Love this area, its one of the man shopping districts and the main drag if you want to see busy everyday paris. It was amazing, accessible by all trains (its north of les halles) and has food and shopping for every price and taste. Most places here have US menus to the side or close by the regular menu stand if you are not good at french, and most will find you a english speaking waiter if you stumble with french. Do yourself a favor and be sure to layer, it can get quickly cold, rainy or hot all in one day.

nice area for people watching. This is a nice area to stroll around for the day. There are several cafe's, lots of shopping, several little shops selling chocolates or uniquely eats. We did a food tour in this area and was satisfied. The tour itself left a little to be desired but the food selection was good.
Another place in Paris. Very touristic and overpriced. Full of shops, cafés and restaurants. Enjoy the walk on the Boulevard Saint Michel and Boulevard St Michel
Always busy!. It's always busy in this area and people come here to have a nice lunch with friends or come to those famous bookstores for shopping.

Small streets, s mall shops a classic Parisienne atmosphere. Enjoy a stroll in the small streets, visit thread many inspiring and artistic shops and find a small cafe for a good lunch. A favourite area of mine. Can enjoy hours looking at antique shops, old prints and paintings. The atmosphere is relaxed band the concentration of tourists tolerable. Give yourself a pleasant experience of the classic Paris.
Chichi side of town. Really not just all about cafes and such but a place where history abounds. Visit the abbey and the Delacroix museum.

Enjoyable dinner location. A high number of interesting cafes and restaurants that are located in this district. Worth the trip for the experience. Check the menus and prices and don't feel pressured, as restaurant staff will approach you when checking the menu.
Just a place in Paris. Nothing really important (especially if you have already been in Paris more than once). It is very touristic and some of the shops are very expensive.

Wonderful Area of Paris. We were lucky enough to see this firsthand with a Paris by Mouth Food Tours that explored the local food, shops, and culture of this area. We would definitely go back there for an extended stay!
A ultra must!!!!. There is so much to see and discover, authentic streets, lovely boutiques, excelllent food choices, a whole day is easily spent in this truly parisian neighboorhood.
Time for a coffee and people watching. The Saint Germaine Quarter is a beautiful place to sip coffee and watch people walk by. Parisians know how to dress with style.
quel merveilleux quartier. Il n'y aura plus d'apres.... A beautifull part of Paris which is a very romantic place to visit as a couple, totally recommend it!

Fabulous french quartier. It's worth a visit getting here. You can experience here a particularly french lifestyle. Make sure to stop by for a cup of coffee in one of the charming cafes on the terrace.

THE OLDEST CHURCH IN PARIS!. This area is named after its landmark church, Sainte Germain de Pres,the oldest church in Paris. Its foundation dates back to the 6th century but was modified throughout centuries after destruction conducted by invaders from the North. The interior is simple Roman-Gothic with a huge organ that resounds with splendid music.Check out your Parisian guidebook or Wikipedia for more details. Well worth visiting. PS: right across the street is the trendy Deux Magots Caffe, where people go to be seen and engage in people watching whereas in the postwar period the likes of Jean Paul Sartre and Simone Beauvoir used to hang out there.

Old paris. This is where I always like to stay in Paris. It has so much charm and history. There's everything in this pretty area. I love walking thru the Luxembourg gardens or sitting on a bench and watching the sun go down. It's as close to the old Paris as you can get.

Overhyped.. Not my style. Though it is Paris and therefore beautiful its full of overpriced restaurants and shops- I prefer the 'rougher' districts in the east part of the city that feel more authentic and diverse. A tourist trap.

Love this are of Paris. This is a vibrant and fun area of Paris and we love it here! Easy metro stops and it is right by Notre Dame and the Sorbonne. Tons of restaurants and stores. Great energy in this area!
The architecture is like stepping back in time.. Loved the shops, the atmosphere, and the lovely architecture. It's great to be able to walk around, see the sights and window shop.

One of my fav streets in Paris. Saint-Germain-des-Prés is one of my favourite neighbourhoods in Paris. Located in the 6th arrondissement it was formerly the epicentre of cool favoured by artists, writers and creative types and was introduced to me by a dear friend when I visited here 2 years ago. If I ever lived in Paris for an extended time, I imagine myself living in this quarter.The main street within Saint-Germain-des-Prés, completed renovated by Haussmann and as important as the Champs-Élysées. There’s plenty of shopping to do here with less of a touristy crowd and wonderful cafes to hang out in. I absolutely adore this area and would always return here just to hang out and people watch.Paris is a city, yes. And Saint-Germain is no small district. But time and again I’ve always stumbled upon quiet squares and enclaves that is both romantic and charming. One of it is Rue de Furstenberg which was an amazing hidden gem that is miles apart from the busy boulevard off the main street. Musée Delacroix is also located in this lovely square, celebrating Delacroix’s works from the romantic age. The museum was converted from the celebrated artist’s final residence. Delacroix’s most famous piece is the Liberty Leading the People (this piece is displayed at the Louvre-Lens) depicting the French Revolution with a woman symbolising liberty holding up the French tri-colour flag.

A great neighborhood always. Good shopping, eating, and a must for first time travelers. We always visit this area each year. We have our favorite cafes, shops both big and small, and just plain walking around.

So much to see here!. We stayed in St Germain for a week and found so much to see. We loved the variety of restaurants, some very tiny places tucked away in narrow streets and dozens of others. The beautiful old church, fabulous shopping, markets, delis, serious chocolate and macaron shops and cinemas. Allow plenty of time for wandering and browsing, the boulangeries are especially high class here, in fact everything is truly elegant, this is Paris.

The best neighborhood in Paris. My husband and I travel to Paris once or twice a year and have stayed in many different arrondissements. Saint Germain is by far my favorite neighborhood for shopping, eating, lodging and simply walking about and exploring. It is not particularly touristy which is perhaps why I like it as I do.

Stop at Les Deux Magots!. One of my favorite things to do is visit Saint Germain des Pres and have a glass of champagne in Les Deux Magots. The location is beautiful, the restaurant a landmark (Sartre wrote here), and no matter what the season, it's a very worthwhile , if a bit expensive, activity!

The best area of Paris.. I spent an endless amount of time in Saint Germain des Pres, walking, eating and just taking in all the surroundings. I highly recommend everyone to explore this gorgeous part of Paris.

Still the best place in Paris!. This was my third visit to the St. Germaine des Pres area for a vacation. It is a happening " village" of colorful people, food, shopping and Parisian life. Hemmingway wasn't wrong to write about this lively area full of happening sounds, smells and sites - even at 4 AM you can find a new "friend" to celebrate with. Oh! And the morning croissants and lattes are super.

I just love this neighborhood because it has a soul.... Many lovely little clothing & jewelry stores, art galleries, cafes. Also lots of interesting people, beautifully and nicely dressed locals, little old ladies with gorgeous outfits, perfect makeup and hair, the Cafe Flore, the Deux Magots, not to mention the oldest church in Paris, St Germain des Pre.

Fun in the Sixth!. I am biased because I live only a few blocks from this area, but I highly recommend it. It features two famous cafes frequented by the famous writers--Deux Magots and Cafe de Flore, across from a beautiful church. In the back streets you will find classic french cafes, ice cream parlors, crepes and books shops. You can stroll from the main street down Rue St. Andres des Arts all the way to San Michel in the Latin Quarter. You might also stop into the Derniere Goutte wine shop--which usually has wine tastings on Saturday afternoon. To eat, check out Da Rosa for excellent Spanish influenced plates.

Our stay was marvelous. We chose to stay in an Airbnb apartment in the Saint Germain de Pre Quarter--it was amazing. Our hostess, Colette, treated us warmly and helped us settle in. It was wonderful to get up every morning and look over the rooftops, then go down to a cafe (we were treated particularly warmly at one and it became our favorite) and then set out on our day. The historical surroundings as we walked and saw so many sites, visited shops, and simply enjoyed being in this area made us want to return again and as soon as possible.

A great french neighborhood. Meander along this beautiful (and expense) section of Paris. You will discover both name brands and local merchants unique to Paris. Fabulous casual cafes and bistros where you can sit and have lunch and watch the people (both local and tourists) go by. Very nice Ralph Lauren restaurant and shop along the Saint Germain. Great way to spend an afternoon. Wander down the side streets to discover even more shops and unique archictecture
Great place to just walk around. We had a good time just walking around and enjoying this part of town. We also went in Winter. In Summer it was a bit overrun with tourists.

Best Location. I couldn't be happier with the selection of a hotel in this general vicinity. How can one small area of the planet hold so much interesting locales ? Cafe's bars, hotels, pastier, and shopping - hold onto your wallet and NEVER go shopping after you have hit the "cafe's"

The Place to FEEL Paris. If you want to "feel" Paris instead of just "see" Paris, this is the best place to sit in a cafe, shop for whatever, or just to people watch, you will not be bored! So many options! Great area!

Safe place to be. Paris seems broken into sections, this quarter, has the feel of being a place to be. Apart from the surrounding places for food and drink the people have a sense of calm about them. The humour is good too from the staff in the dinning places. Best part of Paris for me so far.
Great place to stay. We always stay in St. Germain in the 6th District. There many shops and restaurants in the area and close walk to the Louvre and Notre Dame

Always worth visiting. Every time we visit Paris, it is a most to go to the Quarters. The people are different from those on the other side of Seine. On the other hand the Parisiens regard us as tourists, which was not so nice. Also the athmosphere has changed because of the refugees.
the centre of existentialism. revisit the old haunts of jean paul-sartre and simone de beauvoir. charming and relaxing area. Cafes are very pricey though. Sartre may protest! visited 2013

My favorite location in Paris. Nice, relaxed feel as opposed to busier areas like the Champs-Elysees. Lots of restaurants, cafes, shops. Felt safe walking around. Clean area. Glad we decided to book a hotel in this area.

One of the best neighborhoods in Paris, stroll, dine, enjoy. This neighborhood oozes Parisian elegance and charm with it's lovely shops, restaurants, cafes, galleries and walkable streets. It's our favorite overall neighborhood.
Loved this Neighborhood. We just returned from our first time to Paris and not only did we stay in this area but most of our shopping and eating was in this area as well. Great and not crowded!
Great for walking. Our hotel and favorite restaurants were both in this neighborhood. We went out walking one night and we found it pleasantly easy to get lost strolling this area.

most charming paris quarter. just taking a walk around here is interesting enough even when raining
artistic with many interesting bookshops
beautiful cafes and small restaurants
Great neighbourhood. Fun Buzzy quarter neat Notre Dame. If you enjoy classical music go to St Julienne le Pauvre Church for frequent varied recitals. Very high calibrate and very good value.

I loved the atmosphere!. For the few nights I stayed in Paris, I rented a flat off of Airbnb in this area and I really think Saint Germain is "THE" place to stay in Paris. Just walking around the area, checking out little cafes, walking by the River Seine, it was all magical. I am going back to Paris this summer and I know where I am staying this time :)

Awesome area. to walk, shop, eat, people watch, relax, drink a cup of coffee in a café and get a bit of second hand smoke, but that's what Paris is all about. Fantastic area to spend a few days in. The shops and food are wonderful. Wish I was there right now!
My second favorite Paris neighborhood (to the Marais!). Spent hours wandering the neighborhood, which is so pleasant but rain was making it difficult. Had lunch at Le Hibbou,which was delicious!

fresh and tradition. You can stop there for a quick coffee in a rainy morning sitting on the famous café in the corner...and see mothers pick up or drop of children to school, very beautiful people walking around you thinking you are invisible and invent stories about them. the coffee is quite expensive but bread and butter here is really gummy!
Just a good place to be. A lovely area which feels peaceful and has stunning architecture. Lots of nice cafes and arty shops. Worth a visit to stroll around.
Great precinct and markets. Great precinct and markets. We loved visiting but was the most impressive of those we visited during our trip but was still worth the time

Amazing to stroll along. I visited Paris May of 2015.
The weather was amazing and so I strolled around quite a lot!
Definitely walk around the Saint Germain quarter.....the reality that you are in Paris will sink in! lol

Up market lively quarter!. Saint Germain des Pres is worth a visit when in Paris. It has many busy streets with shops and restaurants. It is very pleasant to walk through the streets and admire the beautiful buildings. Paris is quite small so it is relatively easy to walk between quarters without the need to take public transport. One advice: check where to eat as there are tourist traps!
Best Restaurant Selection. If you are out seeing the Louvre, Musee d'Orsee, Notre Dame, etc., go here for lunch or dinner. The streets are loaded with great little brasseries and cafes.

The "Greenwich Village" of Paris. You wouldn't go to NYC and just stay above 14th street - and for the same reason you want to hang out in St. Germain des Pres, More funky, more casual art scene, great little bistros and lots of youth - since the Sorbonne is near.
Satre - Art and Paris - Enjoy. An interesting area that is to be savoured and enjoyed over a few days and if lucky enough weeks. The cafes are still here and the roads of history all clear.

Favorite Paris Neighborhood. We love this area of tiny boutique hotels, sharing restaraunt a with Parisian residents, outdoor markets, the oldest Paris church, tourist shoppes and best local area to just walk, walk, walk-

Miraculous Medal Church, rue du Bac. Since we are Catholics and Easter is a most special time, we visited Our Lady's special Church on the rue du Bac - we were charged to bring many prayer intentions from family and friends to Our Lady for her intercession and help.

Great Area of Paris But Spoilt By Gypsy Salesmen. Although this is a great area of Paris (aren't they all), the area around Les Invalides is spoilt by the Gypsies selling, in some cases too hard, cheap tat at crazy prices. Security is stepped up since my last visit so expect delays and bag searches.
Good food street. This area is not too far from Luxemburg garden. You can find the local food street on this area. You should taste the coffee from here for keep you relax.

Great Location. Right in the middle of it all. So many small cafes, art galleries, and restaurants. Not heavy traffic. Bars and lounges get crowded, as dirge restaurants. Lots to chose from. Something for everyone.

Great shops and lots of character. We stayed nearby. Never visited this area before though I have been to Paris several times. Loved the area and would recommend seeking out a concert or two in one of the local churches. Just turn up and pay on the door. Brilliant.
The cafe life. This area epitomizes the Parisian lifestyle. Cafes, shopping, churches, architecture, bistros. This is why you come to Paris.

Very chic, very trendy, very Paris. This was my 7th trip to Paris and my 5th time in this part of the city. Incredible shopping, delicious eateries, and a walker's paradise. Now, when I think of Paris, I think of the St. Germain des Pres Quarter. So, even if you are not staying here, take a walk over, boulevard and don't forget the lovely side streets. And for those who complain about prices, window shopping is free!

Wear Comfortable shoes. We walked all over Paris and really enjoyed the stores and cafes. Of course the hills closer to the Pantheon were a little hard on the legs but you`ll enjoy stopping just to take a look at them all.
Nice stroll. We loved walking through the streets and savoring the sights and sounds of al the places in Saint Germain. Lovely eating and shopping to be done in very small alleys
Sweet tooth's heaven. There are lots of good bakeries, cafes, restaurant and beautiful chocolate boutique, sweet and cute macaroon shops. Nice place to visit and enjoy the foods. Love this place.

Famous Cafes & Footsteps of Authors. Saint Germain is a great area for dining and shopping. It wasn't overly crowded because the popular tourist sites are to the north and west of the area. We visited the Louvre and walked the 10 minutes to Café de Flore for a sidewalk lunch. So amazing! The area can be pricey compared to other parts but the atmosphere is very worth it.

Lovely streets to meander theough. Chose to visit here on the Sunday of our trip. Lots of activity - locals out to church, drinking coffees & buying from street stalls. More happening here in this area on what is a quiet day in the city. Lots,of gorgeous food shops & cafes.

If you want a lot of nice stores and not a lot of tourist..... This is the place to go! Walking around Saint Germain is great because you see a lot of stores, restaurants,and yet, it's not so crowded with tourist. Even the cab driver told us once, that we picked a great place to stay.
Lots to see. If you have time for a stroll around the Latin Quarter and St Germain then do it. There are plenty of historic buildings and lively spots.
Great place. The place is full of fabulous restaurants and cafes and there is a lot of shops and high brands , especially my favorite pharmacy ( city pharma)

Great place to locate your stay. This is a great area to situate oneself during a Paris visit. There are shops, cafes and great eating places. The transportation so other parts of the city are super easy.

A Nostalgic Walk through the Fifties. Located by the Seine River, Saint Germain des Près is a typical Parisian burroughs with many famous cafés and restaurants. It is not unusual to see VIPs taking their coffee at the terrace of "Les deux magots" of the "Café de Flore". Amateur of old stones may alos want to pay the basilic a visit. It is worth the trip back to the past ! Lovely boutiques, nice bars, street markets, lot of yougsters, students and tourists in the streets. It is so crowded you can barely walk on a typical saturday afternoon. I would recommend you take the small streets from Odeon to Saint-Michel. You do a stop at the café Procope just for the fun of having a drink or two in the oldest parisian bar and restaurant still in use.
the perfect spot to enjoy food and drink. Here is the spot where you can sit down have a good drink or even a gret meal , while paris life just passes you by. What a way to relax

Nicest to Stay While in Paris. This neighborhood is the Parisian experience of artists and cafe society, charming and filled with quaint streets everywhere, walk to louvre and Notre Dame in 10-15 minutes.
Cafe Flore. Going back in time this area of Paris is the very gratin! Chic and fabulous to shop as major stores have smaller but up market boutiques in this fabulous arondissment!

Elegance and charm in Paris. This is a very chic neighborhood. Lots of design stores, kitchen stores, clothes and shoes and antiques. Most of the stores are very high end. Even if you don't shop there is very entertaining go "window shopping". Many brasseries and side walk cafes all around. This is one of the best places to get lost and discover a new place.

Love the atmosphere!. I love this part of Paris! Lovely streets with great architecture, many art galleries and lovely Caffees. I think i had there the most expensive beer in my life but it was still wort it :)
Charming area. Excellent area to walk around, do shopping, have good food, go to the cinema. Really, there's a lot to do around and famous cafés like Café de Flore or Les Deux Magots

Saint Pretentious. diana-c.comYes, it's a beautiful neighborhood. Yes, there are narrow winding streets, small boutiques and eateries (rue de Buci for example or rue Gregoire de Tours or rue Mabillon), yes the cafe Flore or cafe des deus maggots or la brasserie Lipp still cater to the sloe eyed hirsute intellectual types or in the case of Lipp, politicians, but the feel is definitely one of being in a movie set. Saint Germainites live and breathe an acutely postured history, which for the passing tourist is fine, but goes only so far in my opinion. Enjoy, but don't expect to see a Sartre in hot debate with a Camus anymore. Those days are gone.
A most see. Enjoy this absolutely fabulous place in Paris. Popular vibrant, there is always a great buzz... Nice places to drink, dine or even to enjoy a nice strall..

the paradise of Terasses. having a cafe and looking at people passing by is great! best is during the day to see teh whole activity and still remain quite. But it is also very lively to walk around with beautiful old building and university like La Sorbone just nearby

Paris weekend break. Shopping, hotels and restaurants to suit all comers. Has to be the place to stay whilst in Paris. This was my fourth visit to this part of Paris and I love it. Short walk down to the Seine and it has all the shops you would want either in Bon Marche or on the streets all around including Hermes down to the fresh food stalls at Marche Germain what a contrast. The Abbey is a wonderful place to visit along with Saint Sulpice. Beer or glass of wine in Cafe de Flore eat at Brasserie Lipp, Les Deux Magots or Relais de l'Entrecôte or any of the other excellent places to eat and if after something special try Terroir Parisien you will not be disappointed. We have stayed a number of times in Hotel Pas de Calais slap bang in the middle of everything. Anyway all I can say is St Germain is the place to be if going to Paris you will not be disappointed!

The best neighborhood. Saint Germaine des Pres is wonderful for eating, shopping or just wandering. A day or two and you will be wondering why you aren't living in Paris. Until you remember how much everything costs!

Lively, vibrant, plenty of activities. We took a casual stroll here and there are plenty of interesting shops and eateries. The place is vibrant and towards the evening, there are many bars and restaurants with seating outside. This is definitely the place for some nightlife.
charmingly. fascinating, the real charm of Paris here feels, we loved to spend time here, especially at night,really nice..

A favorite quarter. We met a son near the Pont Saint-Michel and started walking the streets towards the l'eglise Saint Germain des Pres. It was fun to point out the sites to someone who had only been to Paris once before and had never been to this area of the city. We stopped briefly at Les Deux Magots before continuing our walk and crossing the Seine to orient him to other parts of the city. Of course we went into a few small shops along the way.

Must visit!!. This is a beautiful area to literally get lost in. With some great local shops, as well as he high end designers, there are also some beautiful cafes, bars and restaurants to enjoySuch an easy, short stroll from Montparnasse and Notre Dame, it really is a shame if you miss this area!

Lovely shopping, but not much open on a Sunday. We stayed in this area and there were a lot of lovely shops and beautiful architecture. We bought food from the street markets and boulangeries but not much else. We did look in the windows of some truly remarkable chocolate shops (including one with a life size chocolate bust of an orang-utan). We took the kids out to spend their money on Sunday, but everything was shut by then.
The most hip area of Paris. This area is so hip, especially with tourists. The streets are vibrant and bustling. All the good eateries and cafes are a short walk away.

Caffes. I love to walk the back streets - ave Universite, seine and all for the lovely shops and architecture but also Ave St Germaine fore wonderful cafe life. Yo can find really good 3 star hotels there and no reason to look for a higher classification.

A most human sized quarter in Paris. The neighborhood of streets between St Germain des Pres church and pl St Michel, made up of one way streets housing art galleries, small boutiques, restaurants, and residences, is worth a solid 1-2 hours of wandering around. Take most streets and you will be pleased with the mixture of businesses and everyday life, with the rue de Buci having the concentration of restaurants and probably the rue de Seine having the largest of small galleries. There is a good grocery store (Carrefour) in the middle of the neighborhood if you are staying close by, with stalls of fresh food right outside on rue de Seine. It is peaceful in spite of being in the middle of Paris, and you feel the neighborhood's distinct artsy vibe when you step into it from any side. It's a compact and distinct place, a short 10 minute walk from Notre Dame or the Cluny.

Nice area. Saint Germain des Pres is a really nice area. Filled with art galleries and cafe it truly gives a Parisian vibe. Not the best area for budget friendly travels but if you just go and see it's free. I think it's a must of Paris.

Great area of Paris. Spend a day in the Saint Germain Quarter. So much history - we did a walking tour with a guide which was so interesting and such a great way to learn about this area. Best macaroons in the city!

Just the best.... The best restaurants open late, the place for all ages. Walk all day long and you will discover beauty and history at every corner. The marche (market) is great place to meet the locals and find some great stuff.
Must Visit Area in Paris. Young and vibrant area to walk around. I enjoyed walking on the back street finding a cute shops. Also there are a few historically famous architectural sites to visit too.
Best Neighborhood in Paris. Iconic, beautiful, charming neighborhood. Great cafes, shopping and people-watching in the most picturesque setting. We didn't want to leave and cannot wait to go back.

Most colourful area in Paris. This is where you should go if you are looking for a life area, full of restaurants, cafes, fast food (Turkish, Lebanese, Egyptian, Greek, you name it!)The area is very safe to be at night, and also children friendly. I have never stayed at a hotel there but it certainly looks very interesting to try the next time Im in Paris. It is full of life and looks like it never sleeps. They have amazing creperies and gauffres.

Excellent area for shopping / art and cafe culture . I wish we had found this area on our first day as we would have struggled to leave ..
Fabulous doesn't quite cover how nice this area is
It's a cooler version of Soho
Best part of Paris. Im soglad that i been to st germain..The area is realy qualty and you feel save. Buildings are amazing, restaurants are unique and nice

Fantastically Relaxed Neighborhood. We spent a few hours strolling the streets of the Saint Germain des Pres quarter whilst on a long weekend in Paris. The narrow side streets and old buildings with hidden cafes around every corner make this an easy way to lose a few hours and take in the real Paris.Also a great place for literature lovers with some of the big names once strolled along as well.

The Haunt of Literary Giants.... Fans of Hemingway and Fitzgerald will know this place by the books they enjoyed by these fine writers.. What fun to stroll the streets where they walked themselves and perhaps have a drink or meal at one of the famous bistros they haunted...

In the footsteps of the famous writers. This fashionable, elegant quarter is named after the Church of Saint-Germain-des-Pres, situated right in the centre of the area. This beautiful old church alone is a good reason to visit the lovely neighbourhood. However, this charming quarter has much more to offer. It is home to famous Paris cafés, such as Les Deux Magots and Café de Flore. It’s so exciting to walk in the footsteps of Jean-Paul Sartre, Simone de Beauvoir, and Ernest Hemingway, who, among others, frequented these charming cafés. If you don’t feel like going inside, a leisurely stroll in the neighbourhood is enough to soak up the atmosphere. This area is also filled with many shops and restaurants. Do not miss the famous Laduree on the corner of the rue Bonaparte and rue Jacob.

Great food and scenery . We walked over to this area, found some lunch and then just walked around to see what we could find. A very nice area with upscale shopping and also reasonable priced things found so venture into Saint Germain and the near by Latin quarters as well.

Walk and Enjoy. We stayed in the Latin Quarter so this entire area so easily accessible for us and absolutely delightful. It's my third time in Paris, and first time staying on the left bank, once you go left.....you'll never want to go right again! The markets and restaurants and shopping were just awesome. Every late afternoon we would journey out after a long day of touring and stop in for some wine and baguette and bring them back to our apartment hotel and just enjoy while deciding where to go for dinner. St. Michel metro station is an easy walk, Rue de Buci and Huchette are all there. Paul's is a must stop for macaroons, baguettes and pastries. Saint Michel bakery has lovely quiches. Wine, cheese, baguettes, Paris. Love it!!

Love it... feel still the same like 35 years ago. I love roaming the little side streets and walk the Boulevard St. Germain... you see hip people, and generally enjoy the relaxed atmosphere in that neighborhood.... there are universities not too far away and the students generate a youthful flair.... love it like I used to love it decades ago... there are galleries between the Quais and St. Germain, interesting shops, and streets.... try rue Jacob for instance....

Beautiful! Old Paris buildings, boutiques, art galleries . A beautiful quarter to walk through.old Paris at its best. Art galleries, boutiques, small streets and old buildings. Take half a day to walk easily. Very special.

Walk This Quarter. Go walk the actual length of Saint German des Pres Blvd and experience the very high end of Paris and then come to the quarter for a taste of local life. Jammed with boulangeries (there seem never to be enough bakeries) cafes, groceries, boutiques and just life.
Expensive unless you window shop. Walked many streets after shops were closed. Very unique boutiques, fun even to look at window dispalys.

Definitely a People-Watching Mecca. Best place to stroll, people-watch and window-shop. Unique everything -- bizarre and expensive to trendy and moderately priced. Characters abound wearing the most interesting wardrobes I've ever seen -- even in NYC. Have a cup of sipping chocolate at Le Deux Magots and enjoy the show.

My favourite Arrondissement - so many beautiful clothing boutiques.. This was my favourite area in Paris. Streets and streets of beautiful clothing boutiques, cakes, cafes etc. Every day I found myself wanting to come back to this same area.

Fantastic Haussmann Architecture. We spent three hours today walking around the St. Germain des Pres area. It is so French. The shops have such beautiful unique items. Some of our favorite streets were Rue Mabillon, Rue Princesses, Rue du Vieux Colomber, and Rue St. Andre des Arts and Rue de Buci. Stop and enjoy some cafe creme or a glass of wine and cheese plate at Au Sauvignon @ 80, Rue Sts. Peres. It is a joy to just sit outside and watch the French enjoy life as they pass by this fun spot.

Lots of eating and shopping. Have to tell you, I am a guy who loves shopping and dining with my wife. This area can entertain you for hours. My wife found a Caron of Paris Perfume store, her grandmother used to use a scent from them. It is almost impossible to find that scent in the States. She bought some at a good price. All that shopping makes you hungry and it is so hard to pick a Cafe but it is fun doing so. Pick one that meets your wants and needs and enjoy.

Keep a tight hold on yout (partner's) credit card. An interesting wander down a shopping street with few, if any, bargains for those of less than exceptional means. Austerity is not a word associated with this type of shopping.

Great way to spend an afternoon.
