There are so many tourists here, so not a local hang-out, therefore the food is not the greatest and not a typical French experience, but this is one place you just need to walk around and "feel" it.

Casual Chic. Once very bohemian, this quarter became a symbol of luxuary and chic casual. The most expensive cafés are there (sometimes really outrageous and absolutely not justified prices). This was the quarter were the "existentialism" was born and a source of inspiration for many writers like Sartre, Camus and singers like Gréco. The atmosphere is not there anymore but prices are outrageous for the sake of rememberance

Not as touristy . Our hotel was in this area, the Victoria Palace, the streets are mostly locals. Lots of major shopping here. Including the Bon Marche and the Epecerie store next door which has a fine selection of fresh fruits,vegetables, meats,fish,wine, breads, pastry and a home store. Other stores from shoes to what every you desire. Fine brasseries, gardens like the Luxembourg Gardens and churches. Doesn't feel touristy.

Saint Germaine des Pres Quarter. Walked it several times feeling very happy to be there. Lots of trendy restaurants, had lovely meal in several restaurants! Our lovely Paris hotel, BAUME, was in the Larin Quarter.

Saint Germain des Pres Quarter. We visited as many areas of Paris as we could and were never disappointed! We were able to walk to most areas and loved walking and you are able to enjoy and see more this way!

St Germain has it all.. We stayed 8 days at Citadines St Germain but this review is not about the hotel but about St Germain.This was a first lengthy stay in Paris and to stay in the 6th arrondissement at St Germain was perfect.St Germain is close to all the iconic attractions of Paris, you are vertically on top of Notre Dame, a short walk to the Louvre, a shorter walk to the Luxembourg Gardens a good walk to the Eiffel Tower. If walking is not your thing you are close to St Michel Metro and RER station.St Germain has a vibe, a feeling, you can spend you evenings just wandering the streets feeling safe and people watch, sit in one of the many cafes and have a coffee or enjoy a great meal in fine restaurant.The perfect place to stay in Paris.

Nightlife at its best. This is an excellent place to get a taste for Parisian night life. And a cacophony of food styles to choose from - its a great way to spend and evening with friends or dancing with your partner. Don't be surprised to see some celebrities there too...
Perfect location in our view. Wonderful location for hotel, dining and easy walking to all areas. Not the loud tourist spots like the latin quarter etc. We loved this area!
Best Location. Great location for exploring all the best sight Paris has to offer. Wonderful choice - lots of opticians for some reason something for everyone whatever the budget
chocolate. Chocolate shops--ahh heaven! A discounted designer clothing store, arcaded cobbled private streets with good restaurants just off the boulevards.
Great area. What a fun area to stay in! The sidewalk cafes have friendly waiters, the streets are lively with music and interesting small shops.

French Wine and Cheeses. Glad we did not miss this one. A perfect start to the morning such great wine and cheeses. The only bad thing was that we were left in an area that we did not know and with very little help from our guide when she was done. It was like she could not get home quick enough. She lived in the neighborhood. (Viator)

Beautiful area but not easy to get around efficiently.. This is a beautiful area of the City but fairly challenging to get around by Metro and even the bus! We wanted to just hop on the bus and ride it around their entire route but that wasn't possible and when we had to retrace our bus route and steps it was terribly difficult getting back to our original spots. The area is beautiful--we loved the tree-lined streets, the variety of shops, and restaurants. It is a very attractive area of Paris and we enjoyed seeing it but not navigating it!
One of my favourite areas in Paris. Elegant & Charming and Paris personified. Shopping, restaurants, parks on your doorstep. We felt reasonably safe walking late at night.
Strolling is tops. Perfect area to stroll, shop,, eat and do a bit of sightseeing. Interesting stores, some very tiny and some.beautiful.

Spent so much time here. With only 5 days in Paris, I would have thought I'd visit once, but I kept being drawn back into the Saint Germain des Pres's arms. Great shops, wonderfully friendly people, great cafes. When we go back, we'll be staying in the 6th for certain.

Art, artefacts, people, food and wine. Quintessential Paris.. We love this part of Paris and will stay here again when we return. One always returns to Paris. They have an international exhibition of Asian art this week, so all the galleries are open extend hours. This area has a great vibe, with excellent eateries and sights.

Love to walk. I love to walk around looking at the beautiful architecture.If you notice a lot of the buildings in Paris have the architects name carved into the stone.
There is always something interesting to see wandering the streets.

Let your nose guide your feet. I would tell everyone to put on their most comfortable shoes, allow for some room in your stomach and walk the neighborhood, stopping every now and then when you see a pastry that strikes your fancy, a sandwich that seems appetizing and a piece of fruit that calls you. This is a one of a kind quartier.

Best neighborhood in Paris!. By far, the best neighborhood in Paris. Stay here if you have a chance during your next trip to Paris and you won't regret it. It's beautiful and safe and very close to all of the attractions and the metro. Don't miss it!
Top area for a walkabout in Paris.. If you are looking for a wonderful walkabout in Paris, this is the top area, full of beautiful architecture and the essence of French culture in its ambience.
One of the nicest areas to wander. Always a favourite to wander this area. Never tire of it, so many shops, narrow streets, something new around the corner.
Best area to stay in Paris. You want to visit every other area - but you want to stay in St. Germain! It has everythign and is convenient to everything.
Still the best neighbourhood!. This area still holds the title for the most energetic neighbourhood. Lots of brilliant restaurants, great wine bars, and boutique shops. R. xx

Nice neighborhood to see Paris life.. Be sure to stop by the Deyrolle taxidermy shop on rue de Bac which is really more than just taxidermy. Lots of interesting stuff & really good butterfly & insect displays.
Evening in Paris. It is very diverse interesting street with many luxury french shops. Fun place to spend an evening. It is very lively and you could just walk around the neighborhood.
Perfect place to sit at a cafe. This is such a great area of Paris. The streets are lovely and the cafes are all very good. You get more of a neighborhood local feel here vs the Champs Elysee.
Real Heart of Paris. I do believe that St Germain has the real soul of Paris that all foreigners want to see and feel while visiting it. A must go place while in Paris.

Spend an afternoon walking all over this area.... I love this area- walk all around, stop for crepes, stop for people watching at Cafe Flore or Au Deux Magots, oysters at Huitres Regis- lots of boutiques and unique shops...
The center of it all. This area is close to everything and has great shopping and restaurants. We stayed here and felt in the center of it all.
Vibrant part of Paris . Enjoy the cafes and the surroundings , it's an excellent place to go and sit ,especially at night near the fountain. Avoid late night visits .

A must-see when in Paris. Walk down the streets, absorb the sights, smell the air, and sense the Parisien ambience as you stroll by. Hello, Paris! This is what you will find yourself murmuring as your eyes wander down the streets. It is lively, inviting and very interesting. Definitely worth a visit.

VERY COOL!. This part of Paris is very diverse and we loved it! Lots of various ethnicities, lots to see, and lots of things to try...from food, to going into little grocery stores, to souvenier shops...the vibe here is great!

A place to be seen. One of the main boulevard in Paris, where you can find most of the famous and well known luxury French shops. Take some time to visit the Café de Flore, which is famous for the artists who came there.
Famous surroundings. A fascinating avenue with a lot of interesting buildings and cafes where, once,some of the most talentrd writers used to spend time talking over a cup of coffee.

Lively, Exciting, the place to be at any age. The left bank has many somethings for everyone. Find all of yours here. Incomparable. There is a vibrancy in the 5th and 6th arrondissements of Paris (they basically make up the left bank or "Rive Gauche") which is hard to find elsewhere in Paris, or in the rest of the world for that matter. Go see for yourself and enjoy.

Lovely neighbourhood. We loved walking around this neighbourhood. Not too crowded with tourists and pretty clean. There are many cute restaurants on the little streets and it is so convenient if you stay nearby
Busy and average. Okay, plenty of places to see and eat at but I felt there were better places in the city to walk about. Latin quarter just seemd more fun.
night one, our first sample if French Dining. great stuff, friendly staff and would eat here again. the service was good and menu selection was diverse. brilliant.
Les Deux Magots. Wonderful, quaint area! Great shops but without tourist feel. Beautiful walk from Hotel De Ville and the Marais district.
Enjoying the real Paris. Great area to experience the real Paris, with plenty of stressed cafes and restaurants. Ideal for people watching and relaxing.
Paris visit 2015. Another great part of our journey. Walking through Paris you can't help but visit these landmarks. Love the architecture.
Great quarter. Great quarter, one of the richest and of the best saved. Great above all for a walking around at night.

An Excelent Choice to Stay in Paris. This is an excelent place in Paris to book a hotel and make your base. Choose a hotel close to Boulevard Saint Michel and you will stay at foot distance from one of the most famous landmarks of the city: The Cathedral of Notre Dame.
Great place to spend some time in Paris!. There are so many classy bars and restaurants here in this arrondissment. The location is great and so close to other many must sees in Paris.

Beautiful and fun area. We loved walking around this quarter and seeing the antique stores, high fashion, AND the chocolate and macaroon/candy shops. Google the St Germain chocolate walking tour. We did it and enjoyed. See the Delacroix museum while in this area.

Best part of Paris. All Paris spirit is there and if you manage to escape the tourist flow then it becomes really a wonderful moment . Do not hesitate to windows hop the art galleries but negotiate if you think actually buying.
The Arty, Foody side of Paris. Amble the small side streets, experience the art and food of this area, topped off with a visit to St. Sulpice and St- Germaine des Pres, the oldest church in Paris.

Mesmerizing Quartier Latin!. I fyou would like to "fly back to the past" and feel as if you were in Paris back in the 1800's, the Quartier Latin is the place (among others) to go. The congenial atmosphere resulting from the abundant young population (the Sorbonne university is right there!) is captivating. Bookstores, museums, churches and anything else that you may want to relate to earlier eras can be found here.
I ruby in the middle of diamonds.. Definitely do not miss this - Such a beautiful part of Paris and captures what I always thought Paris would be! It's a gem!

Heart of hearts.. This is the heart within the art of Paris and where the history of literature, romance and the independance of America was written in its treaty. It is a place that vibrates with life and colour as the sun fades from the sky and the light of evening descends. It is a people place, to look, listen, and join the passing throng.

My love , my heart , I love it here. I visited this quarter many years back and fell in love with it. So when I decided to go to Paris (staying here now) I decided to stay in the 6th and I'm so happy to be here It's beautiful , cleaner than the other arr. full of cafes and shops and beautiful gardens and antique shops and cool stores and just what I imagine Paris to be like

Our favorite neighborhood in Paris. The cafes, bistros and brasseries are light, airy and a delightful way to spend a few hours after wandering the streets and their unique shops. Getting there by Metro, Velib bike or Batobus was easy as could be. We did not stay in the neighborhood, but will look closely for a nice place on our next visit.

Great place to find a bite to eat. Wandered through here on way from the Louvre to Notre-Dame, more by accident than design, followed the Rue de la Seine which opened up onto some charming little streets packed with restaurants, cafes, bars and ice-cream parloursReasonably priced meals, good choice and we were not disappointed.Wandered through first day, then came back to eat the second, finding a great seafood / mussels restaurant.

Lost Generation alive and well. So iconic it seems silly to say anything that hasn't been said. Hemingway, Fitzgerald, Joyce, Dos Passos and many others stomping grounds, drank, communed, shared each others girl friends and boyfriends, reflected disenchantment with post war Europe while trapped between the end of one war and the coming cloud of Facism. The streets, gutters buildings and sounds are all the same -- but how is the world different, how are we different and what did those gifted artists see and feel that we may not? Or do? Go and wander, take the artists walks which are great …also stop and close your eyes and listen and imagine the world they were in a moment ago.

excellent emplacement (Excellent Location). We stayed in this area this past August Bank Holiday weekend. Lots to do and see. Excellent shopping and designer stores. You can get the metro from Gare du Nord for 1€ 80c.Make sure you go to the organic market on Sunday morning. Crepes, fresh bread, cheese and lots of other delights. Great, central area for seeing all the tourist sights. Cannot wait to return.

Excellent service and location. The hotel lived up to our expectations. Though it was not a very large hotel it offered all we needed, being as we were aiming to spend most of our time exploring Paris. Our room was very comfortable, quiet and of suitable size, though some rooms were smaller than ours. Service was excellent - any queries we had were answered professionally; and every time we entered or left the hotel we were politely greeted or wished an enjoyable time. As it was located in the heart of the Latin Quarter, walking distance from Notre Dame and the Metro, this was an ideal location for exploring different parts of the city. Overall I recommend the hotel and would return again.

Small street side restaraunts with lots of character and a must to to get lost down the small cobbled streets. This is a great place to get lost in , with the Latin Quarter close by and fantastic restaurants that are tucked away , however be careful the restaraunts can be expensive as they are close to the Notre Dame Cathedral/River Seine etc , also check your food , I oredered a Salad Nicoise which is a Tuna Salad at a small street side restaraunt and was disappointed as it quite clearly was tinned tuna and not chunks of a steak of tuna!!! However the House Cabernet Sauvignon was a big plus and a few glasses of the deep red oak it was forgotten .
A must to visite. Nice area for shopping and restaurants.A must see.Very live area .Trendy shopping Famous cafe to drink a nice glass of Champagne
St Germain has always been a favourite. Just love the St Germain area - who doesn't It has everything, Restaurants, boutiques, Les Deux Magots for a coffee, cocktail, patisserie and people watching.
Saint Germain des Pres. Very nice neighborhood with the old medieval buildings and streets. Little shops, bookshops, restaurants, touristic, nice.

Religious or not, take a moment to peep inside and examine the oldest church in Paris.... Saint Germain des Pres.. In this ancient area you will find the oldest church in Paris, Saint Germain des Pres, right on the corner. Patronised by famous writers, celebrities and fashion conscious visitors it lives up to its reputation in interest with Cafe des Flores, Les Deux Margots, Brasserie Lipp and many other famous institutions. Sit here and watch the world go by as so many others have before you!

Love this area. This area of Paris is so fun and cool. There are a ton of cool side walk cafes to stop and have a drink or snack and people watch. This area has so much charm. The buildings are unique and the people are extremely friendly. This area seems to be far less touristy Champs Elysees. We really enjoyed our tour in Saint-Germain.

Will Come here Again!. Stayed here on our second trip and loved it. Honestly the best shops, food and atmosphere. We rented an apartment for a week and lived like locals- enjoyed the shopping, the cafes and the restaurants.
amazing. what a wonderful place to hang out, done and feel the vibe of Paris, this place seems to be vibrant 24 hours per day.lol I believe some bars never close. well worth the visit.

My favorite neighborhood. A great spot for food and shopping. Stop by Deux Magots for a great lunch and people-watching. Fun shops on nearly every side street, including clothes, jewelry, perfumeries, and art.

Second time staying there. I did not know just how trendy this spot is when we booked out hotel. We stayed at Hotel La Perle and Hotel Luxembourg both an easy walk There are many restaurants, bakeries, gelato shops, wine cafes, and café to choose from. You are walking distance to the Bon Marche and the Bon Marche food court for some real fun. There are many other small shops to nose around in. Most important there are several metro stops for the different lines that allow a quick above ground walk from becoming a long underground walk for connecting lines. The café in the picture for this site has the worlds best chocolate- it is like drinking brownies!
Loved the Saint-Germaine Area!. This is one of the most beautiful areas in Paris. It is very classy and full of great cafes and shops.
Good place to stop for coffee or snack..... There are alllot of street side cafe's in Paris and Nice...this one is very good and we would recommed for coffe and pastry or small meal...

Shop, sit at a cafe and people watch...lots to do and see. You can literally wonder around for hours and still discover a new section of chic boutiques and coffee bars in this area.Really a great place to sit and people watch and just enjoy Paris..
Quaint area. We got "lost in St Germaine a few times while in Paris. Charming cafes and flower shops that you don't want to miss. Wander the streets in this area.

Last Place in Paris without tourists... Saint Germain is the last place in Paris were you don't see too many tourists and its still fun. Great shopping and great restaurants. You can spend 2 days there easily.

Great Paris neighborhood for chocolates and cafes. Great neighborhood to walk around, shop, and people watch. My wife loved the area for its chocolate shops and I enjoyed the lovely cafe's lining the streets and people watching.

A great place to get lost. During our recent one week stay we spend a lot of time exploring the bars and cafes of Saint-Germain-des-Pres Quarter. We were lost many times in its maze of streets but we did not care as the dining and bars are wonderful.
Worth visiting. Great fun, highly recommend spending time in this area. Wonderful shopping and food, and solid people watching.

FOODIE WALKING TOUR. We where on holiday in Paris with Rail Disscoveries and one of the activities was a "food walking tour" of this area with a local guide What a lovely area , had a really nice Atmosphere , you didn't really feel you were in a huge city , it was quiet and relaxed we made some stops on the way and sampled some local cheese , bread , fruit etc if we ever go back to Paris we will defo go again and this time stop in one of the many cafe's go it's well worth it
Nice area. Take a walk in these quarters and just admire the buildings and the high standards that surround this area, sit down for whatever you choose to drink in the numerous bars and cafés.

Dig into the little alleyways.... Beautiful but need to be closer to the Mutuelle and rue Mouftard area.... Otherwise it is too crowded and touristic. There are still plenty of book stores and little bistros worth visiting, the best is to buy from local fresh food market and picnic.

wonderful safe area. wonderful, chic, safe area, clean, easy walking distance. Bon march dept store food hall is a must - we were in awe! bakery, butchers, pharmacy close to each other near St Placide Metro.

Walking in the footsteps of "Bon Vivants" past. Quintessential Paris area...great cafes, wide walkable sidewalks, shops and people-watching! Former locale of famous literary greats and noted ex-pats in the early part of the 20th century, prior to WWII. Busy yet peaceful most of the time now, with availability year-round.
Very cool area in Paris. Very cool area in Paris, lots of restaurants and bistro but also nice library, cinema, ice cream places

Lovely neighborhood to enjoy a Parisien Afternoon.. Love this place, just spending an afternoon walking through the streets in this neighborhood gives you a real feeling of what the Paris lifestyle is all about. Rue St Andre des Arts takes you from St Michel Notre Dame all the way to St Germain des Pres and is full of coffee shops, markets, restaurants, bars, etc.

The place to be at night. Busy, vibrant but not as chaotic as the latin 1/4. Found a beautiful restaurant or two - Le Petit Benoir - I would strongly recommend. (with Ben & Jerry's for dessert!!!!) Enjoy

Favourite Parisian neighbourhood. While everything in this picturesque Parisian neighbourhood might be pricey, it's worth it to sit outside at Les Deux Magots or Cafe de Flore and watch the world go by. It's a beautiful area of Paris.
Nice area. Lovely area to walk around, lots of nice shops and many places to eat, not far from the river and many other tourist areas.
Amazing. Paris is magic! Take some time and visit this space. Great people watching. Food options are endless.
just lovely. Fantastic brasseries and shops, lovely walk around without masses of tourists with selfie sticks. Don't plan, just wander around tiny streets and enjoy Paris

Classic. If this is possible today, this is part of Paris that still holds the spirit of the old times. Ideal for sitting in the sidewalk café for hours, sipping your coffee, watching the crowd and imagine the times that have passed away...

The Medieval Heart of Paris. A wonderfully fairy tale like spot to see in Paris! We stayed for a week and the location was fantastic. Literally a stone's throw from the Notre Dame, the Pantheon and the Luxembourg gardens. Walk along the narrow cobblestone avenues and pop into a patisserie for a pastry. Stroll past the cafés Madame famous by Hemingway and his fellow artistic brethren.

A collage of Parisian and international places to choose from. Wonderful, amazing views of the Saine on the bank of the river. Myriad of wonderful restaurants and bistros to enjoy the views from no matter where you are. Fashionable stores just nearby not as expensive as Champs Elysees, near the Katin Quarter where you could find a variety of stores and international food along with fois gras on the same line. Enjoy!

Parisian Princesse. The church is splendid, but avoid cafe de Flore which is overpriced with horrible service. Go towards Saint Sulpice to buy fashionable clothes, the to rue Princesse for a drink, meal... like a true Parisian princesse
Food. Cafe on the corner was wonderful - French food, the atmosphere - made the trip memorable and now I would live to return

Classic Parisian spot to experience Lost Generation cafe culture. If the Paris of your dreams is that of the artist and cafe culture of Hemingway and his cadre of Lost Generation expats, then this is the home-base for you. While it has most certainly been gentrified since Hemingway's day, it still retains the bohemian flavor that sets it apart from the glitzier right bank neighborhoods. Any visit to Paris must include some time spent sitting in a sidewalk cafe in Saint-Germain-des-Pres, and one could spend hours, or days, in the restaurants, cafes, shops, and gardens in this neighborhood. It is a perfect,centrally located home base that has a good balance of authentic Parisian flavor while still being safe and accessible for almost any tourist.
Position........ What an area to visit, full of cafes, shops and people. A real buzz, great place to stay central to everything.

One of my favorite quartiers!. I love the vibe in this quartier. It reminds me of when I was studying here and I would go to the FNAC afterwards and then enjoy a cafe with thousands of gorgeous Parisians and watch the world go by. Plenty of fab restaurants tucked away here, too. You just have to dig a bit.

Probably the best place in Paris. This district has it all : great restaurants, cafés, bars&pubs, nightlife, hotels, shops, great history, great bookshops…It's a must-see place if you're visiting Paris.
Charming area. Paris the way it was.. We walked this area almost every day we were in Paris. The narrow streets, shops, and cafes are Paris the way it was hundreds of years ago. You are back in time.
Great Place to stay. We were lucky enough to stay in Saint-Germain and I would definitely be staying there again... close enough to everything without the insanity of all the tourists
Very Lively Area of Paris!. Great area to walk, shop or just sit and enjoy the people watching while sipping a glass of wine or coffee.

Loved it!. One of my favourite area in Paris! It is for artists, really. All of our Hungarian poets lived in this area, Endre Ady, Attila Jozsef... and I have to say: yes, of course, it is very boheme!

St Germain district is vibrant.. This area of Paris is alive with vibrant energy and life. Many restaurants to sit, pause and take in Paris. A glass of wine and people watch. Stroll through the narrow cobblestone roads to discover Paris.The Metro is convenient. The Beautiful Seine a short stroll. Notre Dame not far. I have stayed in this area and also the Tulerie Garden area. I have visited the beautiful Le Marais area but still in love with St Germain. Solo travellers, couples this area is for you. Just love it.

Lovely, Parisian neighborhood. Beautiful, lovely neighborhood! Lots of cafes and boutique shopping. We felt very safe simply strolling the streets and taking in the Parisian lifestyle. Highly recommend!

Beautiful, paris at its best.. Saint Germain is one of the best places in a Paris for a stroll with a loved one. The shopping is excellent and not as busy as the Grand Boulevards. Make sure you stop for a drink and people watch at either Les Deux Maggots or the wonderfully unchanged Cafe De Flore, expect to pay premium. If its night life your after head down Rue De Buci, dine at Le Germain and take your pick from over 8 bars on this cute street. If your after some celebrity spotting or a non touristic decadent dance club try Le Montana- make sure you contact them before, its locals only and entrance can be very very hard.

stay away from tourist traps. We all dream of sitting in a street café, sip a drink and watch the world go by. They can be super expensive ( 5 Euros for a small soda, 12 Euros for a cocktail!) so review prices before ordering and check out the restaurant reviews on TA before ordering food. Went to one place in this quarter (called cafe metro) where the food turned out almost inedible and was too expensive. Check out the small ethnic restaurants in the smaller streets of this area. Also Leon de Bruxelles chain for mussels. Have cash to pay for food in case CC are not accepted.

Loved the section of Paris!!. This section of Paris was so quaint. Designer shops and regular store fronts. This where I did most of my shopping. Something to remember, is that there are only two times a year for sales. I was there during one and it was July. Everywhere, where signs telling us about the sales going on at the time. So, I saved so much on the shopping that I was able to do, that I had money for other things!! The streets in this area get more narrow the closer you get to the river. It will go down to only pedestrian traffic. Again, I loved it. Had lunch there in a fine, little open air cafe. Don't miss this section of Paris.
relaxing evening in paris. Relaxing time in one of the finest neighborhood, take a walk, enjoy french delicacies or sip in wine & enjoy people watching
Parisian style. one of the best areas to stroll in Paris. For women, it is a paradise, nice cosy cafes, some boutiques, no annoying immigrants passing by, clean and safe.

Favourite area in Paris. My favourite area of Paris! It's just lovely to spend an afternoon wandering the beautiful streets, stopping off at bistros for drinks and food. There's also a huge Monoprix, and the Pantheon is in the area which is well worth a visit!

My favourite part of Paris. Le Marais is supposedly the trendiest part now, but I love this area best with its little narrow streets and cafes.
So close to the Seine too, the lifeline of the city.
Quite a let down.. We went here as it was reccomended to us that this is a great area to eat and go out in at night. We had the worst meal and found a few below average 'pubs'. I would not return.

Romantic visit to Paris. Lively area with intersting shops, bars, live street music and many great restaurants, very close to Jardin de luxembourg to sit and chill a while amongst lovely gardens. This would be a good area for choice of hotel with so much to see.
One of the best place in Paris. It is very nice place to chill out in Paris. A very safe area with lots of shops and restaurants nearby.

One of the most loved neighborhoods in Paris. I love this area for its shops, restaurants, cafes, bakeries and many well-known attractions. This is the neighborhood of Hemingway and friends. A trip to Paris is incomplete without spending a few hours in this charming and historic area.

St. Germain: Boutiques, Tranquility & Cafe Society. A district that continues to shine and evolve--don't miss it! Get off the main drag and find shops (CosmoParis), fine Chocolate (Henri Le Roux) and restaurants (Le Procape). As I often have, I stayed on the Champs in the 8th District and, again, I was disappointed I didn't plant myself squarely in St Germain. For those who may know NYC it's like the difference between staying midtown vs. staying in the Meatpacking District. Forget the Champs Elysees (don't care what hotel), find something small and elegant in the 6th District and enjoy the peace and boutique nature of St. Germain.
Fun place day and night. very crowded and fun place to walk around, shop, and nightlifeor get picnic food and eat at park. close to everything
beautiful neighborhood. Another one of my favorite neighborhoods in Paris. Enjoy the walk around the area, window shop and don't miss the oldest church in Paris - Saint Germain-des-Pres.

The place to stay. This area of Paris is full of excellent restaurants and shops. True it's a little pricey but this is Paris after all. Metros and subways are easily found and just as easy to use. The streets are clean and outdoor cafes are very inviting
Wander to your hearts' content.. Beautiful boulevards with leafy shady trees, classic Parisienne cafes and many boutiques make this area sublime.
A highlight. Definitely worth a visit. I found this area my favourite place to visit while we were in Paris. Great little shops.

This is a great place to see and do in Paris. The Saint- Germain-des-Pres Quarter, is one of those places you don want to miss. The food, the shops, the people.
You could easily spend a day walking around and soaking up the bookstalls, and the famous cafes.

We wanted to go again.... we enjoyed touring this area immensely, well worth the experience.
So much so, we wanted to go again, but didn't have the time...I guess we'll have to go back...

Even Though I was On Crutches. An unexpected injury almost wiped out the time I'd planned to stay after a tour and spend 4 days on the Left Bank. And it did drastically cut my list of things to do. However, I did use taxis and hobble well enough to see the book stalls on the river, the oldest church in Paris, eat & drink at Le Prix du Clercs, see Les Deux Magots (the rumored cost of a cup of coffee kept me from sitting down - my speed was more Le Prix du Clerc) and the brasserie where Hemingway often ate and Woody Allen showed at least the outside of in "Midnight in Paris" (they are kitty-cornered) across the boulevard. I loved the area and even so feel cheated and want to go back as soon as I can. I also made it to the Musee d'Orsay and will write about it separately.
Favorite area of Paris. Favorite area of Paris for meals, nightlife and chocolate/bakery shops. The night time was amazing, with street performers, excellent cocktail bars and restaurants.

times gone by.. The sense of Recent history hangs heavy in this part of Paris not just 1968 but the influx of writers from the States and painters at the beginning of the 20 th century. Old bookstores, caffees, the Academie Des Beaux Arts the wall with graffiti where Serge Gainbourgh lived a place where ideas still come easily.
St. Germain. A wonderful variety of shops, restaurants and beautiful architecture make is a pleasure to stroll around this lovely neighborhood.

One of the best areas!. We recently stayed near this area and I would highly recommend to anyone for their 1st visit or 100th!There are loads of cafes, restaurants, bookshops etc so you'll never be bored. It's the type of area where something interesting lies around every corner. We had a rough plan of some of the bookshops we wanted to see, and there was so many interesting little finds around....a fountain here...an interesting building there just grab your camera, a comfy pair of shoes and away you go!One of the highlights of Paris!

Lively, historical area on the Left Bank. This area on the Left Bank was once at the forefront of the city's intellectual life in the 1950s,a nd still has major publishing houses located there. The area is now shared with high fashion, where one can find spots like Yves Saint Laurent's posh premises. There are many good restaurants, cafes and movie theatres. Famous restaurants like Les Deux Maggots, Cafe de Flore and Brasserie Lipp can be found in Saint Germain. Wonderful musuems like the Musee d'Orsay (ranked #1 Paris attraction on Trip Advisor) are located in this area. Want a different type of museum? Try the Musee Nationale de la Legion d'Honneur, where one can learn all about the Legion of Honor, a decoration launched by Napoleon I and cherished by French and foreigners. Napoleon's Legion of Honour is on display here. Other decorations, such as the British Victoria Cross and the American Purple Heart, are also featured here. Try Le Procope, which claims to be the world's coffeehouse, founded in 1686. Patrons included Voltaire and Napoleon. Quel history!

Quintessentially French Quartier and my Favourite in Paris. Coffee, gelati, just wandering and window shopping 'Je juste regarde'. St Germain de Pres is a lovely area to spend an afternoon. Include a visit to the beautiful church and you may be lucky enough to strike a concert or musicians tuning up ... At present along the fence of the Church (the oldest in Paris) are various posters describing the archeology of Paris and the various studiens in progress - all detailed in both French and English.Close the afternoon with a gelati from Amorino - wonderful quality and flavours.
Must see to feel the Paris , not just see the monuments. This is Paris I like , not anymore famous turistic attractions, walking here, eating, enjoying bistros, ...Quartier Latine rules

Restos and shops. My husband and I walked around the area it has lots of restos , galleries, pattiseries to consider. We happened to talk to a friendly local and suggested to have dinner in the area and skip the known cafe. It was 5ish in the afternoon after a long day of getting lost at the louvre, we wanted to save our bellies for an authentic french cuisine. We came too early as they start serving dinner at 7 and we were already seeing stars. We resorted to an american-french fusion which is not bad at all. We spent the rest of the evening people watching and chatting with fellow tourists and locals. We walked further, and saw a bazzar with lots of good stuff. It was a nice stroll.

Best area to stay. We loved this area. This was our first time to Paris and we stayed in this district. Goo shopping, resturaunts, sights, and close to the metro. It seamed very safe and we will stay here again.
Love. Wonderful place to stay in Paris! Close to metro, restaurants, shops and grocery. Highly recommend if looking for an apartment for family.
Hip and Busy. This was a busy area and walking required navigating people. There were many street performers, many boutiques and cafes. It was a fun atmosphere.
Lively. Lively area and full of very nice restaurants. Nice to walk down and mingle with the crowds or sit at a Cafe and watch.

Best area to stay in Paris. Especially for first-timers.. We visited on April of 2014. We were first-timers and were worried we would not be able to get around easily. Luckily I found a lovely flat (via airbnb) right behind the St Germain church. The metro stop is on the opposite side of the church. I couldn't have asked for a better location. You can, if you're inclined to see more, walk to; the Louvre, Notre Dame, lock bridge (removed my lock and all others!), and more from here. There is a nice street market area about a couple of blocks from the church where you can find restaurants, markets, and other food. There's a Paul bakery which has an absolutely delightful country bread. You also have L'avant Comptoir nearby which is a must stop. We ate there 3 of the 5 nights we were in town.

Cafe De Flore & Les Deux Magots. This quartier is amazing. the roads are nice and the best thing is the cafe trotoir where you sit and forget yourself for hours. there is a nice church next to these coffee shops and i recomend that you visit too

My favorite area in Paris. My new favorite area of Paris. Clean, safe, friendly, welcoming, quintessential Paris. I've visited Paris 9 times and never stayed here. Won't ever stay in another area again. St. Germain has everything: lovely hotels, wonderful restaurants & shopping, museums, sights. LOVE!
Lovely area. We love this arrondisement. We enjoy the shops and restaurants. We have stayed in some lovely hotels in this area.

I Loved it. Access to other attractions,many are within walking distance. The metro is also readily accessible. If I had any complaint it would be the prices at the restaurants. I do not believe locals pay such on a regular basis. The feel, architecture, etc. was to me very Parisian. We truly enjoyed our stay in this area. Would we return? Yes. However, simply because I would want to see more of Paris I perhaps would select a different location for our hotel on our next visit but I would also stroll around this area just for nostalgia sake.

City Pharma. Whilst you are walking around this area it is worth popping into City Pharma on the corner of Rue du Four. This is supposed to be the cheapest supplier of beauty products in Paris and is full of women with baskets of cut price beauty goods and very long queues. It doesn't stock every brand but has Nuxe, Caudalie, Biotherm, etc.

Perfect Neighborhood for Exploring Paris. We walked all over Paris from Saint-Germain. It is so easy to navigate, even as English only speakers! There are many cafes, bakeries, ice cream shops and boutiques here. Getting around the city is easy from here..
Wonderful upmarket area of Paris. A wonderful up market area of Paris with amazing shops, restaurants and cafes.We stayed in try area and loved it and would not hesitate to stay here again.

My favorite 'hood in all of Paris. This is my favorite area to stay in Paris. The closest I will come to feeling like a real Parisioner. Love people watching and just sitting at a cafe people watching. Life is good here. Everyone we meet was totally charming and helpful.

Get anywhere easily ~. This was our first trip to Paris and we are so fortunate to have selected this neighborhood to reside for our week adventure. Ease - ready cafes and bistros, easy walk to Luxembourg Gardens, Musee d'Orsay, subway stops taking one in multiple directions. If you are up for walking - and covering a lot of ground easily - this is a perfect peaceful somewhat local place to lay one's head.

The best by far. St Germain des-Pres is the most wonderful area to stay in Paris, it is not as hectic as the main tourist areas so an excellent place to relax after a day sightseeing. There is an abundance of cafes, bars, restaurants and creperies. The transport links are fantastic with several bus stops and metro stations within easy reach. If you want to shop then there is a huge selection of boutique shops to choose from.
Paris by night. Wow, that place was full of life, plenty of restaurants, bars, souvenirs, and people all over...a lot of singing and laughing, nice to have dinner there...
Great area!. Great restaurants bars near this area. We really enjoyed the Latin Quarter which is where our flat was located. This is a great location to stay to be centrally located.

Relaxing pavement cafes. Full of great pavement cafes to sit and watch the world walk by and before you know you will have seen a couple of hours walk past such a great place to sit talk over a glass of wine.

My favorite area to shop, eat and people watch. There are so many cute little boutiques, lovely and delicious cafes and plenty of interesting little places to stop and people watch. It is very clean in this area and the architecture is just lovely! I find myself strolling here often when in Paris.

take your sweet time and explore. A dignifed parisian neighborhood with roots of grandeur. Look up and see those balconies and details in the stucco. We found the perfect picnic items in a number of delicatessen stores and a bottle of red for under 10euro we would pay $25 here for. amazing value of you look hard enough. If you try your rusty french don't be upset to be blown off some. keep trying!

The abets Area in Paris.. This is probably one of the best neighbourhoods in Paris. So much to see and do and also is the location of the Jardin du Luxembourg Gardens, which are just divine. You could spend a shore day there!,
Great location. Stayed at an appartment through airbnb. Great location to everything. Hired velib bikes and rode aling water to Eiffle Tower. Excellent access to all forms of transport.
Great restaurants. District full of good restaurants, cafes and people. A part of Paris you to go and enjoy some great food.

Great area To Stay. This is such a great location providing many walking options for attractions and some lovely little restaurants, bars,markets and close metros. Feels like the real Paris. We have stayed in many areas but this is our favourite.
hard to keep purse in bag!!. Have to visit cafe maggot/fleur for their chocolate biennial sit people watching. Beautiful umbrella shop up the road

Joie de vivre in Saint-Germain-des-Pres. Lots of shops, restaurants, and galleries. Some are a little pricey. But there's always a lot of activity---usually street music or street performers. We spend 3 months every summer in Paris, and this is where we rent an apartment.

The dogs almost got my Jambon de Paris!. This is a magical place. The open air markets are so lovely even in the freezing cold of December. I was in search for a lovely ham by the name of Jonbon de Paris. As I tasted many similar hams this is the one that I was going to get back to the U.S. Or die trying. The store owner cryovaced two pound wonder for me. I kept it hanging outside my hotel window for three days to keep it fresh. After making it through customers I thought I was home free.Then the drug sniffing dogs were in the distance. I kept moving my luggage to avoid this little hound. Thank god I threw out the stinky cheese before the flight. That never would have made it.I saw an opening and seized it...home free.Victory was mine and it never tasted so good!

Love this part of Paris, especially at night with street musicians. Great area to stroll thru day and night with wonderful cafes and restaurants, shops and beautiful architecture. Listen to jazz played in the streets at night while eating a gelato....mmmm.

Get Lost in the City. One of my favorite places to just hangout and people watch. Lots of cool shops and great restaurants. This are has some off the beaten track alleys that you can explore and get lost at.
THE best corner for watching Parisians. The oldest church in Paris? Vraiment? And lunch at Les Deux Magots. Don't imbibe too much, as there's a Loius Vuitant store right around the corner.

Bursting with life. The most popular quarter of Paris with tourists and quite rightly so with its eclectic collection of shops, bars, restaurants, theatres and hang-outs for the rich, famous and wannabees. You can never be disappointed here, check out the little alleyways, those hidden treasures often reveal themselves more interesting than the bigger 'names'.
Go there when the sun goes down. Full of people and lots of lights and talk. Great Place to have fun and eat. Better go there when sun goes down.

Nice neighborhood. Beautiful neighborhood, a stroll along the main road will offer a great deal of locations that you can admire. There are also quite a few restaurants and bars in the area. I stayed close to this area and each day, started with a walk on this streets.

A Fun Place To Explore. Granted like the Latin Quarter it has its touristy areas, but still is great for people watching. Luxembourg Gardens is located in the 6th Arrondissement and is always great. There are also some local restaurants that are popular with the locals!

It's worth a visit. If you have limited time and have to make a choice... go to Ile St Louis before here as it is more beautiful... but if you have time to wander then this is an area to include in your travels. It is worth a visit for the culture, the architecture and just to take in Paris on a quieter level.
Great area to stay in.. A beautiful area to stay in- elegant shops and within easy walking distance of main attractions and Metro.
Wonderful shops. Just strolling through this quarter you will feel the energy of young people in Paris. Shops, restaurants and clubs fill every street.

Best neighborhood in Paris..... This is the only neighborhood I would consider staying in - it isn't near the sights but it is a destination in of itself. There are restaurants, cafes, shops, stores, delis, markets, wine shops, and yes, a Starbucks ! all within a 12 block area - you can walk around and truly get the Paris experience.

A great neighborhood!. Sidewalk cafes, unique shops and lots of people watching, this a great neighborhood for late afternoon into evening walks. We choose to stroll, stop, imbide and move to the next block. Such fun!!
the shopping center. a wonderful mix of the leading brand names as well as independant shops offering a wide range. Excellent also for restuarants and bars as well as local history.

Very quaint and quantiessential Parisien experience. While you will see tourists, this area is filled with quiet streets, cafes, boutiques and charm! You can spend the day walking and plan to eat lunch at any. Brasserie and desert at a cafe.
Great area. Great area. Really buzzing and full of life. Be careful crossing the roads though as zebra crossings are more for decoration than function! Cross with confidence but stay aware.
So much to see. You need good shoes to make the most of this area. We walked from dawn until dusk. There are interesting shops and wonderful restaurants. Plenty to keep you busy for a day or more.

The best area in the city to see and be seen!. Tres chic. Dress up for the show. People watch in Cafe Deuc Magots and Flor on the Blvd St Germain.expensive but you pay for your seat and can stay almost all day with one drink! Wander around the art galleries on the Rue de Seine, Rue Saint Peres, Rue Bonaparte. Marvel at Asouline bookshop, la Hune bookshop. This has always been the cultural sera for Art and Literature. Everything go feast your eyes. Market Buci for your fruit, supermarkets, cinemas, fast food, chic high end shopping for fashion. 15/7-30/8 is low season and the sales (solders) are on! Metros Mabillion, Saint Germain and Odeon. Walk the other direction to the Seine and wander towards Saint Michel past all the traditional Bouquinists. That is Paris!!!!
Great Shopping. I prefer this area over the Champs Elysee. Boutiques with unique items that you won't find in the states at relatively good prices with Parisian flare. Yes, do shop here!

This is Paris. If more shopping is what you need, walk down the high street here. If people watching is on your agenda, choose a cafe seat here. Enjoy the Bo Ho style different from the main streets of Paris because it's more authentically Parisian.
Bohemian side of Paris. Saint Germain is a must in Paris. It is full of art galleries, boutique hotels, book sellers and nice bistros.
Stop and eat here. Lots of great places to stop eat while enjoying the atmosphere and get tourist gifts too for everyone back home.

45+ years. We like "wondering the streets" of both the Saint-Germain-des-Pres Quarter and the Latin Quarter.
Yes, the area has changed in the last 45 years, but we cherish our memories as 22 year olds in this area, and still find plenty that says Paris to us.

Our second time to stay in this part of the Left Bank.. Overall, we just love this area. Not too crowded, relatively quiet at night, great historic cafes - Brasserie Lipp, Les Deux Magots, Cafe de Flore, great Sunday street market, the 1,000 year-old church. We stayed at Hotel Pont Royal on Rue de Bac, just a short walk from a Metro station, 10 minute walk to the Louvre and d'Orsay. In Paris, the Metro is the key to getting around, so the choice in where to stay depends on your choice of hotels. This is a great neighborhood, and where we have decided to make our home in Paris.
more up market than a lot of Paris. A visit to La Bon Marche is a must as it lnocks spots off Harvey Nicks and anything else on offer in the UK

My favorite place in Paris. The 6th is a great place to wander around looking in shops, stopping at cafes, finding little authentic restaurants that aren't tourists traps and understanding why you come to Paris again and again.

Great food and fun to people watch!. We went to a great tiny and I mean tiny little 'restaurant' called Au Comptoir. We ate where the locals enjoys tapas and delicious glasses of wine. The food, atmosphere and friendly staff were so much fun! The menu is on little photo cards hanging from the ceiling. I ate the best fried mini raviolis ever! We stayed in the area and went to an outdoor restaurant to people watch and have an after dinner drink late at night, it was still booming at midnight.
Great area for a stroll. We were staying narby this area in the Latin Quarter and enjoyed our walks to the many good restaurants and shops here.

great shopping. I love this neighborhood. It is "walkable", it has beautiful architecture, great shops (and Bon Marche!), lovely cafes, Laduree, Pierre Herme, it is next to the Jardins the Luxembourg and the beautiful points des arts.

lovely little neighbourhood. this neighbourhood is called upscale and was a short walk from the latin quarters where we were staying. Lovely high end and affordable boutiques, several good cafes and dining options......just so good for people watching and good food and shopping

A really good area. We were lucky enough to be staying in the area, so we saw a lot it. It has a lot of character and characters. There is a lot to see in the area and lots of restaurants including Le Deux Magots, which was a nice surprise in itself. There is a man across the road who sells crepes till very late in the night and we're delicious.
So different from the Right Bank.. Full of cafes, bars and people enjoying what St Germain has to offer. Get a seat in a cafe and people watch while sipping an espresso or a glass of wine.

Great for Shopping. One of the most renowned quarters of Paris, Saint-Germain-des-Pres has long been a prominent tourist attraction. Its streets are littered with stores and boutiques, so if you are interested in some shopping during your stay in Paris, Saint-Germain-des-Pres is a great place to visit.

An Elegant Neighjborhood. Int he dozen or so times we have been to Paris, the 6th and 7th arrondiseements have become our home away from home. There are many charming neighborhoods in Paris, but this suits us best. Put on your walking shoes and cover one end of Boulevard Saint Germain to the other. Almost every cross street is worth exploring-towards the river or towards Saint Sulpice and the Sorbonne. Much of this quarter is pricey, but with a little planning you can find restaurants and cafes that won't break the bank. Try Marlotte, a fine bistro on Cherche Midi which we have been frequenting for years. We prefer Bonaparte to Deux Maggots for a cafe with some decent food and a nice mix of locals and transients. Les Climats, on the backside of the Dorsay, deserves its Michelin Star and is a worthy place for a splurge. Plenty of one of a kind shops on the side streets if shopping is a passion.
Great area. Just walk around, old streets, lot of restaurants, great place to walk and enjoy the spirit of Paris
Loved this little area.. Get off Blvd St. Germain des Pres and away from the expensive tourist cafe and find a little gem in the quarter. So much character.
Our favorite neighborhood. We stayed in this neighborhood, ate breakfast at different french bakeries, and enjoyed walking around all the cafes, bakeries, shopping and beautiful streets.

Best Shopping in Paris. Not too crowded, wonderful shops, great cafes, and the only Louis Vuitton without a line, wonderful if you actually want to buy something. If you really want to do some shopping, this is the place :)
Visit the Latin Quarter. The Latin Quarter was amazing. Nice to walk around the streets. Tons of restaurants, a lot of energy. It was even good to do with the kids.

Real Paris. You can walk around or sit on the terrace of one of the many cafés, you will feel, this is real Paris. The buildings with their iron balconies, the shops, the restaurants - all parisienne!
Love St. Germain. We stayed in this district for 6 days and just loved it. Great cafes and restaurants, the best shops, history, gardens...it has it all.
Charming area. We rented a flat in this area and fell in love with it. What a beautiful place to stay and visit. If you have the opportunity visit.

Even though lots of tourists, worth the visit for a day. One of the more renowned areas of Paris, it is a fun area with lots of brasseries, cafe's, shops etc., but it is very close to many of the top attractions.
Lovely but pricy!. A charming area, but very expensive generally, but preferable to Saint Michel which is just far too touristy!
Quaint & elegant. My favorite neighborhood has always been St. Germain!! And it still is! Everything you need or want is in this quaint & bustling neighborhood!!
Good for lunch. Nice surroundings for a lunch with family. A lot of options for a good price. The access is easy from the Notre Dame also from the Odeon subway station.

Where our apartment was for a week. This area is wonderful is a centre point for exploration. Additionally, this area has a tremendous amount of historical and other types of attractions; it is also quite close to lists of the other major attractions or 5 - 15 Euro by taxi if you don't want to use the Metro. The range of shops, bars and restaurants is just fantastic.We will return and will definitely stay in this area again.

Enjoying Paris like a Parisian. When in Paris visit Cafe de Flore 172 boulevard saint germain. You will notice that all chairs face the street so that people can watch everyone that goes by. Unlike other cities, you can sit as long as you want and no one will encourage you to leave. If you go there on the right day you might run into designers Sonia Rykiel or Karl Lagerfeld.. What is really special is if you go there early for breakfast when the croissants have just come out of the oven, you listen to the singing birds and you watch Paris wake up.
Has this Parisian charm. It's great ,exiting,a lot of nice stores and restaurants.Great place to choose for an hotel.Has a lot of history.
typical parisian area. most cosy and cute area in paris! its typical parisian, full of small streets with nice restaurants and shops. my favorite area so far.
Saint-Germain-des-Pres is the perfect location for you hotel choice.. Every night we came home to our hotel on Rue de Buci we were greated by music and crowds enjoying the evening.

A cool area. One of our favorite areas in Paris. A walkers and shoppers and foodies paradise. Stop often for cafe au Lait et panne de chocolat, vin et fromage or just sit and watch the glorious street scene. Dogs frequent the cafes which is so French and wonderful. Its less highbrow than other areas, authentic and magical.
Parisian Chic?. It is another area I love for shopping... especially the AIGLE store! The area is full of different cool local stores to shop till you stop!

EXCELLENT LOCATION AND GREAT AREA TO STAY!. Loved this area. After doing a lot of research we decided this was the area for us. It is perfect for walking to many of the attractions as well as to all transportation. It was a lot cleaner and less graffiti than some of the other areas (but you cannot get away from the homeless). The Seine River was a short walk where you can catch the Batobus (water taxi) which we used a lot. Lots of cafés, patisseries, authentic french restaurants etc. It was fun to sit at the cafés and get an expresso or cappuccino and watch everyone walk by. Just a 5 minute walk to the Latin Quarter which was so much fun especially at night! . We loved walking around this area, it kind of felt like 5th Ave in New York.
Beautiful area to wander!. Great area to walk around to shop, eat or just enjoy the scenery. A lot of nice shops, both local shops and bigger chain stores. The cafes are wonderful.

A million things to do.. We stayed in the 6th arrondisement for one night only but wish it was more. Once you are done with iconic towers and arcs and churches, this area is a godsend. More restaurants then you could ever ask for. Shopping - some ultra-luxurious and some fun and affordable. A time to relax and unwind. Drink roses and people watch. Such a great area.

Sourire on Rue Galande. Tapas restaurant with great prices, delicious food and the best cocktails in the world! This restaurant fills early. We found this on a website 10 restaurants the Parisians won't tell you about. You won't be disappointed.

Great place for a neighborhood stroll. We were in or through this neighborhood often during a recent two week trip to Paris. Our main trip was built around a visit to the church by the same name, but the area was full of interesting restaurants and residential buildings. I'm sure it would make a great place to stay, since it's near many of the city's top attractions.

Great place, but pretty ful of tourists in July!. St Germaine area is a lovely part of Paris. Very cosmopolitan, great wee shops selling antiques and art, jewellery and clothes, shoes and books, and many many lovely cafes, bistros, patisseries.It is a much narrower-lanes part of Paris than many of the touristy areas, making it an easy place to be. Most enjoyable... Almost as good (but not quite) as the less touristy Marais area nearby!

We loved this area!. We fell in love with this area when we were in Paris and will definitely be staying here next time we are in the city! A very young and vibrant part of the city that is close to everything but also feel far enough away that you aren't swamped by too many tourists. Great restaurants, bars and shops!

Our Paris Quarter. We carefully selected our neighbourhood in Paris so that we would be close to many attractions, restaurants and shops. St Germain was perfect! Lively but not too noisy, classy and fun! We loved this area of Paris and would return! We loved finding the little shops and restaurants. Just what we thought Paris would be!

THE place to stay in Paris. In my opinion, the best place to stay in Paris...all the shops, cafes, patisseries . Centrally located to walk to Notre dame, Latin quarter, the seine. Metro stops to go to Versailles, and Montmartre and the Eiffel Tower
The place to stay in Paris. Saint Germaine Des Pres is a quarter of Paris made up of tiny streets brimming with restaurants and cafes. A great launching point for all Paris has to offer.
A great place. So full of unique shops and restaurants. A lovely place to stay and feel at ease in! Easy access to the City too

The Neighborhood in Paris. If you are near of Louvre or Notre Dame, don't forget visit this neighborhood, When I saw it I reminded the New York Soho , obviously this comparison is only to have a picture in mind because the place has particular things to do, see and eat that reflects the Parisian living.You can get there using metro too, the closest station is Saint Germain des Pres

A very beautiful neighborhood. Saint-Germain-des-Prés is an area of the 6th arrondissement of Paris, home to a number of famous cafés, such as Les Deux Magots and Café de Flore, and also has the Abbey of Saint-Germain-des-Prés. It worths a visit.

A must see area of Paree. Cafe Les deux Magots and Cafe de Flore are both across from the Place St Germaine Des Pres . There is plenty of History and excitement in these two Cafes and the occasional musical entertainment in the Place on the corner Luxury shopping,boutiques and a left bank feel , make this a must go to area when in Paris . Quality Champagne can be had by the glass, and served as if you had ordered a bottle .
A lot to offer and more. You can see a lot of tourists flocking here. There are some streets to avoid (cheap shops and too many people}. But there are beautiful moments here too.
all you need is in here. No matter you want shopping, food, culture, heritage, church or just one cup of coffee, you can find it here.

Expensive. Lovely area, usual array of cafes, bars, not a great many "touristy " things to do. Cafes expensive, posh. The famous Les Deux Maggots and Cafe Flore are here, not amazing as you would wish for. Cheaper cafes are eadily found, that have great coffee and meals. The Musee De Orsay is in this area, which is wonderful, dont miss this.

Still a must see - Brunch at Les Deux Magots. I was in Paris with my teenager daughter, one of her few requests were to visit a store located at St. German-des-Pres. Since we were there, we decided to have brunch at Les Deux Magots. We both asked for Croque - Madame, mine with Capuccino and she asked for a lemonade. We loved it and the chance to sit outside and enjoy the busy area was great. One of the favorite places of well known French poets and artists!
Walk down all the Alleys. Every street is awesome in this area. this is why we picked it to stay in. Every alley is packed with patios to sit and eat, drink, and just people watch.

Bohimium and Classy all at once. Food drink nightlife and homes mix well in this area a short walk to sheakspear and co the classic bookshore hostle still there after many year Not a bad place for your hotel with easy access to the rest of Paris

History, religion, luxury and Parisian way of life. The avenue where intelectuals like Jean-Paul Sartre and Simone de Beauvoir use to attend the restautaurants like Cafè de Flore, the St.Germain church, and luxury stores, a mix of what you may call Parisian way of life.
Great area to stay. Love staying in this quarter. It's handy to everything and has superb access to restaurants and the Iles.

"A highlight of Paris!". This is one of the most charming places you will ever have the delight of visiting! If you are lucky enough to find yourself walking down Boulevard Saint-Germain, or rue de Cherche Midi (one of my favorites), make sure to stop at Poilaine for a tartine (a delicious open face sandwich made on this "oldest bakery in Paris' bread"). Simply divine!

A fun stroll!. This is such a great neighborhood to walk around in, explore the unique shops and boutiques, and grab a bite to eat. There is a very artsy and trendy flair in this area. Great fun to just amble and explore!
Couldn't have asked for better. Wonderful district with lots of locals !... great eateries, parks, shopping, transit and the safe feeling of being in a real neighborhood.
The BEST place to stay!. We love this neighborhood...amazing food (restaurants and patisseries galore), fabulous shopping (boutiques anyone?) and close to many sites.
Best part of Paris. Best part of Paris to walk around and hit the cafe's. Les Deux Magots is the signature cafe, so yo have to hit that
Stroll. Perfect area for shoppings, lively night spots, bars and restaurants. Grab a table at one of the many outdoor cafes for some people watching while sipping a glass of wine or coffee .

Very French, very much Paris. Very Ooh La La French, very good food bistros, artist quarters, shops and fine restaurants here. Try Snails in Garlic, the French Onion Soup, the wonderful wines and art galleries and stop for some unique and quaint shopping. Reflect on all the Rock and Pop stars, Kings, Queens and Artists like Picasso, Lautrec and others who have passed this way. More French than other quarters.

Upbeat street. This is a very energetic part of Paris. Great for food places and all kinds of shopping from high-end to high-street. It's a place to get lost in the streets and see what you will find.

Lovely as always. This is possibly my favorite part of Paris after more than 30 years of travel to Europe. It is a vibrant area filled with outstanding restaurants, shops, and patisseries. The cathedral is gorgeous. And of course, one cannot miss Les Deux Magots! The only downsides are that St. Germain des Pres can be very crowded and the stores are closed on Sundays. Otherwise, it is a real gem!

Lost Generation found. Paris heart for almost everything that is good, here you will find lots of history, fun, art, shopping, the best people watching at walking distance in any direction. Of special note anything related to the lost generation period. Hemingway, Scott Fitzgeral, Gertrue Stein. Worth visiting Jardin de luxembourg and at the end La Closerie des Lilas restaurant, excellent piano Bar and Brasserie

great place to stay. we hired a 16th century apartment apparently part of the musketeer stables if the stories are true! being my second time to Paris an that we had 7 days to explore this was the perfect base to do so. we grabbed dinner (wine and cheese!) from le Bon Marche most nights and our location was within 2 minutes to both the 10 & 12 metro lines meaning we could head anywhere in the city. the shopping is fantastic and all within one big block. if you want to experience Parisian life this is a great place to do

Great cafes. Although it is quite touristic, it is nevertheless a very charming area of the city, and if you're a fan of literature and art, you would be happy to know that some of the most prominent artists and writers would frequent such cafes as Les Deux Magots or Cafe de Flore. Cool experience.

Paris at its best. After doing the obligatory tourist sights which are worth the costs and waits (at least once) cross one of the many beautiful bridges over the Seine and find your way to Blvd. St, Germain on the left bank. The 6th arr. is by far the nicest part of the left bank or Rive Guache. Take a quick look at the 5th arr. around Blvd. St. Michel, but quickly leave its tackiness for the 6th. See the famous church of St. Germain du Pres and the warrens of neat side streets all around. Pass some time at a cafe, window shop or buy fresh things at the street markets. No spectacular sites.....just a relaxing and charming part of Paris, not likely to be duplicated anywhere else.

Lovely area. We spent some time here, ambling around the shops - found a lovely bookshop but don't remember the name! We did find City Pharma though - what a crush! We did get some skincare bargains though so worth it!! We loved sitting with our lunch people watching too!!! There are some lovely churches in this area - and we enjoyed watching a choral rehearsal for a while in one of them!
Great people watching. Hang out and sit in a cafe and watch people go by. No one seems to be in a hurry here. Beautiful neighborhood to stay or visit.

Beautiful old Paris. This is how I imagined Paris to be outside the usual tourist spots. Beautiful old buildings, churches, street café's, friendly locals etc. Easy to get lost, not in time, just lost!!
Truly French. This district is located in a truly French surrounding with locals. Lots of small boutique, and lots of café.

My favorite Arrondisement in Paris. As a student in Paris in my early twenties, I lived across from the Roland Garros Tennis Club in suburban Boulogne. Very beautiful and peaceful, but didn't seem like I was in Paris.Moved to the lively Rue Mouffetard neighborhood, where Hemingway had lived. Finally moved to the St Germain area, by my university, and that's the neighborhood I always go back to. Bld St Germain has the classy cafes: (Les Deux Maggots-JP Sartre's favorite, Flore, and Brasserie Lipp),less formal unique cafes, like La Palette, and its surrounding art galleries It has good mid-range hotels (Monroe, de Buci., and less expensive deSeine).and great mid-range restaurants (Le Comptoir de Relais, L'Avant Comptoir, Balzar, and Boillon Racine So for these reasons, I love the St Germain area the most

Love this area. As a great fan of Ralph Lauren, I had to visit the Ralph Lauren store and have lunch in the beautiful restaurant. The Saint-Germain area is an elegant area with great shopping a restaurants. We also visited the Bon Marche which is beyond any shopping experience.
The only place to be. This was our first time on the Left Bank and we think that it was fantastic as a location. Walked to most places but the Metro was easy to use for the rest.

Saint Germain des Pres is Like Greenwich Village. This area is our favorite quartre in Paris and we often stay there.. The main reason is it reminds us of when we lived in New York City's Greenwich Village. One after the other cafes, restaurants, clothing shops, bars, shoe stores all jambed with young people having fun. We. had NYU in NY with about 25,000 students and they were everywhere, this quartre has the Sorbonne with an equal level of young people per square meter. SGMdP is a happy, young place to live or visit.

Simply Fun. You could walk around this neighborhood for months/yrs and see new things every time you return. Boutiques, shops, restaurants, bars, etc. There are a lot of students in the area and tourists.

Close to everything!. This relatively quiet, blue collar neighborhood is close to Notredame, the Louvre, Musee Orsay, Saint Chappelle and Conciergerie. There are Monoprixes closeby and Cafes and Pattiseries abound. Perfect spot as a homebase during your vacation.

Charming Neighborhood in the center of the city. From small winding streets to broad handsome boulevards, this neighborhood has a feeling and appeal all its own. Loads of great restaurants and interesting local shops

Paris St Germain - the heart of the city?. My favourite area within the inner Arr. of Paris. Older narrower streets containing some of the original medievil roads and frontages sit alongside modern boulevards of commercial and residential buildings.This area has more old Churches (including St Germain itself) than you can manage and is especially atmospheric when these are lit at night. Square after square of traditional French cafes and small specialist retailers make this feel like rural France in the heart of Paris. If I visit Paris I must visit this thriving heart of the city.

Cool place for an evening stroll.... Narrow streets conceal nice surprises. The Guillotine no longer has its trademark device -- so sad. But the food is pretty good, and for Americans, this place holds the kind of touristy charm you might find in the back streets of the Bronx.

Great shopping area. This area is great for wandering around to see many small boutiques and shops off side streets. Also many eating places to enjoy that are less expensive than in the other major tourist areas.
Full of life. Lots going on. Very lively area and spoilt for choice with restaurants and cafes. You could spend all day just walking around this area alone.
Good food, lively quarter. Do not miss the churches as Saint Severin and Boulevard Saint Mitchell, after a nice walk here cross to Notre Dame.
The best part of Paris!. My favorite part of Paris! If you are a literary buff, this is the place to hang out. Go find the ghosts of Hemingway, Stein, Fitzgerald and Kerouac.
Touring. Shops restaurant and cafes are great. You can buy anything eat anything and shop for almost everything in this area. Love section and would spend time walking area.
This is Paris. No trip to Paris is complete without a drink and a meal in a small café here. And there are plenty to choose from

Awesome old Paris. Stayed here a few nights and loved the area. Easy walk to Notre Dame and of course the Seine is right there. Cafes, bookstores, boutiques..easy to navigate. FYI take the Batobus boat down the Seine which stops at all the tourists spots for $16E for the day.
My favorite neighbourhood. Our daily walk...breakfast...beautiful shops and galleries. We enjoyed getting lost and deliciously distracted.
Within walking distance of the Seine.. This area is a lovely part of Paris. Great shops, cafes and churches. We have stayed there many times and will return.

Nice Place!. Real Paris in there.
small but nice restaurant are there.
Not famous for the travlers. so relatively less crowded.

Our favourite part of the city!. This is a very old part with lots of ambiance, with its small streets, restaurants and so close to everything. A few tourist shops selling tat but you can easily just walk by!! We are regular visitors to Paris and now prefer to rent an apartment instead of using hotels and this is the area we always choose. In the evenings buskers set up in the street, we have seen dancing, acrobatics, steel drum bands, accordions as well as some really good singers. Likewise the steps of opera garnier is perfect to sit and listen to the street entertainers

Saint-Germain-des-Prés Quarter. The famous oldest church in Paris church gave its name to Quarter of Saint-Germain-des-Prés, a lively area in the sixth district which gained its reputation as a literary district in the twentieth century. Check out the famous 'Café de Flore' and the 'Les Deux Magots' cafes where Ernest Hemingway and other famous writers and philosophers gathered.

Left bank - right in the heart of Paris. This area is right in the heart of cafes , bars and restaurants as well as being only 10 minutes away from most of the major attractions, Louvre, Tuileries, Notre Dame , Palais .Garnier, Pont Neuf and many others . Makes you feel apart of Parisian life.

Want to stay here next time. We were at the Louvre and walked over here to eat at Brasserie Lipp (reviewed separately). After lunch at Lipp, we walked through various streets of Saint-Germain-des-Pres to get to Notre Dame. A lot of walking, but very enjoyable. We saw the cutest narrow streets with so many different shops, bakeries, cafes, etc. I would like to stay in this area of town next time we come to Paris. It has such a true French feel.
Really nice area. Just took a walking tour around here, it was nice. I wish I had stayed longer in Paris to really explore the city more.

The nicest quarter for me. Many bistros, many bookstores, many shops..and above all Shakespeare and Company, and a most lovely shop, the Pays de Poche, but it is already in the 5th arr., a shop where you find rings made of spoons or forks etc
Paris at it's best. We loved staying in Saint-Germain area. Tons to see, easy to walk around and experience Paris. Lots of little shops, restaurant and people watching. A true joy.
Nothing like Saint Germain des Pres. Near all beautiful brasseries and restaurants. Nice to walk on the streets. Full of all Paris charming details. Wonderful shopping places.

Fabulous Location!. We stayed in the Saint-Germain-des-Pres area (right off Rue de Bac) on our recent 10-day trip to Paris and were amazed at how beautiful and convenient this location was! Many of the major attractions were less than a 10-minute walk from our hotel, including the Musee d'Orsay, the Louvre, Notre Dame, etc. We strolled along the Seine after dinner every evening and felt safe on the short walk back to our hotel at any hour. There are tons of great cafes and chocolate shops on every block, including Cafe Flore and Le Deux Magots. There was also fabulous shopping (clothing shoes, handbags, tons of children's stores) all along Rue de Bac and its side streets. Louis Vuitton even has a boutique right near Cafe Flore. Great metro access, too!
Stayed here. Lovely to walk around and sample the fantastic local restaurants. Thought we would explore but just stayed around this area as so clean and safe!

Great for strolling. One of my favorite areas in Paris. After you have done the obligatory main attractions, immerse yourself in the wonderful neighborhoods on the left bank. The old St. Germain des Pres church stands as a fragment of old Paris along boulevard St. Germain. In fact, you can transect the left bank by starting any where to the west, Eiffel tower or the Invalides area and then stroll along the boulevard St. Germain to visit the university district then down St. Jacques to the Pantheon or maybe Luxembourg Gardens and then make your way over to rue Mouffetard. This is a great restaurant and shopping pedestrian-friendly neighborhood and a great way to end your day visiting the left bank. Remember, stroll as much as possible and when you are tired at the end of the day, take the subway home. (in this case, place monge station near rue Mouffetard.)

Get lost!. So many tiny streets with so much to discover. Spend time wandering and you will feel the Paris of 50, 100 and 200 years ago. Notice the plaques on the sides of buildings, many will grab at your heart strings.

So Many Places to Eat on the Cheap. This is the place to buy a three-course meal for under 12 Euros. The street are lined with cafes with the managers trying to entice you to join them for a meal. I've eaten at several different places and all of them were good.

Fantastic Place to Stay in Paris!. Since this was our first trip to Paris and the trip was broken up by visits to other places, we stayed in three different arrondissements.
