I felt like an extra in Woody Allen's Midnight in Paris.Like the movie, I've always felt that the magic must have been amazing in the 20's.So on each trip, I wander the streets looking for where Satre and Camus had their coffees, where Hemingway ate but unfortunately I probably found more in the movie than wandering the streets.We sat in a street side cafe and asked what they could offer Lynn that was gluten and dairy free and his response was blunt "this is Paris" and moved us on.Reviewers have commented on attiude at Le Chateaubriand, I would disagree - walk the street here and you'll find it in abundance.But despite all that, I still love it - I will keep looking even though it has obviously changed and it is a far more modern city than we dream about - the truth is that Paris is special and Saint-Germain is part of that.
on the path of Sartre. nice, lively area, many nice restaurants great atmosphere

Shopping and cafes, but avoid the demonstrations. Loved the cafes on every corner, and the shopping on perpendicular streets rue de Sevres, rue de Rennes, and rue de Bac. The demonstrations with police and megaphones was not pleasant for us, but I am sure their reasons were just.

A Great Walk. Sit at one of the cafes and people watch. Visit Eglise St. Germain. Look at the shops on the side streets. Go to Buci Market. Visit Paul(Buci Market) or Gerard Mulot (rue de Seine on the other side of St. Germain) for great breads and pastry.

Surprising place. The first time I went there, I was not impressed, but then I came back by night and I would like to recommend a cabaret: "Les trois maillets", a little bit expensive but it's worth to pay a visit.
rive gauche. amazing place,a ,ot of bars and restaurants,beautiful people!! sit at cafe de flore and ask a hot chocolate,in a silver cup! tres chic!!!
This is my favorite area in Paris. Shopping, food, cafes, fine dining, casual dining, hair salon, hotels, rue buci, Hotel Louisianne.

Don't forget the church!. This church is the oldest in Paris (part of it) and has concerts and services inside. Many times there are impromptu musical groups playing outside the church. We enjoyed a jazz group in January.
Hemingway's Stomping Grounds. Just a great area to hang out and chill, the Latin Quarter, Sorbonne University, Cafe Du Flore. Just a great place!

Informative Docents. My husband and I recently stopped here and got a first-rate history lesson from one of the docents. He had a great love for his church , it's history and architecture. It gave our visit more meaning and we left with a deeper understanding of French history and Catholic art.

Steve and Keith. A MUST find is the Rue Gregtoire de Tours near the odeon metro station.
Fantastic restaurants at great prices!
wear comfortable shoes. so much to do, so much to see, and it's all here. you can literally leave in the morning, walk down one side of the street till lunch- eat- and then shop your way back.
A walk down memory lane. Enjoyed seeing Cafe Flore, Les Deux Magots etc looking the same as in my student days.
Cozy!. The walking street are really nice and enjoyable, well recomended.

A smaller Notre Dame. In an older part of Paris, surrounded by cafes (like everywhere else in the city), and high end stores (Gucci, Prada, etc). No line ups here, but the church has fallen into a state of disrepair. They are renovating what they can with the money they have, but it will be a long time before it is what it was. Very dark inside, darkly stained stonework and little lighting. Free entry, although may have a number of beggars sitting on the entry steps.
Beautiful. Great place to walk, and for shopping. A lot of restaurants and cafes. Best place to stay
awesome!. the best area to stay in Paris; so stylish and cool. many things to do and see in the area
Wish I could live there. Charming. Just walk among the streets. You'll feel great. Many stores, restaurants, cafes, very Parisian.
Lots to do -great people watching. Best little cafes in Paris - plus bars like The Great Canadian that shows American Football live on Sunday nights. Excellent shopping and a real neighborhood feel

A simply wonderful, accessible neighbourhood. A really vibrant, authentic part of Paris. And so near to lots of attractions - Notre Dame, Louvre, Tuileries, l'Orangerie. Just such a delight to stay, walk, eat, and shop in this area. Try breakfast at Paul on rue de Buci, the crepes and coffee offer at Moliere opposite. Fabulous soaps and other toiletries at the most wonderful perfume shop, Lothautique, just around the corner on rue de Seine.
Love this area!. We spent lots of time roaming the streets, checking out the cafes. Love this area!
The cool 6eme. A great way to spend the afternoon, wander around the cool boutiques and watch the fashionable people go by. Tip: Pierre Herme is on rue Bonaparte!
nice place to walk around. a great place to walk around the ellegant parisian streets

My favourite neighborhood in Paris. I love this neighborhood. Mny people dismiss it as too touristy, but I know people that live in Paris and its there favourite place too. You can't dismiss places because they attract tourists, not if the quality of the local shops and restaurants etc are good. It's full of cafes, restaurants, quaint little shops, bookshops, bakeries, silver shops, little hotels, flower stalls. It's a great place to base yourself from because it really is very central. Look up places to eat at on trip advisor and hotels to stay at, read the reviews and you'll soon know if you want tot try it. I walked through this neighborhood on my own day and nit and always felt safe. The area has alot of history and poets, writers, muscians from centuries gone by used to hang out here, live here, write here.....it's full of wonder in so many ways.
we love this place. All of Paris is great. we love this site and always go there when we need refreshing
Unique experience. Beautiful building... If you like history...this is a must see in Paris.
open on sundays. cute shops and great restaurants open on sundays...great place to go after visiting notre dame. paris is tough on sundays with so much closed

Join the tourist crowd. You used to be able to sit down here and have a chat with your neighbors over a glass of Rouge, or ogle the pretty girls while some aspiring author scribbled away in his corner. You now jostle for space with the japanese, italian, german and russian crowd, the waiters are foreign students on Erasmus and the atmosphere has gone together with the low prices. There are many far more Parisian places to go to...
Worth a visit. A good area to explore and plenty of eatig places to choose from but most places are very expensive.

The best of old world Paris!. What a beautiful area. This is where the romance of Paris is at its best, full of cafes, cobblestone streets, beautiful views and holiday markets.We stopped here for steak tartare and wine, at the famous Le Deux Magots. Perfect for a bite and a view!
An excellent spot for people watching. A very typical Paris spot which is close to The Seine and other great spots. Nice atmosphere.
Wander the streets for hours. Cafes, bistros, shops and Parisian culture. Pick a street and wander...
Stopped at the Louie Vuitton store. This was a must stop for me!! We walked from Notre Dame Cathedral to Musee Rodin along Saint-Germain-des-Pres.

A monument to the history. Quite interesting, but is not in the same conditions as other monuments of Paris. It seems that after more than a thousand years is still under construction. It is still untouched by lighting technology and others. Good for those looking to escape from Disneyland ...
Such a beautiful area!. Take your time - walk and see all the beautiful buildings and shops. Take a break and have some champagne at Le Dux Magot!!
Less Touristy and More Authentic. Wander over to the Rive Gauche and enjoy a more authentic Paris experience. Fewer cameras and awkward tourists and a exhilarating Parisian vibe. Not to be missed!
One of the most beatiful areas to see in Paris. The architecture and the cafe shops makes you to stick around. Very neat place.

trendy shops. I liked the upscale shops without the pomp of Champs Elysee.I loved the activity,and the neighborhood feels safe.Great sales this time of year(Jan.)Next time I'll stay there as well,as a local even recommended this neighborhood.
Lovely area to wander. Beautiful street markets and fascinating shops make this a delightful place to spend an afternoon/evening. Highly recommended.
Anther wonderful Neighborhood. This is a beautiful neighborhood with many historic cafes. The church draws lots of attention because of Dan Brown's book but it is well worth seeing on its own merit.

Beautiful Parisian suburb for a nice stroll. what a beautiful Parisian neighborhood. We combined a stroll down its tree lined streets with a visit to Musee Orsay and a trip to the beautiful Luxemborg Gardens.

Old and historic. The church is old and should be seen, but not the most impressive in a city filled with impressive churches. The Saint Germain des Pres neighborhood is lively with cafes, restaurants, shopping, and people watching available everywhere.
Books and Chics. Go, buy books, look for Woody (he might really be there somewhere) and try to drag a girl, that's what St. Germain is made for youre a tourist in love with paris

Saint-Germain-de-Prés. Around the oldest church in Paris there is the most beautiful tradition of litterary Paris. Hemingway used to have a drink at Deux-Magots and Sartre in café Flore. Good book-store, La Hune, open till midnigth
great area. Loved walking in this area for good shops, restaurants and make sure you see the epicurean center at Bon Marche.

Cozy, Walk and get lost ..then tuck into a very old restaurant. Great neighborhood - one of our favorites. We love to wander around finding a restaurant based on what most appeals to us at that moment (a good crowd is a good indicator). Just go...explore and find what is special ...you will surely find something that inspires or speaks to your heart. Very special and yet hard to put my finger on exactly what makes it so great. It is a combination of many ingredients with the best one being you! Explore....
Best place. Always stayed in Sait Germain. Walking distance to all Paris sights. Clean and heaps of good restuarants.

Great memories and convenient area. I had a sensational time staying in this area. Le Madison was just fantastic! The area is just lovely and has loads of character. It was lovely to sit out the front of Le Deux Magot's and watch people go by while sipping Bollinger. Watching the locals park was very interesting - we have nicknamed it "Le Bump" as cars bounce in between the others to get into the smallest of spaces! Highly recommend!
Still stylish. The Marais may be more edgy, but St-Germain-des-Pres does not disappoint with its high fashion shops and friendly eateries.

The neighborhood I would want to live in if I lived in Paris. What a lovely place, great little shops, pastry places, restaurants.... very quaint and what I expected Paris to look like. I am sure I can't afford to live there but a girl can dream, can't she?
Beautiful area. Every idea you ever had of Paris comes to life in Saint Germain. Great cafes, safe area, and beautiful architecture.

Elegant!. Lovely area with lots of old style shops. Great patisserie and chocolate shops. All very stylish but with some comfortable coffee shops for a nice sit-down. Just stroll along and have a nice time.
Wonderful Neighbourhood. Love this area! Lots of charming cafes, bistros & little shops. Walked around the cobbled streets of old Paris and enjoy the Parisian charm of this neighbourhood!
The quitessential paris shopping. Get away from the major store and wander through this area of Paris for those little stores you will love

One of the world's most elegant neighborhoods. So elegant, a place where Hemingway, Sartre, Gertrude Stein, Picasso, Simone de Beauvoir and so many others hung out. Chic, elegant and expensive, but you can stroll and window-shop for free.
Great place to have a great time!. Great place to eat, to drink, to see people and beautful structure.

A Memorable Breakfast...Every Day. Usually a great morning in Paris (6e) starts with a baguette fresh off the boulangerie oven then heading back to your apartment to enjoy it with your breakfast coffee... unless you are nearby the Croissanterie on Saint Germain des Pres.No more baguette needed; just go there with a friend and enjoy the lumping of breakfast, with a fabulous expresso and people watching..I could not figure out exactly what makes their expresso so authentic, it has the right aroma and kick that you need in the morning. I tried the cafe expresso at the cafe des Deux Magots but although it is smack on the place St Germain des Pres but the strength and kick of the Croissanterie expressso was nowhere to be found. True the waiters at the Deux Magots are impeccably dressed. You do feel like you must wait on them instead of them on you.. The Croissanterie is more relaxed; so I went back there the next day and ordered my expresso and croissant and it just felt like breakfast heaven again.. I told the manager there that his coffee was better than the Deux Magots'.He blushed because comparing an institution such as the Deux Magots to the Croissanterie is a blasphemy by itself and telling the Croissanterie manager that he served a better expresso is just Parisian heaven to his ears..
Saint-Germain-des-Pres. Wonderful neighborhood - lots to see. Clean and safe. Great restaurants too!
St. Germain de Pres. Loved, loved this area. Great shopping and fantastic cafes. Plenty of people watching. Would definately return to this area to stay. Less crowded then by the Louve.
This is Paris!. Wonderful place to stroll, shop, drink rose at one of many cafes in a wonderful neighborhood. We will never stay on the right bank again.

Good to walk around but nothing really special. Pleasant place to walk and get some food. You can find really good deals: good food with reasonable price.Try also the small streets along the neighborhood, you can find good surprises.
wonderful. great place to stroll and look for places to eat and drink and find something marvelous.
Not the bohemia it was. But the ambience, c-est magnifique. Walk around the small streets at night and look into the galleries, lit from inside.
Beautiful and relaxing. The elegance of this area is what I liked best. It feels like the old Paris with pedistrian cobblestone streets lined with shops and cafes.

Great area to stay in or shop. We stayed here on our last 2 trips and highly recommend it. You have shops such as Dior around the corner from Laduree and close by is Ben & Jerry's. So you have quite an assortment to choose from. Great shops and cafes are all around and it just has a really cool vibe to it.
Wonderful area - also decent for clothes shopping!. This is a very Parisian neighborhood, yet easily walkable, and dotted with clothing stores that had surprisingly reasonable prices.

Excellent location. it felt like the heart of Paris with lovely restaurants and shops all around. We visited small museums in the area including
the Maillot which was having a special exhibit,
Lovely Cathedral on Blvd St. Germain. Beautiful, impressive construction. It was supposed to come down after a great Exposition but that never came about.

Fun, fun area. If you have read a book of fiction where the characters are meeting in the cafes in Paris, this is the neighborhood they have met. It is the area of Paris that is not fictionalized in novels, but written as life really is. A stupendous area of Paris where people sit in the outdoor cafes all year round and actually talk to the people they came with and those that show up. Not one cell phone on the table or waiting to be answered in someone's hand. Texting while dining with others is considered rude and unthinkable. I loved it!

High in historical value but not much to see. The Eglise Saint-Germain-des-Prés is the burial place of Merovingian kings and the only remainder of the Abbey of Saint-Germain-des-Prés. It is not a very impressive church in architectural terms, but the philosopher Rene Descartes and the Benedictine monk and scholar Jean Mabillon are buried there, so you might want to check it out if you are in the area. There is a seated statue of St. Peter inside, the foot of which has been rubbed to shine while the rest retains its bronze patina.
Height of sophistication. A great area to venture when looking for interesting art or home goods. This is a sophisticated neighborhood to explore.

A pretty and pleasant neighbourhood.. As other reviewers have said, this is a lovely neighbourhood. It's especially worth visiting if you want to see or experience the cafés famous for having been patronised by people like Sartre, Beauvoir, and Hemingway - see Les Deux Magots, or the Café de Flore.
Great for Low Key Eating Options. Very tranquil part of Paris, walking along the banks of the Seine, Notre Dame, over Paris bridges.

Nice Neighborhood. Been there done that, fine, not impressed, not unimpressed. I
'd go back or I wouldn't go back...depends on the rest of the day

Charming and Wonderful. My favorite place in Paris. You can walk from famous, old cafes to designer shops, to chocolatiers, to Shakespeare and Co., to Notre Dame all in about 5 minutes. Such a great atmosphere, especially at Christmas time with all of the decorations and window displays!
Great shopping and eating. Love this part of Paris! Lots of shopping, and great eating. Anything you could want is within a few blocks. I liked cruising it by bike.
Great for a stroll. We strolled along the avenue and visted the Chrsitmas market stalls as well as some of the churches located along the way. Many cafes looked inviting as we passed by.
Yummy. If you like to try different kitchens and wines; Saint-Germain is the true address
the heart of paris. this area is located in the heart of Paris. Great shops and the chic Bon Marche department store. And of course les deux Magots and Cafe Flore are very famous.
Movie Set. It is a wonderful place to walk, shop and eat. Some of the better retailers are found on the side streets.
Nice Area. A trendy piece of property. Good for sight seeing and lazing around. The area along the river has secondhand book kiosks etc

Great place to spend your time. The atmosphere was so much fun. The Cafés and the little shops kept us busy for hours. Before we knew it, the sun had set and we were looking for a place to sit for dinner. Too much fun!
wow,,restaurants. great day trip here. lots of small stores, food and ambiance. took a boat ride very close to here.
all you need. this area was one block from our hotel and we enjoyed walking around and eating in various cafes.

One of my favorite districts. It's bustling and cafe-filled and expensive. But I love Laduree on Rue Jacob, the Xmas markets in December (esp., vin chaud), and the beautiful art and clothing on offer on Rue Bonaparte heading towards the Ecole des Beaux Arts.
Great place. Great place to visit...buzzing with its quaint stores and wonderful cafes.

nice neighborhood (but not a must-see). In this neighborhood you'll find some famous brasseries like Lipp and La Flore. On the boulevard Saint-Germain you'll find fancy stores and restaurants (like Ralph's). All in all a nice neighborhood but not as memorable as some other places in Paris.

colourful and vibrant. Lots of things to do and see. Fantastic tiny restaurants in little alcoves and cobbled streets - insanely cheap, too. Must look at the church of St Germain. It's an old Knights Templar built after the crusades. Dates back to the 12th century. Dark and cold and very atmospheric.
lovely. very nice litlle Ancient toun ' we enjoid there very much
Nice. Hotel was nearby so I wandered here quite a bit. Lots of stores to buy things you need. Nice places to eat as well. Paris is awesome.
A great neighbourhood. Such a great night life in this arrondissement and you can never go wrong with sampling the many menus found at each step along the way
Another Church. Just Another Church in paris, under construction now for some issues, it's not a must in paris as there are more important points to visit in this city.

A lovely base to explore Paris. This area is full of interesting things to do and see all within walking distance. The Musee du Luxembourg where there are often excellent art exhibitions, the gardens themselves and churches and monuments abound.Lots of restaurants, bistros and bars, interesting and excellent small shops including lots of bookshops to satisfy the students of the Sorbonne.

Love this area with the small galleries, antique shops and small boutiques. This area has an almost surreal atmosphere taken out of a movie. You easily feel time has stopped and old values still count I love to see the rare things at display in the shops and entering talking to the owners is a special experience in itself. The stories they can tell. I always end up here when I go to Paris.
Lovely neighborhood.. My friends and I rented an apt. in this arondissment. Cute shops. Great restaurants, bakeries and bars.

Oh La La. If you go nowhere else in Paris come to St Germaine. I walked across the street, downstairs to a supermarket, purchased a french roll filled and a small bottle of french wine, crossed back over to the train station side to the church grounds, sat on a park bench and listened to Jazz. Beside that it is walking distance or the 3 day bus pass can be used to get you to every place on your itinerary at your own pace
lovely neighborhood. definitely must-visit when you are in paris! superb shopping and original parisians lifestyle all in one area!
best shopping. the best shopping is in St Germain area, the guides underestimate it
great area. Lots to see and do around this area with numerous bars and bistro's to sit and enjoy Paris

Lovely and Quirky. Really nice to wander around and feel you are in the real Paris still heavily populated with tourists but retaining its Parisian Charm and away form the hustle and bustle of central Paris

St-Germain des Pres @ christmas. We loved walking along this boulevard especially once the sun went down and all the Christmas lights were on. There's a fabulous Christmas market too, beginning just across from Le Deux Magots cafe.
An excellent place to wakl. We rambled around on a sunny afternoon looking in shop windows and buying chocolate. Have lunch or dinner at Leon de Bruxelles. Nice!

Currently under extensive renovation. You can't see very much at the present time due to the on going renovations. The whole alter area of the church is blocked off and off limits. Personally, I wouldn't bother until the reservations are complete.
Great neighborhood. We stayed in a small hotel, the Atlantis, and loved the lively neighborhood, with lots of beautiful (expensive) shops and cafes. Especially loved the bakery a few streets away.

Extraordinary Cave,bar for degustations. St Germain des Pres is as remarkable as the reviews describe it-gardens,archetecture,restaurants,shops and little surprises like Ambassade de Bourgogne.A group of knowledgeable dedicated wine enthusiasts have opened a wine bar where you can sample,tipple or purchase a supply of Burgundy wines for later consumption.They serve small but exquisite plates of gougeres,jambon persile and cheese to accompany the outstanding wines available by the glass,bottle or in flights. We love it and drop in to 6 rue de L`Odeon several times during our annual visits to sample fine wines ordinarily out of my comfort zone.
The most beautiful place in Paris. Everything is nice at Saint Germain des Pres, the small stores , the restaurants, the bistros, the boulangeries, the people....

Nice quarters with plenty of boutiques and feel. In a way it's mostly luxury boutiques but I still think it's worth to walk around a bit even if you don't intend to do some shopping. Less tourists and a bit more mellow than other quarters. Go early during the day or in the evening.

the never dying charm of Saint germain des Pres. it doesn't matter how many times you've been to this neighborhood and how many tourists you have to endure, it is still the best symbol of the Paris that we all love with its famous overpriced cafés, fabulous pastry shops, great walks, and the feeling of sharing the love of this "quartier" with a lot of artists and writers of yesteryears...

The best area of Paris. The best area of Paris - it's not at all touristy, and is brimming with antique stores, art galleries and patisseries instead of tacky souvenir shops. It's clean and typically Parisian.

Meandering through St. Germain des Pres. St Germain is full of character and charm. Fascinating individual shops and galleries of character and style, especially in Rue Bonaparte and streets going north to the Seine. Very handy for Louvre, Musee d' Orsay and Luxemburg Gardens. Must give yourself time just to meander at will and sample the many delightful cafes and restaurants.

Beautiful place!. Like Quartier Latin, Saint Germain des Pres is a place you have to go and walk around. For a good meal and good coffee, go to "Les Deux Magots" and "Cafe de Flore" (I was there in 1995 with my wife)
still a great buzz. Hot chocolate at Cafe Flore: 8 euros but to die for!
Very nice area!. One of our favorites IN Paris, stroll around and enjoy the atmosphere!

Great atmosphere and great food. We could hardly choose from among the wonderful little restaurants and bistros in this charming district. But luckily we found La Jacobine near the rue St. Andre des Arts and indulged in authentic French specialties.

Our favorite are. Great cafes, boutiques, patisseries and chocolate shops. I love the passage way from Blvd St Germain and rue St Andre des Arts! Great olive oil shop and Un Dimanche a Paris has fantastic macarons. Blvd St Germain can be crowded but the side streets aren't. Tons of restaurants that we love...Marco Polo, Le Comptoir and more. Lots of great small hotels near the Odeon metro stop. This is our favorite area.

Fantastic area to shop and people watch!. Great arrondissement for a coffee, glass of wine and a bite to eat at a bistro. Great shopping in the area too. Try a brasserie named J'Go, great vibe and food.
The heart of an interesting neighborhood. Great streets for walking around; seeing people; looking at shops; restaurants.
Great area for shopping and strolling!!. Loved the Left Bank way more than the Right Bank area. Lovely shops, restaurants, markets, etc.
Great area!. Though it is difficult to find an area of Paris I do not like, this is an extremely beautiful area.
Oldest Church in Paris. Beutiful old church, but currently most of it is closed off due to retoration efforts.

Elegant and away from the hustle. The neighborhood is very elegant and more tranquil. There are many choices of restaurants and shops and, depending on its location, just across the bridges and will be in the main city sights.

Side streets are where to go. The side streets are the interesting part of this area; especially if you like popping into art galleries. There must be 1,000 galleries in the area. If you are not interested in art galleries, then I would knock the rating down a couple of notches.
Great walking.. We enjoy spending time walking the streets in the area. There is everything you need to enjoy the day.
Perfect for meandering. Wonderful narrow and ancient streets with interesting boutiques, great restaurants and ice cream. Lots of history recent and ancient.
Jammed. The place is just too popular so is jammed with people so we avoided it and went on the side streets.
Well Balanced. Close to the Latin Quarters, yet not too touristy.
Fantastic Area. Absolutely loved this area - amazing restaurants and fruit and flower stalls. Beautiful
Artistic. very artistic area (like the whole paris if its for that).....you can just walk throught the streets with nothing to see in mind, you'd still be amazed at all the things you encounter.
Great during day- and nighttime. Great for shopping at daytime, particularly along the boulevard Saint-Germain and sidestreets. And great for aperitif, dining, partying during nighttime.
Day and night.. To tour and sit with the locals. It is coverd with all types of resturants, coffee shops and crapiers. Pricess from cheap to most expansive. Have fun fell Paris.
Excellent area. We staying in this area. Exellent area to stay and explore
Saint Germaine -Paris as we know it. The food, the coffee, the atmosphere, the people, we just loved walking through here on our way into town or on our way home, if the feet weren't too tired!
This is Paris. Buzzy little area of Paris that is a must visit! Great people watching, good cafés and bars!
Nice district with nice cafes and shops. Nice and famous cafes around such as Cafe De Flore. Nice art galleries. Luxury shops. A decent, intellectual district in Paris. Worth a visit.

A wonderrful neighbourhood for your visit. Hundreds of shops, cafes, restaurants! Get a taxi at a taxi stand when you are tired and return to your hotel for around €8! Taxis were inexpensive - generally for the price of two teas at a cafe we could come and go with ease. Good for a few days to a week of wandering around and close to most attractions.

Get lost there!. I liked (of course!) the cafes and bistro, I like the beautiful small streets that lead you to another beautiful small streets, I liked the small shops with cloths "Paris style" and I liked that in every corner you can find o good coffe and a delicious croissant.
Something for everyone. This visit to Paris was the first time we had stayed in the District and found it enchanting. Lots of shopping,antique stores and excellent places to eat.

Good Place to eat. Paris is a little bit expensive but in this area you can find a couples of alleys the call Latin Quarter, you can eat excellent food for a good price. 10-15 euros for starter, main course and dessert. Very good

A must-see. What a great neighbourhood. The shops, the cafes, the restaurants, the Parisians. It's the experience you would expect to receive walking about Paris on a rainy day. Too much focus in Paris is focused on the other side of the Seine. This is where the Parisians hang-out, and it's a wonderful area for a stroll or to shop.

Great neighborhood. Nice location to stay in and walk around in. Cute shops and if you like walking, you can see even more while walking to the Seine, Notre Dame, Eiffel Tower, Jardins du Luxembourg...
Great area and the restaurant "fish" was great. Great area and excellent food at " fish la boissonnerie". We also enjoyed seeing the oldest church in Paris here.

A wonderful district-easy to get too. Paris past and present. This area is close to the Musee d'orsay and has wondeful boutiques and artistry shops-both modern and ancient. A nother side of this amazing city.

Great location for curio shops and Parisian finds. The whole stretch of St germain de pres comprises of many stores that sell leather products, branded and non branded ones. Many interesting stores for souvenirs and many cafes to choose from to get your fix of croque Madame , coffee and crepes as well

Ooh la la. From buying macarons to marveling at $500 lavender leather gloves, every beautiful product in the World seems to be on Saint Germain des Pres and adjoining streets. Have lunch and spend three hours walking the streets in this area for a must-see Parisian experience.

One of the nicest neighborhoods on the Left Bank. When visiting the Left Bank, there are 2 neighborhoods I find myself gravitating to: Rue Cler and Saint-Germain-des-Pres. If you enjoy discovering small boutique shops, this is the neighborhood to explore.
Atmosphere. I loved the atmosphere of the whole area and the small shops and cafes

Looking for Steak Frites. We walked the streets of this Paris classic neigborhood searching for Le Relais de L'Entrecote - an all-steak-frites restaurant that Mary recomended. Dinner was excellent and we didn't even have to wait for a table since we arrived before 8:00pm! After which we walked back to the Latin Quarter to take in some jazz.
Favorite street. Cares ,Bars ,shopping , hotels you could keep walking forever and never tire of this street.
Wonderful Neighborhood to get lost in. Just wander in. Put the map away, get lost, and see the best of Paris. Sanit Sulpice was amazing as was a 2 hour break on a corner cafe.
history with charm. You don't have to do anything ,just walk around go to 2 museums ,have lunch at any place but with charm at place du marché de sainte catherine
Nice atmosphere. Great to walk around here to shop for souvenirs and having some drinks and snacks. We did end up having dinner in pne of the cafe and it was a beautiful meal. Very parisian.
Bohemian Paris. Where the Artists hung out ... still full of charm--do stroll and EnJoY!
the most exciting place to be in Paris. this was my favourite area of Paris and we spent a lot of time here and loved the diversity
Lively area. Have visited this area before and been a little disappointed but this time there was a much better atmosphere

Bookshops for everyone. Why on this earth haven´t I been here before? A pity, shame or just because Paris is more than just one visit! Saint-Germain-des-Pres have bookshops for the everyone. Must amusing. We went to Eyrolles and bought cookbooks for French macarons - and catbooks. You have to notice this - they have dogs in Paris - but the cat IS Paris.Eyrolles is in Boulevard St-Germain - but there is a bookstore on every corner. Almost for everyone - fantasy, history, English literature, poems, science - everything.

Expensive coffee but perfect place to people watch. Lovely area to walk around and absorb the Parisian atmosphere. We had coffee sitting outside in Les Deux Magots. Probably the most expensive coffees we've ever bought but it was lovely just sitting there watching the world go by. The coffee is served in a jug so you do get more than a cups worth at least.

Perfect for a sunday walk. Had a two our walk around in Sant-Germain-des-Pres and in the Latin quarters. Small streets, many restaurants and of course lots og book stores. Very cosy and quiet on a Sunday.

Lots of restaurants. We stumbled into this neighborhood on a stroll leaving Luxembourg Gardens. It was about dinner time and let me tell you, this is where you want to be if you're hungry. For the most part, there is no shortage of restaurants and cafes in Paris, but there is an intense concentration of them in the St Germain area. And because outdoor seating is the norm for most places, it's very lively here throughout the evening. We picked a restaurant, had a great, relaxing meal, then continued our walk. There is a lot to see and do in this amiable neighborhood besides eat, so I would put this on your list for a way to spend a nice afternoon or evening.

Great restaurants, shopping & location. We stayed at the Holiday Inn Paris-Notre Dame, which is in the same area as the St. Germain des pres neighborhood. Great neighborhood, lots of shopping and many many restaurants. Overall, a safe, bustling area of Paris to visit and walk around. Great location to stay in if you are looking for a hotel. Its centrally located for tourists.

A really pleasant area in which to stroll. We came upon the area after a recommendation for the restaurant " Allard ", (see separate review ) in the evening. It was a really nice buzzing area in which to stroll on a summers evening before our meal.We liked it so much that we explored further later on in our trip, taking in the main street with the very expensive shops, we sat outside at one of the numerous cafes watching the world go by. It appeared at times as though we had stumbled on a model assignment as most of the women and some men paraded around as though on a catwalk.If we were to return to Paris, this would be the district I would look to stay in.

My Favorite Neighborhood in Paris!. What can I say? This neighborhood is uniquely charming! The oldest church in Paris - St-Germain-des-Prés is located here. St-Germain is the center for intellectual book stores which attracted the likes of T.S. Eliot, Scott Fitzgerald and Ernest Hemingway.I highly recommend walking on rue Bonaparte you will eventually see the Ecole des Beaux Arts on your left. This is the historic School of Fine Arts in Paris through which many of the great names in art history passed before anyone knew them.Lots of bistros, coffee shops and charming boutique also make up a big part of this vibrant neighborhood.

My favorite area of Paris. We stayed near the Eiffel Tower during my first trip to Paris. I loved the city so much that I'm already planning my next trip for next summer. I'll be staying in the Saint-Germain district. The first time I came to Paris with my mother, and found the area near the Eiffel Tower to be swamped with illegal and very aggressive panhandlers and street sellers, especially at night. Their aggressiveness made us uncomfortable walking alone in the evening. Instead, we took the Metro (right next to our hotel) to the St. Germain or Latin Quartier districts. The food, culture, sights, and people-watching can not be beat in these areas, and we felt safe walking alone. There are several bistros and cafes on each block, each with food more amazing than the last. It's also central to everything. I highly recommend spending free time in this area - you won't regret it!

What can be said that hasn't been mentioned yet?. This is a great area of Paris for it architecture, food venues, shopping, boutiques, galleries and historical sites. It is wonderful to wander the area to take in the sights and sounds. The Church of St Germaine des Pres survived the Revolution in 1789 and is the oldest church in Paris. Home to three famous brasseries (Cafe de Flore, Les Deux Magots and the Brasserie Lipp) and epicenter for 19th Century writers, artists and philosophers, this area of Paris deserves several hours, if not days, to fully appreciate all it has to offer.

My favourite church in Paris & Fabulous area!!!. The church here is simple yet beautiful- not grand stone like it's cousin Notre Dame down the road, but wooden & colourful & you can imagine how it would have been 5 centuries ago... It's accessible. The area surrounding it is a splendour for bars & brasseries (think 1920's Paris writers scene) and the shopping (especially clothes) is fab too... We love this area so much that we bought a holiday apartment in it!!! Read the novel "Lady & The Unicorn" by Chevalier before visiting the Musee de Moyen Age & Eglise de St Germain-des-Pres.

Check it out if you are nearby. This church was very interesting and very beautiful. If you are in the neighborhood, you should definitely visit its namesake church. We also visited Notre Dame and St. Sulpice, so we know what the big ones look like. It is nice to see a different kind of history, and St Germain has plenty of it. Swing by, check it out, a drop a few Euro in the box to say thanks!

Disappointing visit after reading about it in guide books. We read about this in the guidebook and walked over to it. It is in a nice area of high end shopping and cool boutiques. It looked nice in the distance as we approached it but once we walked up to it, we were less then impressed. It had buskers outside, people begging on the doorstep and once inside, it was dark and dingy. I know the history of the church is great so if you are into history, go for it. But as a walking visit with the family in tow, I wouldn't recommend you go out of your way.
underrated great visit. This church is certainly worth visiting, the area is nice, no lines, outstanding fountain outside.

Fun area, though touristy. This is a very fun area to experience while in Paris. It's right along the River Seine, so very easy to find. It is a great place to stop at a cafe and people watch. This active area is very close to the beautiful Luxembourg gardens. A favorite activity of mine is to grab a lunch from a bakery in St. Germain and walk up to the gardens and take it all in. It's a wonderful way to spend an afternoon. The Amorino gelato stands in this area are also a must try!

the area of. I enjoyed the area of st. germain du pres. Stay in this area if you can. Late at night there are still people gathered at cafes. It seems...active and it was rather clean. I wasnt scared walking the streets at night, plus the location is great, not that far from the good museums, the eiffel tower, invalides, or the notre dame cathedral.
